description:
Dinosaurs sandwiches are the best in the world! For me as a construction company owner that has no time for lunch most of the days it has been a lifesaving experience, my system with these guys is calling 10 minutes ahead and my sandwich is ready, the best items on menu are grilled pork sandwich and fresh rolls with shrimp with a fabulous peanut butter dipping sauce. Now I have to tell you that these sandwiches are super addictive, if you try it, be ready to welcome Dinosaurs into  your daily life, sandwiches are fresh, perfectly balanced and unique. Best that Dinosaurs has to offer is its people, always smiling, always welcoming you and always deliver what they promise.

Get your munch on with these crafters of deliciousness, it's worth it!
author: Erast B.

description:
The other day, I tried two of their banh mi's - shaking beef and the Special, as well as their pork and shrimp fresh spring roll.

Enjoyed both sandwiches - they had a lot of flavor, and the meat was moist, not dry, but between the two, would definitely recommend the shaking beef more. I only ate half of each (and took the other halves home), and shaking beef was still delicious when reheating.

I also appreciated the pork and shrimp fresh spring rolls. Didn't expect the green apple to be in there, but I thought it paired well, adding a light, crisp, sweetness to the roll.

Though the price is a bit more than what I usually pay for banh mi's and spring rolls, for a good meal in the city (with reasonable portions), I think it's worth it.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Fast, cheap and delicious sandwiches and other quick Vietnamese fare. 

Pork is where it's at, the crispy tofu is also amazing.
author: Trent W.

description: Avocado smoothie is a must get here. They do it so well. I get massive food coma afterwards but it's still worth it!
author: Yad L.

description:
Yummy Sandwiches!

Ok, so I've only tried their Shaking Beef Sandwich so far because I'm a creature of habit so I tend to just stick with the same food if I really love it!

I've been to Dinosaurs probably about 4xs now, and every time I've been happy with my sandwich. I think the 1st time I was there I got it with an Avocado Shake which was light, creamy, refreshing, and slightly sweet. I think I would prefer it being a little sweeter, but this was nice too. Then the other times I've tried the Thai Iced Tea (which was good), and my last time I tried the Mango Mint Smoothie which was delish! I think so far my fave would be the Mango Mint Smoothie. 

They have other sandwiches selections, but I just can't get myself to try other ones yet. They also have spring rolls as well if you're into that. 

Pretty cute little sandwich place with a few seatings inside and outside. There's a small little vintage-y arcade game with lots of chip options. It's also pretty hidden with not a very obvious signage. It seems like they get break-ins often because of the wooden plank to cover where the windows were. That's not good that they have to keep on dealing with that. 

But yes, I'm a fan of this place. Love the name of the place. :)

Ps. Don't forget to check-in & show them the 10% check-in offer *before* ordering! :D
author: Amy C.

description: Best bun mi sandwich I had for a very long time in the heart of Castro San Fran, and the spring rolls are fresh, tasty ice coffee and avocado drinks. Will be back when I visit again!
author: Allen W.

description:
The bahn mi I bought here today is easily the best I've had. At over $8 plus tax, it's also the most expensive, I think, but I've now discovered that there's 10% off with check-in, which is something. The bread is crunchy, the veggies perfectly pickled, the dressing savory as can be, the meat so tender and juicy, and, oh, that cucumber. I had had a few kinda bad Vietnamese sandwiches lately, so this was even more of a treat. 

I had walked this block numerous times, as my tanning salon is very close, but I had never ventured inside this little hidden gem location which houses a few other shops as well. I really enjoy coming across such spots in the city, especially as a long-time resident. Nothing fancy, but the feel is comfortable. Service is friendly and efficient.
author: Paulina F.

description: Good sandwiches and fresh rolls.  Higher priced than other Vietnamese sandwich places in San Francisco, but the quality is so much better. Cons:  service is always lacking and restaurant layout is terrible.  When it gets busy its hard to sit and eat.
author: Alan H.

description:
This is my second time here and this review is specifically for the Tofu & Taro Spring Rolls. Spring rolls are usually made with various ingredients but the addition of green apples just didn't work for me. It's also not listed on the board of main ingredients so I was slightly thrown off. I'm one of those people who generally don't like fruits mixed with savory food so it's a personal preference. 

Overall, I very much recommend coming here though for their sandwiches and smoothies! Service is straightforward and relatively fast and that 10% coupon is great.
author: Christie C.

description: This is definitely a neighborhood favorite! The pork pate on the "special" is delicious. I love the mint mango smoothie. Order ahead by phone and your sandwich will be ready in ten minutes. Grab it to go and enjoy it in the park.
author: Gianna S.

description:
I like Dinosaurs - tasty bahn mi (Vietnamese sandwiches) at a reasonable price.  They have a wider range of protein selection than most - I especially love the steak!  
Definitely a great neighborhood sandwich shop - I'd go all the time if I lived in the area.  But since I don't, I only stop by when in the area - I wish there was a way to order online and quickly pick up, since parking can be difficult in the area for a quick stop.
author: Greg B.

description: My shuttle drops me off right in front of Dinosaurs and I've been meaning to try this place, so glad that I did!! I picked the special pork sandwich and fresh rolls with shrimp and both items were ammmmaazzzziinnggg!!! I went to school down in the OC, where there's amazing vietnamese food everywhere, and always felt deprived of good and accessible vietnamese food in the area (without driving into outer sunset or richmond) so I am so excited to have stumbled upon this place. Will now be my to-go spot for a quick vietnamese fix!
author: Katherine C.

description:
Hey Dino,

I like you. Yes I do. 
Sandwiches are solid and those drinks. YES.

I know people give you a hard time about Banh Mi sandwiches being like $8 when you can go to chinatown or some other asian location and get it for like $3... but I understand. This is SF. People pay $15 for a salad here. So I don't hold that against you. Plus your sandwiches are a bit more fancier, more well made. If others want cheap banhmi then they can seek it elsewhere. I think your sandwiches are pretty good. having said that let's not go overboard and keep things as is :). One vote for the shaking beef. Another for wicked fast service.

As for those drinks. Avocado drink. YES PLEASE. So much goodness. Mango Mint? AH i love mint. Watermelon? I ordered it once before, can't remember what it tasted like but I am sure it was awesome! (does that illegitimate my praise or does it reinforce it? not sure about that one...)

Anyhow I'll see you soon.
If you ever do a rewards card... YES.
author: Paul L.

description:
Dinosaurs is one of my favorite places for banh mi in San Francisco! The sandwiches here are fresh and delicious, but also affordable too - which is surprising given the shop's location and slightly more modern style.

My go-to order is the Shaking Beef, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I love that the banh mis here are packed full of meat, and you get a very even distribution of meat, sauce and veggie in every bite. Surprisingly, the sandwiches here also hold together pretty well, which is definitely not the case at other places I've visited.

Overall, highly recommend as a quick lunch or dinner place!
author: Yuan J.

description: I was aiming to eat half a sandwich and get a green leaf smoothie. Instead I ate a whole sandwich and ordered an avocado milk shake. Delicious.
author: Evelyn Y.

description:
Oh how I love thee... chicken and shrimp spring roll with peanut sauce. 

This is my favorite dish in all of San Francisco right now and it's only $8.  I come here at least once a week because the food is awesome, the staff is friendly and I can get a mighty tasty meal for less than $10.
author: Jalahn W.

description: Wonderful hole in the wall small restaurant. Get their special Kare Kare sandwich. They only serve 10 a day and it's totally worth echoing in early for!! The Thai tea is beautifully refreshing as well.
author: Ahmed H.

description: Excellent sandwiches and spring rolls! Both we flavorful and moist. Be sure to check in for 10% off.
author: Leslie T.

description:
Forgot to use my Checkin deal,  but I'll do it next time...

Shaking beef sandwich

Yes! !! Perfect bread, soft and fluffy fresh bread with a light crispy exterior (not a mouth cutter),  juicy high quality beef tastes like it's been slow cooked,  instead of the hard cubes (Bo luclac at other places), fresh vibrant crispy pickled carrots 

Awesome chinese pop music from the 2000's playing in the background and a neo geo arcade system

Although it's double the price than regular bahnmi,  you're paying for the fusion aspect of it, and it's top quality. I'd  definitely bring a friend next time to battle at the arcade machine after a sandwich!
author: Tina A.

description:
Yummy, delicious - and surprisingly addictive - SPICY TUNA Vietnamese sandwich rocks my roll.  Spice-lovers Sriracha sting, crunchy burst of pickled daikon, chopped cilantro and freshly made French bread give it the authentic V flavors.  Pack a new lunch today; this isn't your mother's tuna fish sammich.

I'm game to try more at this little shop.
author: Sondra H.

description:
This is the bahnmi sandwich shop OF MY DREAMS. 

First: cilantro-free sandwiches! Then there is the perfect protein to pickledveggie ratio. The crispy tofu is indeed crispy and the grilled chicken sandwich is ONLY dark meat - so juicy! The bread is perfectly crispy and warm and stays crispy till the end unlike most places where the bread is soaked through and mushy. They have a variety of cool flavored kettle brand chips including Korean BBQ. 

Last but not least, you MUST try their bomb avocado smoothie. It is so incredibly yummy. 

Check in 10% off still worked for me so stop by if you haven't already!
author: Lisa K.

description:
Hidden somewhere in a strange shopping center near the Castro is a Vietnamese sandwich shop called Dinosaurs. I decided to check it out because of the quality Yelp score and the unusual name.

One banh mi sandwich later, I can confirm that both are accurate.
author: Nick K.

description: Done with Dinosaurs. Whatever magic they had in the beginning is long gone. Tiny "carrot" sandwiches with high prices is what you get nowadays. At least there's no more long lines.
author: Carol A.

description:
Yes, the prices have gone up quite a bit over the last several years as they've gained in popularity, and the banh mi are pricier than, say, a mom-and-pop establishment in a heavily Asian neighborhood, but you do get what you pay for in terms of good ingredients and tasty sandwiches.

My favorites are the Shaking Beef (sliced beef sauteed with onions and vinaigrette) and the Special (roast pork, "fancy" pork loaf, and pork pate). While there isn't much seating, they serve you quite fast, and it also tends to be a quick in-and-out experience. Or get your sandwiches to go, head over to Dolores Park, and have a nice picnic amongst the masses.
author: Vincent L.

description: Decent sandwiches! My husband and I enjoyed the grilled pork and chicken sandwich. I also loved their thai iced tea!
author: Criselda B.

description:
TL:DR - If you live near / in San Jose or have had a great sandwich in SJ, then this place is overpriced. 

Parking: Paid street parking, typical of SF 

Ambience: The space is small with a few tables inside and outside. It is a casual setting, reminds me of a teriyaki joint. The environment is young with its young staff and top 50 music. 

Service: The staff are super friendly. The guy who rang my friend up saw that we had split a sandwich and that I was using a napkin for the sandwich. Without asking me, he got me an extra tray. 

Order: Crispy Tofu Sandwich ($7.15): They shred the tofu into small pieces and used vegan mayo, perfect for those who can't / don't want to eat meat.

Verdict: The sandwich was flavorable, and I have nothing to complain about in terms of taste. However, coming from San Jose, this sandwich was extremely overpriced for what it was. Since there aren't a lot of Vietnamese places compared to San Jose, this place does the job (and relatively priced well compared to other restaurants in the area). I wouldn't come back as I am not living in the city and live much closer to San Jose.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Ordered: the special
Taste: 8/10
Service: 7/10
Ambiance: 5/10
Overall: 7/10

Would I return? Yes.
author: Shawn M.

description:
I have never spent this much for 1 banh mi (sandwich) ever! In socal, for 7.50 I can buy like 3 baguettes ! Sighhhh. This makes me miss socal so much and I took my banh mi for granted down there.   I will not come back here because the price is just ridiculous. 

But the baguette is actually good. I got a number 1 and the avocodo smoothie. But the price does not justify it though. 

There's also a random atm machine inside.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Solid Vietnamese sandwiches and spring rolls. A little fancier and pricier ($8 sandwiches) than more classic bunmee shops but good quality and portions.  It's a small hole in the wall shop with limited seating, located in a small shopping plaza that is super easy to miss if you're on Market St.  There's also a back entrance on 16th St.

Tried the "Special" (multi meat) and Crispy Tofu, both good. Watermelon and lychee smoothie was refreshing. 

All in all, not worth a special trip but a good option if you're in the area and looking for something quick and tasty.
author: Dennis H.

description: Tasty bahn mi-some traditional, some fusion innovations. I tend to be a traditional gal and like the meatball one. A bit more pricey than their Tenderloin counterparts, but tasty, wholesome, and a friendly, helpful staff.
author: Edith C.

description:
I LOVE THESE SANDWICHES. Great spot for a quick bite near the Castro and for a good value on a delicious Bahn Mi. I got a grilled pork Bahn Mi sandwich; the meat was moist and well cooked, the veggies were delicious and perfectly pickled, the bread was tasty and the whole sandwich was a good size. They seriously inspired me to start pickling carrots and other veggies for the sandwiches I make at home. For $8 you really can't go wrong with Dinosaurs. 

P.S. This place is super hidden! There is no large sign, just a decal on the window. If your maps said you passed it you probably did lol As they say though, good things come in small packages.
author: Alex C.

description:
The first time I try to find this place, I walked past 2x times using google map before I actually figured out where the spot was..... it was hidden alright!! 
The sandwiches here are so juicy and the meat is tender and filling. 
Prices are higher than an average banhi mi but they don't skimp on the meat and it's super tasty so that justifies it. Besides the sandwiches, the spring roll here is also really good perfect grab and go lunch spot and I will come back more often.
author: Luna C.

description: I probably get food here like three times a week. Their sandwich rolls and spread are great and set them apart.
author: David P.

description: Super tasty vegan options. Love that it stays open too late. Wish they wouldn't use super harsh cleaning supplies so early (900 pm). Can barely breathe. Thank God for open windows. Bonus: condensed evaporated soy milk for Thai iced coffees !!!! Tofu and portobello are great vegan sandwiches.
author: Chad J.

description:
Dinosaurs is one of my favorite go-to spots to grab a quick post workout snack (the other being I'a Poke). I frequent the 24 Hour Fitness on Market and Church, so this banh mi shop is only a very short walk away.

You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches they have here. I myself don't have a preference as they are all equally satisfying. However, the grilled pork banh mi is the one that made it to 7x7's 100 Things to Eat in San Francisco Before You Die. Go for that if you're trying to get a tick off your bucket list.
author: Miko B.

description:
Dinosaurs is fast, friendly, delicious and affordable! A great place for a quick lunch if you're headed to the park on the weekend or working from home on the weekday. Chicken Bahn Mi can't be beat (although my husband says the pork version gives it a run for it's money). Slightly more expensive than your standard banh mi,  but nevertheless considered cheap eats in SF with a price tag under $10. They also offer some pretty tasty spring rolls.

I used to order from them a lot more when they had "Order Ahead" because the line can be kind of a beast. Hopefully they'll get another pre-order system in place for us spoiled neighbors who can't deal with lines.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Don't forgot to check in and save 10% of any purchase!  I love sharking beef always my favourite sandwich


Yummy!
author: Liu J.

description:
My new favorite place! Everything we tried on the menu was incredible. Each sandwich is about $7.50 which is a little on the higher end for Vietnamese sandwiches but still way less than what you would pay at a restaurant in SF! The service is really nice. The place is clean and well kept - definitely not a hole in the wall type. It has a few tables to sit at and even a video game machine!

We ordered the special and shaking beef sandwiches. Both were AMAZING! I was addicted to the mayo on the special pork and the vinaigrette on the shaking beef. The bread is perfectly toasted and is a large serving size. The meat is so tender and flavorful I couldn't recommend them more! We also tried the watermelon lychee smoothie ($4). This was very refreshing and I enjoyed the small bites of lychee jelly inside.

Overall if you love bahn mis then you should definitely add this to your list of places to check out!
author: Linda X.

description:
Food is pretty good for Vietnamese banh mi! Don't let the look of the store decieve you, it's on the other side of the corner than what Google maps/yelp says it's on (16th St). 
Got the grilled pork today but will definitely come by the next time I got work!
author: Anderson H.

description:
My two major issues with this place are that the location is surprisingly difficult to find and the prices are a little high. They should add some signage on the exterior of shop facing the street, so it's easier to locate. For the prices they charge, I think the sandwiches are a bit small.

Beyond that, this is one of the better restaurants I've been to in the city. The menu isn't expansive, but they provide great quality for everything they offer. None of the ingredients fall flat. The smoothies are also surprisingly fantastic as well, and I highly recommend the watermelon smoothie with lychee. 

Parking is difficult to find, and there's not a whole lot of seating. The decor is pretty bare - it's much more of a grab-and-go spot than a sit-down place. Service is pretty fast too. 

I definitely recommend a visit here.
author: Daniel M.

description:
My buddy from work turned me on to this place and it's the real deal.

Not saying that these sandwiches are authentic bahn mi but it's the real deal in terms of the hype - believe it. At the end of the day and about a handful of visits I have to say that they have the best bahn mi sandwiches I've ever eaten.

I've had the Special, Shaking Beef, and Grilled Pork. All of them were incredibly good. The meats were all tender and spiced perfectly. They add the right mix of carrots and greens. And most importantly, the bun is the best I've had for a Vietnamese sandwich. The perfect crunch and flakiness on the outside and soft and warm on the inside - like a true baguette.

Just writing about this makes we want to go back!
author: Art O.

description: I haven't been to dinosaurs in a few months I must make a revisit the people there are friendly and you have to try a different sandwich  each Rome you visit you won't be disappointed. I like mine with a lot of jalapeños and a little Chilies. Great place on 16th street but you get there from market as well just go down the steps.
author: RICHARD J.

description:
Delicious sandwiches! Their menu has sandwiches for diets of all kinds (vegetarian, etc). I got the spicy tuna sandwich and my partner got the grilled chicken sandwich. Both were very well prepared (not falling apart, good portions and ratios) and tasted extremely fresh. The freshness of the sandwiches was probably my favorite part.

I did not eat inside but the establishment is quite small. I would not suggest coming here as a large group, although 2-3 would sit comfortably. It is pretty quite in there so it makes for having a good conversation. Oh, and there is an arcade machine inside!

Overall, I would definitely would eat here again :)
author: Camille G.

description:
This place was hard to find. The shop is tucked inside a building away from the busier street. 

The service here is fantastic! The shop was clean and nifty with its mini arcade and decor. The food was so delicious! I'm coming here for their banh mi and spring rolls! Try their drinks as well . So fresh with every sip
author: Kent B.

description:
having a name called dinosaur, it had me thinking these sandwiches were made by cool hipster white folks.  But no, the ladies there are Chinese/malay/thai/Indonesian/Burmese?  Not 100% sure but they were playing Chinese music (mandarin) and I ordered their special which was kare kare Filipino ox tail beef stew.  But they didn't look Filipino...I will have to ask next time.

Anyway, their non-traditional banh mi's were quite delicious, especially the kare kare with added pate.  At my normal establishments, I would get extra pate and jalapenos, but first time at dinosaur, I wanted to see their norm.  The sandos could of used more jalapeno, but the pate was a pretty good sloppy amount, a bit more would be merrier for me and I wouldn't mind.  Kare kare was sweet and melty in your mouth.  The bread had a very nice slight crust with soft interior and over all easy bite apart texture.  Sometimes when banh mi is too hard by toasting too much or just sitting a bit too long, you take a bite and its hard so it pushes all the ingredients all over the place and falling out sometimes too.  But not these sandos.  

Oh the other was The Special; roast pork, fancy pork, pate.  The roast pork tasted like Chinese roast pork that you get at the hanging duck/chicken roast spots.  It was warm and good.  Could have used a bit more mayo and pate, as the roast pork was abundant but a bit dry.

Spring rolls with grilled chicken and shrimp, it was nice, broke apart easy but tasty and fresh especially with a surprise of apples!  Choice of sauces was a new thing for me.

Overall, one of my favorite non real deal banh mi sandos unlike a dac biet you get at any huong lan.  And almost as good as non traditional ones I make at home, so will be back!
author: Kevin L.

description: Dinosaurs is the best. They always get it right, the place is clean and the service is good. It's probably the only sandwich place I go where I love everything on the menu. My favorite would have to be the crispy tofu!
author: Beaky L.

description:
Urban Legend says that when the owner was a kid, he liked to think of himself as a dinosaur because he had to open his mouth very wide to eat banh mi. Hence the original, semi-hipster name of Dinosaurs. (I used to think they were remotely affiliated with Andytown, which features plastic dinos and succulents as table art.)

The style is a little similar to Wooly Pig because they have traditional banh mi as well as some unique, more fusiony creations. (Maybe one day they will form a collaboration called Wooly Dinosaurs??!) Both feature excellent quality, a nice setting, and expensive-ish sandwich at $7-$8ish, which is pricier than your typical banh mi, but less than Ike's which is usually $9ish.

Sandwiches come on a crispy baguette roll, cilantro, jalapeno, mayo, and a mountain of pickled carrots and daikon. The star is the baguette--fresh, decently crunchy, and thick enough that it doesn't get soggy with all the sauces. 

(+++) The most classic is THE SPECIAL ($7.49, slow roasted pork, fancy pork loaf, and pork pate). I highly recommend especially if you like traditional banh mi, since it's the best deal for pate (it's the only sandwich that comes with it; for everything else it's an add-on).

(++) Although I'm not usually particularly enthusiastic about vegan things, the CRISPY TOFU ($7.15, fried shreds of tofu, taro, rice noodles, and jicama with vegenaise) is surprisingly good, making a refreshing (and arguably healthier) alternative. All the ingredients complement each other very well, and the extra crisp makes it even more interesting.

(+++) I was blown away by the SPICY TUNA ($7.15, chunk light tuna with spicy mayo). After having underwhelming experiences with tuna sandwiches being too mayo-y or too bland, Dinosaurs' version restored my faith. There was just enough mayo for a light creaminess, and the spicy kick reminded me of spicy tuna rolls.

(++) One of their most popular is the SHAKING BEEF ($7.49, sliced beef sauteed with onions and vinaigrette) . It's indeed delicious, though not earth-shakingly so (pun intended). I find it a bit too salty and heavy, so I would recommend if you have a dinosaur's appetite. They once had a Filipino inspired version with peanut sauce and bok choy, which I can't comment much about since they ran out of peanut sauce and for some reason there was no bok choy.

(+) For more simple options, there are the GRILLED CHICKEN ($7.49) and GRILLED PORK ($7.15). I do prefer the grilled chicken since I find the grilled pork a bit dry (the Special with the pate or adding avo helps with this). I couldn't really taste the lemongrass, but these are good choices if you don't want anything too gimmicky or saucy.

(+) The $1.50 extra for AVOCADO is quite worth it, since they give you a hefty half avocado. It's an indulgent addition, but I would suggest it only for the grilled chicken or grilled pork, since everything else is flavorful and filling already.

Yes, I've tried nearly everything on the menu :3 Like a dinosaur in an apocalypse :V I passed on the SPRING ROLLS, partly because they actually cost more than the sandwiches, and partly because I'm already so happy with the sandwiches. I've always been curious about the MEATBALL (it's supposed to be sui mai style like the Chinese dim sum).

(++) The VIETNAMESE ICED COFFEE ($3.75, dark roast coffee and chicory with sweetened condensed milk) is great as well, not as caffeinated as Wooly Pig but I love the earthy notes from the chicory.

One thing I will rant about is their propensity to mess up orders. I usually order one sandwich without cilantro and jalapeno (for the boo, who is anti-cilantro and anti-spicy) and one sandwich with everything (for myself, since I'm an omnomnomivore). Once they realized they messed it up and redid it so it was a longer wait. Another time, they mixed up the no cilantro/jalapeno on the sandwiches, and also gave me a grilled pork instead of a meatball. They also forgot my extra avocado once, and in my dismay over my lost $1.50, I asked at my next visit if they could give me my avo. The lady was very nice and allowed it, but I do wish they were better about keeping orders straight. It's usually not too busy, and the special requests are not particularly complicated. (Cheers to Starbucks baristas who can put up with far worse nit-pickiness)

Other tips:
*Street parking in the area isn't too impossible
*You can call in your order ahead of time!
*Portion size is just right--satisfying but not so filling that you feel like a glutton
*They charge $0.10 for a paper bag. I suggest bringing your own, because once they didn't wrap the sandwich well. I was being thrifty and passed on the bag, and there were carrots and daikon all over my car.

Dinosaurs. Always makes me as hungry as a dinosaur!
author: Edna C.

description:
This place is really good.  I'm not an expert in Bahn Mi but I lived next to Hankos in Brooklyn and ate there religiously and this is basically my comparison.  

Sandos come out meticulously prepared, very neat and not messy or overflowing.  

Can be hard to see from the street since it's not actually on Market.  Definitely recommend going.
author: Pablo N.

description: Great little place near the beach. Had the special and shrimp fresh rolls - really good but too much food for one person. Highly recommended for lunch and takeout.
author: Brahm G.

description:
Just had a Special Banh Mi and Viet coffee here. I'm asking myself: why everyone in SF is raving about this place? Have they ever tried other Banh Mi in the Bay?
It's hard to go wrong with Vietnamese sandwich. The one in Dinosaur is mediocre, not bad, not great. Portion was enough for an adult, but I find the price is too high ($7.59) for what it is. I also had the iced coffee which is $3.59. The place is small, has a few small tables inside and some outdoor seating if you prefer eating with the wind blow. Overall it's ok for a quick bite if you're in the area.
author: Shaz L.

description: My favorite place to go to get a banh mi in the city! They have innovative flavors with their Kare-Kare and shaking beef sandwiches. The bread is on point - toasted to perfection. The avocado shake is also great with a nice taste of vanilla rice milk that you don't always find. The spring rolls are always fresh too - definitely get their peanut sauce which is nice and creamy. I come back and back again for dinosaurs!!!
author: Trisha L.

description: Oh man, their sandos are some of the best. Pickled carrots are perfectly done. Meat portions are healthy. Priced reasonably. Definitely the place for a quick bahn mi fix. Highly recommended.
author: Alice W.

description:
I wanted a Vietnamese sandwich for lunch last Sunday, May 22nd. When I saw Dinosaurs on DoorDash, the roommate and I decided to get delivery. We placed our ordered at 12:39pm and it arrived at 1:38pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Pork & Shrimp: Grilled lemongrass pork with shrimp, lettuce, cucumber, green apple, cilantro, mint, and rice noodles, Served with Traditional peanut ($7.95)
*Grilled Chicken: Dark meat chicken, grilled with lemongrass, with pickled carrots and daikon, cucumber, jalapeños, and mayo on a French baguette ($8.50), add Pork pate (+$1.50)
*Grilled Pork: Sliced pork grilled with lemongrass with pickled carrots and daikon, cucumber, jalapeños, and mayo on a French baguette ($7.95)

I got the chicken banh mi. There was a good amount of chicken and the veggies had a nice pickle, but there was an overwhelming amount of mayo in certain bites. I could have done with less. I love adding pate to my sandwiches, but I wish there was more as there were just small smears throughout the baguette. The roommate got the pork banh mi and thought the same thing. Too much mayo. The addition of the green apples to the spring rolls was weird in my opinion. It added a tartness the rolls didn't need. I wished this was a little more traditional.

I've been wanting to try Dinosaurs for some time now, but I gotta say, their food was just okay. My favorite vietnamese sandwiches still come from the Tenderloin.
author: Elena N.

description: Fantastic banh mi! The banh mi with the roasted pork and the pate is delicious and unlike the other banh mi I've had in the city. The owners are friendly and service is fast. The spring rolls are excellent as well. Prices are fair. Check it out!
author: Mikey J.

description:
If Ross Geller were to open up a sandwich shop, maybe it would look like this?
I've heard good words about Dinosaurs' banh mi, so I wanted to try it for myself. First of all, this Dinosaurs location is on the 16th St. side of the little neighborhood shopping plaza. If you enter this miniature mall from Market St., go down the stairs, and head straight towards the 16th St. exit, and you'll find a small, simple sandwich shop. The menu includes the usual items you'd find at a Vietnamese banh mi shop, including spring rolls. A couple of the sandwiches stand out, like the shaking beef or the one with pork meatballs.

$7.39 The Special - roast pork, pate, pickled carrots & daikon, cucumber, cilantro, jalapenos, mayo on French baguette:
The baguette was wonderfully crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was stuffed to the brim with roast pork, the kind that looks like it was cooked with a red glaze. The sliced vegetables were crunchy, but not quite juicy. I would have liked to taste more pate on the sandwich, too. 

Although, the banh mi comes at quite a premium rice, it is still considered an affordable sandwich. Plus, the neighborhood doesn't really compete in the banh mi department. It was also a tasty sandwich, but this wouldn't be my first choice for a banh mi. If I were in the mood for a sandwich in this area, I'd still be curious to try the shaking beef sandwich.
author: Joy W.

description:
Best sandwiches EVER!!! 
Super nice and friendly staff and the coolest sticker machine in the WORLD!!!
So glad its here in the city. I know where to come for yum yum yummy yum food when I'm back THANKS FOR THE AWESOME EXPERIENCE GUYS!!!
author: Michael G.

description: I came here for lunch today and was so sad to see 3 slices of pork in my roast pork sandwich. Maybe they were running out of meat or just being frugal, but I was disappointed that my sandwich didn't look like the photos on Yelp. Despite the lack of meat, the toppings were delicious and the bread, the bread was the star. It was so GOOD. If only I could combine the bread from here with the filling from dragon eats....heaven.
author: Skye W.

description:
this review is for the pacifica location,  I ordered the pork lemongrass bahn mi & was very disappointed.  I've had many bahn mi's & this is the worst I've had, lacking in the proper flavors.  if you're looking for an authentic bahn mi, please go somewhere else.   if you give it a chance because of the good reviews, there's a good chance that you'll be disappointed like me.
what also turned me off was the basic "thank you" after paying & receiving my sandwich.  there are many places that sell bahn mi's, won't be back or suggest it to anyone I know.
author: sandie g.

description: Dinosaurs has great bahn mi sandwiches,  is conveniently located, and has the friendliest staff. I came here caring a bahn mi sandwhich, and Dinosaurs definitely satisfied that craving. I ordered the beef and pork sandwiches, and both were awesome. I've had several bahn Mis from Vietnamese grocery stores or neighborhoods before, and these were right up there in quality. My one wish was that the sandwiches were a little bigger than they were for the 7 bucks. Other than that, I am very happy with the food, quality and service that I received.
author: Ross S.

description: Decent Bahn Mi but nothing to write home about, especially for the price. I've had better for less
author: Cayle G.

description:
Wheee, I love Dinosaurs! The restaurant is pretty small, but they also have a few tables of outdoor seating.

Their banh mi's are slightly more expensive than other banh mi places (~$7), but it's definitely worth it. Their sandwiches are always overflowing with filling, so you'll never complain of a boring bite of just bread. I always get "the special", which has roasted pork, pork loaf, and pate, plus pickled carrots and radish, jalapenos, cucumber, and cilantro. It's different from the barbecue-flavored banh mi's that I've had at some other places, but it's even more delicious. The avocado shake is also thick and creamy - you can actually taste the avocado, but it's not too strong.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Got the grilled pork sandwich. Very tasty. Wish they put egg on their sandwiches and wish there was a slightly better meat to veggies ratio but everything tasted fresh and good. They did seem to be out of a lot of stuff when I went but maybe that was just an off day
author: Bowen G.

description:
If you've ever had a legit $3 banh mi, you know that Dinosaurs will never ever ever be able to compare.

To me $8+ - they're raising prices again soon - for a banh mi is a complete rip off. Yes it's reasonable for the area - but there are plenty of places in SF where you can get a meal just as affordably priced.

Food wise, I've had my share of banh mis, and I'd rank the bread they use here as one of the worst. Traditionally, banh mis come with a soft and crunchy baguette, and this was nowhere close. It was more Dutch crunch than baguette and just fell apart as you're eating it. 

Their shaking beef sandwich I don't even know why is called shaking beef because it's prepared way different than how the shaking beef is usually done if you're familiar with Vietnamese cuisine. They also went way overboard with mayo which is a big no no.

Overall a sloppy and disappointing banh mi for the price. Some say it's pricy because it's better quality but I don't believe that obviously. If they aren't making the effort to create a flawless banh mi from the bread to every other component, what makes you think they're making the same effort to carefully select only the best ingredients? Sorry but when you overcharge your banh mi by 3-4x what some of the best places charge, there's a certain expectation.
author: Veronica T.

description: A great take on bahn mi! Love everything on the menu! Whenever I'm in the neighborhood, have to stop and grab a couple for the road:)
author: elgin e.

description: Shaking beef and thai iced tea are always a great choice. Beef is tender and flavorful. Service is always fast. Has tables if you want to eat there.
author: Janette W.

description:
Prices are appropriate for the best banh mi in the city!  Crispy light baguette, tender & moist meat, crunchy pickled veg, just the right amount of jalapeno.  Bread is never stale even at 9pm!

I like the special because of the creamy pate, my bf likes the shaking beef with onions and extra jalapenos.
author: Elouise D.

description: Hands down best vegetarian banh mi I've had. The combination of shredded tofu, fried taro and rice noodles somehow conveys a meaty texture and soaks up so much of the wonderful authentic flavor. The only thing preventing a fifth star is that the juiciness was mostly contained in the middle of the sandwich, leaving sparser, drier ends.
author: Kumar P.

description: For bahn mi this is favorite! I am a huge fan of the crispy tofu. I tried to go back to my old favorite, Saigon Sandwich, after eating only Dinosaurs for a couple of month and I know I will never go back again because it just does not  compare. I am addicted to these sandwiches and it is great that they have vegan options so I can nearly anyone here.
author: Denise L.

description: I'm currently obsessed with banh mi and Dinosaurs sure knows how to make 'em. The shaking beef and the special are my go to orders. You won't regret coming here. The location in Pacifica is also fantastic!
author: Jenny E.

description: Love this place. Great sandwiches and very nice staff. I always get the "special" and spring rolls. Yummmmmaaaaay!!
author: Dani G.

description: Hella small and over priced.. and for a can of soda was going to charge me 4$ wowserz ain't that serious if was a crush soda from Texas not from over seas sheesh
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Came here after dinner to pick up lunch for the next day.  Yes, unfortunately I'm always thinking of food... thus the weight gain and why Yelp is my favorite app!

Luckily this time, I was full from dinner, which prevented my typical over order!!  Two combos + 1 grilled pork.  I asked the staff to put the veggies on the side and no cilantro, since I'm not eating it until the next day.  To my surprise, not only were they more than accommodating to my request, but they even asked if I wanted to have the mayo and pate and beef all separate.  How awesome was that?  I did opt to have the mayo on the side, but said have the meat inside the bread.  When I opened the package the next day to prep lunch, everything was perfectly packaged!

Ty Sandwiches was previously my favorite, now Ty and Dinosaurs are tied.
@Dinosaurs the major pros are:
 * grilled pork, so much flavor, my favorite in SF, get this!
 * meat quantity in the combo!! you never have to ask "where's the beef?"
 * video games while you wait
 * small Sriracha to go/keychains, why didn't I think of that? 

minor con @Dinosaurs is that they're slightly pricier than the more OG places, e.g. Ty's or Saigon Sandwich.  But IMO, it's worth it.  

Can't wait to come back and try the shaken beef sandwich.  Next order two grilled porks and one beef... Yes, an over order again.  :D

Happy eating!
author: Tina F.

description:
Love the sandwiches. Super yum. 
You can't go wrong with a good sandwich, I always go pork. The place is small, so go at a less busy time if you want to sit. About 4ish tables. The service was quick. Sauce is delish and they serve beer. All great combos for a yummy simple bite.
author: francis c.

description:
Spicy Tuna is my best favorite ! 
While I`m in Tokyo , this is one of those things  I miss.
author: Shinichi M.

description: I read reviews and heard great things about their banh mi sandwiches from multiple people local to the area. I wasn't really impressed. The menu is very limited as are drinks. The "Special" sandwich i ordered was a "slow roasted pork" banh mi with the usual ingredients..cilantro, carrots..etc etc. The bread was good because it was soft from the mayo spread within it, but the meat didn't taste good to me at all, it tasted maybe a week old. Luckily I've decided to try them again in hopes when I walk in i'm not bombarded by kamikaze flies.
author: Michael S.

description: Grabbed a quick sandwich here to go. Although the beef sandwich was a bit sweater than I was expecting, the flavor was good. It was a bit more than I am used to paying for a sandwich and I did not love the flies that were in the restaurant while I was waiting for my order, it was fast, convenient, and tasty.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday & was super excited to try the tofu spring rolls. Sadly when I got to the register, the cashier said it would be a 50 minute wait for the spring rolls. That was very disappointing, how can you not have the ingredients prepared for tofu spring rolls right at prime lunch time?! I tried the crispy tofu sandwich which was good, but I really was not in  the sandwich mood. I don't think I'll be coming back unless I call beforehand to make sure they can make the spring rolls for lunch. 

There was seating outside and inside which was nice, but it can be hard to find a place to sit since it's a small space. Employees were also nice & my order was quickly served. Hopefully the next time it will be a 5 star experience!
author: Aisha L.

description: Found this spot by accident and found out they had kare kare bahn mi. Kare kare is a Filipino dish and one of my favorite, so I had to try it. Bought two for and me and my wife with a avocado shake. It even came with bago-ong (shrimp paste). The sandwich wasn't bad but it wasn't that great either. The meat was soft and it had the peanut butter creamy taste. The bagoong definitely helped the experience. Next time I'm in the area again I would probably try something different.
author: Lloyd M.

description: The go-to bahnmi spot. $8 per sandwich is pushing it but they're very good. Can't go wrong with the shakin' beef. It's a favorite. They know how to make a good viet sandwich and keep the peanut sauces well away from the other foods for those with nut allergies.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Don't judge a book by its cover. We were looking for something quick but healthy-ish in the Castro. Dinosaur came up as viet sandwiches and four stars so off we went. 

We arrived and were slightly taken aback by the look of the place but as we all know Yelp finds those hidden gems that you wouldn't normally discover.

Dinosaur has been running for 6 year but it seems like the quality has remained high. They were out of spring rolls BUT that was fine by me! I opted for the shaking beef.

The food was made quickly and served fresh. Plenty of beef, and a great sauce which was spicy but just the right amount of spice. 

The waiter was also very friendly and very accommodating. 

As I said, don't judge a book by its cover and give this place a try. You won't be disappointed!
author: Bethany W.

description:
DINO sandwiches are so bomb!  

Their house special ham sandwich with pate, pickled carrots, a slice of cucumber and topped with a shred of cilantro, is so loaded with yummy goodness!  They have other sandwiches if that doesn't suit your palate. I like how they offer Sriracha as a side hot sauce condiment.

Their shrimp spring rolls are delicious for an opening delight.  

It's a great place for a lunch stop and they have a cozy, outdoor seating area for you to bring the sammie outside to nom away at while enjoying the breeze.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This is a pretty standard vietnamese sandwich place hence giving it a 3 star (A-Ok) rating. The sandwiches were good but nothing out of the ordinary. The price is typical San Francisco.

I recommend the place if you're looking for good, simple vietnamese sandwiches in the city.
author: Jon T.

description: Legit banh mi sandwiches. Very good, very delicious. If you're looking for the real deal here it is. The location on Market St. makes them more expensive but it's worth it.
author: John C.

description: Amazing banh mi's and spring rolls! The warm peanut sauce keeps us coming back. Haven't had a bad thing yet :)
author: Annie C.

description: I bought a sandwich called 'the special' and it was excellent.  I am definitely going back again! Price was cheap ($7+), the bread was crunchy, and the flavors were on point.  The service is kind and friendly!  Small, quaint space perfect for a small lunch break.  Sitting is limited, however there are tables outside!  I wouldn't go in a large group of 4+.
author: Paula N.

description:
I was in the city, craving food nearby but didn't know where to go, so Yelp sesh it was... and alas! It led me to this gem.

+ The banh mi here is very good and fills you up
+ Price is very affordable ($7.39 for the Special)
+ Quick and friendly staff

Certainly more of a grab & go place, but there is seating available if that's what you're looking for. I'm not sure why this place is called Dinosaurs, but does it really matter? Some dino-mite sandwiches to be had here.
author: Connie H.

description: Hungry one day after work but not sure what to eat, I mosied over to Dinosaurs for a sammy. I mentioned to Clyde that I was vegan and he took care of me! The vegan bahn mi with mushrooms is fucking legit. Best vegan bahn mi ever! I told him to wrap it up and that I would eat half here and half later at home and he told the sandwich assembler to make mine half for here and half to go. What a babe. Love it. Will be back probably more times than I would like to admit to myself.
author: Danica N.

description:
Love  the spicy tuna bahn mi and spring roll ! 

Always good you can see from the check ins this is my go to spot
author: Sfclint O.

description:
Solid banh mi and spring rolls.

I had the Special Banh Mi with roasted pork, fancy pork loaf (whatever that means), and pate, and it was great. One of the best things about their banh mi was that the bread was perfectly warm and toasted, with the perfect crunch on the outside, while still being soft on the inside. The other fillings are pretty standard for a banh mi sandwich (pickled carrot and daikon, cucumber, cilantro, jalapeño), but there's a good amount of everything and it all comes together for one of the more flavorful banh mi sandwiches that you'll try. I wished that there was more pate, but it's already really good as it is.

Some people have commented that they thought there was too much mayo in the sandwiches, but I didn't find that to be the case. Though I may be biased because I enjoy mayo. 

We also ordered the Pork & Shrimp Spring Rolls. The shrimp were a decent size, and the pork was good too, though I do think that the lemongrass pork from Freshroll is more flavorful. I thought it was unique that they add some green apple inside the spring rolls. It added a nice refreshing touch to every bite, with just a tiny bit of tartness. I chose the peanut dipping sauce and liked that they warmed it before serving.

Overall, great place for an affordable and tasty meal.
author: Sara L.

description:
I had high expectations for this place because some people have told me it is their favorite sandwich place in SF.

I got a shaking beef sandwich and a Thai iced tea.

The tea was mediocre, not bad, not good.

The sandwich was disappointing... I liked the bread and the mayo based sauce... but the meat and the pickled vegetables just weren't flavorful enough. The meat was similar to philly cheese steak meat in texture but didn't have much flavor. The pickled vegetables was mostly made of carrots and wasn't sweet nor pickled for long enough... Overall I found the whole sandwich to be quite lacking.

I did have a bite of my friend's grilled chicken sandwich and thought his meat went better with the sandwich as a whole. But unfortunately the disappointing pickles makes this place very mediocre for me.
author: Lily L.

description:
My banh mi of choice in San Francisco! The special with roasted pork and pork pate is so delicious and filling. And I love the watermelon slushie with lychee. It's so refreshing on a hot summer day.

This tiny hole-in-the-wall is popular, and rightfully so. Maybe a bit pricey for a banh mi, but I'm happy to pay a bit more for the quality. FYI, they'll soon be cash only.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Dinosaurs vegan Bahn Mi was listed as one of the top seven vegan sandwiches in the Nation by VegNews magazine so was excited to give it a try.

Dinosaurs offered two different vegan Bahn Mi-Crispy Tofu or Roasted Portobello. I went with the Crispy Tofu- Fried shreds of tofu, taro, rice noodles, & jicama with Vegenaise, pickled carrots & daikon, cucumber, & jalapeños on a French baguette.

It was $7 yet received a 10 percent discount with an online Yelp check in so was just $6.85.
They have Sriracha there & even sell Sriracha key chains for one to take Sriracha on the go.

The Crispy Tofu Bahn Mi was tasty & flavorful. Kudos to Dinosaurs for going the extra mile adding Vegenaise to their sandwiches making a traditional vegan version of the Bahn Mi.

They had spring rolls with one or two being vegan & potato chips yet would be great if Dinosaurs would offer some vegan Pho or traditional noodle soup or Rice Noodle Salad. 

They already have the vegan Bahn Mi dialed yet these additional sides would make Dinosaurs go from great to excellent!
author: Shane S.

description: Visiting my friend in the city and was totally craving a banh mi for a major hangover fix. The crispy tofu sandwich was definitely underwhelming. Wish I went to one of the hole in the wall places with similar good reviews. The crispy tofu was super dried out and was not doing anything for me. Maybe if the strips were a little bigger then it would have worked out better. They just tasted like strips of fried nothing. Overall, the flavors of the sandwich itself were good and the vegetable amount was definitely abundant. Maybe I'll give the spring rolls a try next time.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
After a super rough day at work and then muni breaking down, I just wanted to get some good food and get my ass home. The closest place on this list I'm trying to finish was Dinosaurs. I had heard that Stef had tried it and enjoyed it so I thought I'd try this place. 

I decided to go with the grilled pork sandwich - was on the list and honestly, it looked like one of the best to me. The location is SMALL though - only a few tables so I couldn't actually sit there and eat.  A few minutes later, my sandwich was done. 

I got home and finally dug into the sandwich.  The sandwich was FILLED with the meat though. Not necessarily worth the $8 I paid since I can get a sandwich for like $5 in FiDi or even less in some places. 

Protip: Don't plan on eating there. Probably not enough space!
author: Nina Y.

description:
I have tasted better Vietnamese sandwiches elsewhere.  This place is decent if you want to get your Banh Mi fix.  I've heard from several people that's been here that they have created a special fusion sandwich called Kare-Kare Banh Mi.  The idea got me quite excited since this dish has been completely overlooked/avoided by many as it takes forever and intimidating to prepare, some would think peanut butter and beef mixed together is just completely gross to the foreign tongue, etc.

Kare-Kare is a famous slow-cooked Filipino oxtail stew complemented with vegetables that is prepared with thick savory peanut sauce.  (Note: There are not a lot of people that know how to properly make good/authentic Kare-Kare.  Try to delete in your mind beef that is just dipped in peanut butter--this is definitely NOT an accurate description of what the dish is per se.)  Unfortunately, Dinosaur's attempt to create a fusion sandwich completely misses to have the very basic taste of what Kare-Kare tastes like.  Their version somewhat tasted like liverwurst paté mixed with peanut sauce accompanied with your pickled vegetables, cilantro, mayo, paté and french baguette bread.  We also tried their Special Banh Mi and again, it's nothing amazing.  It lacks in taste and again the texture (there was WAY more liverwurst paté and very minimal serving of very thin slices of meat) is not like what I have eaten before from other Banh Mi spots.  The fresh rolls are okay but their peanut sauce could be improved as it tastes more like melted peanut butter with peanut bits.

I am still debating whether to give this spot another chance to check out the other selections in their menu.  Many have raved about their avocado or mango smoothies but I did not get to try it.  Again, the place is decent; it's not horrible but maybe it's better to stick with solely the basic Vietnamese Banh Mi's and perfect that before trying to create fusion dishes.
author: Heidi S.

description: Yummy, fast banh mi and spring rolls. Watermelon lichi  smoothie was good too. There is outside seating and some inside but it is a pretty small place where you order at the counter.
author: Megan Q.

description: One of my favorite banh mi places in the city. Location was pretty small, but the food was very promising. The baguette was fresh and crisp.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
In terms of Vietnamese sandwiches, it's alright. 

The more fulfilling artisan bread is a nice change from the baguettes I am accustomed to from Lee's, Dakao, and Huong Lan in the South Bay. The Special (roasted pork, fancy pork loaf and pork pate, $7.39) is as close as you can get to the traditional "banh mi thit nguoi" (my personal favorite), but it simply does not cut it for me in terms of taste. It's a good sandwich, but if you're looking for authenticity, you're better off looking elsewhere. 

That avocado smoothie, on the other hand...is the best damn smoothie I have ever tasted outside of my home! Most places tend to make it too thick, too sweet, and/or too watery. Dinosaur's avocado shake (fresh avocado, vanilla rice milk and pure cane sugar, $4.50) is the most balanced and freshest avocado shake I've bought, ever! Rice milk is definitely a better ingredient to use in those kind of shakes than regular or even condensed milk, and going organic with the cane sugar was the best thing to do. 

Seriously, if I ever make the trek to that place again, it will only be for that damn good avocado smoothie.
author: Viet N.

description:
First and foremost, dude, what an awesome name!

Came here with a friend while he was showing me around my hometown. (born and raised here but left for college).

This particular location is on the smaller side. Maybe 3 tables inside and 4 outdoor tables.

Overall, i'll have to say that I was pretty impressed. Let me just say that i'm usually someone that is not too keen on paying more than $3 for a banh mi. So when I saw that the "special" was close to $8, I had a mini heart attack. BUT i'll give it you. Their banh mis are bomb. The bread was perfectly toasty on the outside and soft on the inside. They did not skimp on the fillings, literally the pickled veggies and meats were overflowing. The flavors all melded well together, and my tastebuds were thoroughly satisfied.

Surprisingly their tofu/taro spring rolls are pretty good too. Nice crunchy texture and very fresh. OH make sure you get their peanut sauce..seriously bomb.

Like i said previously, i'm skeptical of good ethnic foods being jacked up in price but being mediocre in taste. At dinosaurs, that isn't the case. The food is legit and very tasty.

Will definitely return and had over my credit card willingly.
author: Diane T.

description:
Since I was exploring more of San Francisco, I decided to visit Dinosaurs with a friend one Thursday night. It was definitely empty and looks like one of those hole-in-the-wall places, but the Vietnamese sandwiches here were pretty darn good in terms of quality and portion size! My only concern would be the prices, as they are a bit high for what they served here. I typically never pay more than $5.00 for a banh mi sandwich, but it is a bit overpriced here. Delicious, but not typically worth your money.

As for the customer service, the staff members were very nice and friendly. Four stars for a satisfactory experience here!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Small place. Friendly service. Street parking.
Various unique, gourmet-styled Banh mi that are $7+.  Sandwiches are loaded with ingredients in an easy to chew baguette. I was definitely full after eating my sandwich. 
We enjoyed the "Special" and the Beef with Peanut sauce Banh Mi. 
I also enjoyed Mango Mint Smoothie.
author: Grace C.

description: Great value and scrumptious taste for a fiver. Young, friendly, and efficient behind-the-counter staff.
author: Aliza M.

description:
The shaking beef sandwich was so fricking delicious. I couldn't help myself and devoured it within a few minutes. I was almost tempted to order a second sandwich just because it was so good, but I had to resist otherwise I'd be stuffed. The price is certainly on the pricier end for banh mi sandwiches, but I think it's worth it. 

Checkin on yelp for 10% off.
author: Edward W.

description: It's inside a mall-like area so depending the entrance you use its can be difficult to locate the store. The banh mis are pretty good! But a little bit pricey in my opinion. It's $8 for a tofu banh mi. They also have this Watermelon lychee drink - super refreshing!
author: Sam W.

description: What can I say.  The pork Bahn mi is bangin!   Quick service. Great food.  Good price point.
author: Jason C.

description: Dinosaurs is located in a dingy weird mall complex, and the interior is equallh dingy. Boyfriend and I ordered a pork bahn mi and chicken/shrimp summer roll (incorrectly called "spring roll" on menu). The chicken/shrimp summer roll was decent, a little bland and quite revisionist with chunks of green apple. The pork bahn mi was terrible. The bread and pork were not made correctly. The pork was sliced thin and tasted like nothing, not the little sweet fatty chunks in good bahn mi.
author: Grace Y.

description: Dinosaurs is one of the few places you can stop for Vietnamese sandwiches late at night. This location is on our way home from the gym. It's a nice choice if you want a quick and easy bite to eat for dinner but aren't feeling like Mexican food. Prices are higher than average. My favorite banh mi spots are still in the inner Richmond but Dinosaurs definitely fills a void in the neighborhood and their menu offerings are interesting and different compared to a traditional style banh mi shop. I wish the bread were softer inside but overall the taste is satisfying. I'm more curious about the cans of condensed soy milk that I saw displayed. I'd like to try some of the drinks off their menu to see how I like it. Their menu tries to cater to a lot of different dietary needs which is great!
author: Alice H.

description:
The quality of these Vietnamese sandwiches is actually pretty good! I walk by this place all the time, and I've always been skeptical. One day, my favorite Chinese restaurant was closed, and while I was walking home, Dinosaurs was like my light in the dark. I decided to take a chance. I ordered The Special which has pork, pork loaf, and pâté with pickled carrots and daikon, cucumber, jalapeños, and mayo on a French baguette. WAY overpriced for a Vietnamese sandwich ($7.39) but very filling.

Another tip... do not come here if you are in a rush. Apparently good culinary work takes time at Dinosaurs. It takes ridiculously long for one sandwich to be made, even if there aren't many people in line. Totally worth it, though. Going to try the spring rolls next time.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I ordered the chicken bahn mi & the shrimp spring rolls off of DoorDash. Their food is actually pretty good and I enjoyed my meal. For the spring rolls they use apples instead of cucumbers, which I thought was interesting & didn't mind the sweet touch. The bread they used was toasted perfectly-- crunchy, but not too tough on the jaw. 

Giving a 4/5 mainly because of the price. In my opinion, banh mi & spring rolls should never be priced so high! I can get each of these items for $5 or less in Oakland, but I mean, what can I expect from San Francisco?
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Stumbled across this one afternoon. They serve delicious Banhmi sandwiches that are relatively big. I've always split them with a friend as a mid day snack.
author: Ann L.

description: Great place! I'm vegan so I got the tofu spring rolls and sand which to share with my boyfriend. Soooo good but kinda wish the tofu was fried on both. As I try to be healthy it would be great to have that option. But it sure was yummy! My favorite this was the mango mint smoothie though!! So good!!
author: Valerie W.

description: A-OK. I got the Grilled Prok Banh Mi and the Shrimp/Pork spring rolls and definitely was left wondering why I was paying the $8 premium. I get that this is San Francisco, but San Francisco also has the mom and pop Vietnamese restaurants where I can get this sandwich for $3 and it tastes better.
author: Alan L.

description:
3 stars for the avocado shake! They use vanilla rice milk and pure sugar cane instead of whole milk and condense milk and it tastes 100x healthier than reg avocado shake. Refreshing, less artificial than most places and is the cherry on top for your sandwich meal.

Sandwich: pretty steep for what I'm used to buying, $9 compared to $3.50 in San Jose. Nothing spectacular about it, other than it's a small little shop, but it is good.

Overall, I wouldn't come here too often cause it's pricey. But I'd recommend trying their avocado shake!
author: Angela T.

description: Love the Spicy Tuna sandwich and the Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Always a great treat. They are always fast and consistent. The bread is crispy and buttery. The grilled chicken sandwich and rolls are also good. Reasonably priced, and the sandwiches are large enough to share if you dont get greedy and just finish the entire thing.
author: Jesse N.

description: Was walking back from the urgent care in the Castro when I passed by this place which literally stopped me in my tracks due to the lovely aroma. I was hungry so figured I would pop in. I ordered the shaky beef and mango mint smoothie. Both were out in record time. The banh mi was out of this world and there were so many flavors dancing on my tongue. Get the mango mint smoothie! It was a nice, light, and refreshing surprise. Best thing of all was that it was a super filling a cheap lunch.
author: Carly H.

description: Love this tiny place! Good sandwiches and fresh rolls. Fast service and friendly staff.
author: Ayden T.

description: Love this place! This restaurant is pretty darn good. They make  Vietnamese sandwiches and have several types to choose from.
author: Carla D.

description: The Special is a somewhat refined version of the cold cut aka dac biet that you would get from a traditional vietnamese sandwich shop. The sandwich was packed with roast pork, but omits the weird stuff like headcheese that I enjoy. There were a ton of picked carrots, which are less vinegary then normal. Their bread was great. Though the flavors tasted dialed down in comparison traditional banh mi dac biet, it was a well put together sandwich and left me pretty happy.
author: Huey N.

description:
yum
delicious, reliably good every time
author: Tom M.

description: Best bread on a bánh mì baby. Rolls out quick
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description: Love all of the vegan options here! The crispy tofu sandwich is awesome. I always get it with the watermelon lychee smoothie. Would highly recommend!
author: Lina L.

description:
Definitely my favorite banh mí in San Francisco. I was tempted to give 5 stars, but the price (over $8 with tax) seemed a bit steep...

I really like the space. It's on one hand authentic feeling but on the other fun, bright, and semi-hipster-ish.  The dinosaurs, Sriracha key chains, and arcade game make it funky and inviting. 

The Special sandwich - a pork combo - is terrific. The bread was exactly what I had all over Saigon - sufficiently substantial but crispy and airy. The pâté was terrific and the veggie toppings were plentiful but not overwhelming. There was also plenty of jalapeños to give it some heat. 

Service was quick and friendly. The sandwich was ready in under five minutes and they accommodated my request for less roasted pork and more pork loaf and pâté. 

I will definitely be returning here!
author: Tay H.

description:
For a period of about 4 months, i essentially lived on the Bahn Mi's. I absolutely love them. 
Meatballs, and pork are my favorite. Love the large selection of eccentrically flavoured chips.
author: amit s.

description: People are super nice here. Dinasour makes mediocre, but okay, vietnamies sandwiches and spring rolls. I like it, it's cheap. The place kind of smell like cucumber which isn't great.
author: Ramin A.

description:
I love me some banh mi and while the banh mi was egg-cellent, the real star here was their fresh spring rolls! Seriously I've never tasted spring rolls so delicious

We ordered:

Grilled Pork Banh Mi: Solid banh mi, I think the BF seemed to like it since he ate it all in minutes haha
Crispy Tofu Banh Mi: The texture was good but it did taste a little plain without sriracha. Definitely prefer the spring rolls.
Tofu & Taro Fresh Spring Rolls: My favorite part of the meal! Each bite was fresh and crunchy! Comes with a traditional peanut sauce that was to die for. So creamy and nutty.

Very vegan/vegetarian friendly too! Also they have an interesting drink menu like the watermelon litchie smoothie, avocado shake, and mango mint smoothie that ARENT made from artificial sweeteners.

Also, not too many seats as it is a very small shop.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Solid Vietnamese sandwiches, although a bit pricy ($7) for a banh mi. I'm glad the meat isn't super fatty, yet its still flavorful. The portions are also quite generous, stuffed with lots of veggies! They go a little overboard with the mayo, but you can just always wipe that off.

If I'm in the area and craving a Vietnamese sandwich, I'll be back!
author: Janet H.

description:
Fast, tasty, and easy to grab on the go.

Call ahead if you don't want to wait for them to make the sandwich, but it's pretty fast one way or another.  Try their drinks as well, the Watermelon Lychee really hits the spot on a warm day
author: W L.

description:
Woke up and needed food. I've always passed by this place, but somehow never went inside. I love Vietnamese sandwiches so I decided to check it out once and for all. 

I ordered in for two pork Bahn Mi and one with LIGHT Patè. Walked up the street to pick up the sandwiches about 10 minutes after I called in the order and it was ready about 5 minutes after, I arrived which was awesome. 

When we got home and opened the wrapping the sandwiches looked fine until we started eating them. My sandwich w/ no Patè was coming apart all over the place. I basically ate it in pieces. The flavoring of the pork was amazing (don't get me wrong). I just wish I could have taken real bites instead of putting the sandwich together again everytime like a  Ban Mi Humpty dumpty. 

My partner got the Patè on his sandwich and they laid it on THICK. He had to scoop the patè off of each slice of bread with a spoon. Guess next time we have to ask for EXTRA LIGHT Patè.
author: Jamal P.

description:
Cheap sandwiches that don't skimp on its ingredients. Averaging from $5-6 makes me think SF could be affordable after all.

The reasons to dive-in +'s:
+ Sandwiches are priced cheap meaning $5-6.
+ You pay for the great quality and fast turnaround. It's a pick-up and go place although a couple tables allow some seating.
+ Great variety of sandwiches but grilled chicken and shaking beef are my faves so far.
+ Nice proportions: crunchy/chewy baguette, cilantro, shredded carrots, cucumber and your meat are stuffed by someone who doesn't skimp.
+ Salads (chicken/cabbage or shrimp/papaya) are the only two options but for $6ish it beats the Whole Foods $10ish.

The reasons to drive by -'s:
- Parking sucks here so if you are in the hood it's a great, quick and satisfying bite when you're on foot.
author: Yiven C.

description: Shaken beef sandwich and mango mint is the way to go. Don't forget to play arcade machine :).
author: Boris S.

description: Cute little Vietnamese place a stone's throw from the heart of the Castro. I only ordered the avocado shake but thoroughly enjoyed it. The avocado pairs well with the rice milk. Looking forward to coming back for a banh mi
author: Michael S.

description: Overprice, small, and average tasting sandwich. Not worth it. Would not come back or recommend.
author: Riley N.

description: Great tofu vegan banh mi and also has vegan Thai iced tea and Vietnamese coffee (With soy sweetened condensed milk)!
author: Emily K.

description:
The sandwiches here are $8. That is really expensive for a Vietnamese sandwich. They must be making $6 on each sandwich. I've tried three of their sandwiches are thought they were just  meh. They were the chicken, pork, and beef sandwiches. The bread was too hard and chewy, they add too much carrot - makes up like 50% of the sandwich, and the meat is just okay. If you're hungry and can't think of anything else to eat or too lazy to think of a place then come here. The food is edible. 

I used to come here but I stopped altogether a few months.
author: Scott T.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend who had the craving for a yummy Vietnamese sandwich even though that's not my thing. 

We ordered a special sandwich, spring rolls, a vietnamese coffee, and a watermelon lychee drink.

Although I didn't have the sandwich so I'll hold off my review, I can say I was pleasantly surprised by the spring rolls. They were made fresh to order and had a surprising sweet flavor due to the apples that Dinosaurs puts inside. The rolls were refreshing, crisp, and overall really yummy and I enjoyed them without any sauce. They do offer a 3 different sauces to choose from and we selected the peanut one, however I found it a bit to sweet for me and opted to eat the rolls plain. 

Finally the drinks were good. The Vietnamese coffee was strong and had a rich bold flavor as I've come to expect with these drinks, no surprises there. But what stood out to me was the Watermelon Lychee drink. Refreshing and not to sweet while still offering a very distinct watermelon flavor, this drink would be perfectly suited for a hot summer day paired with the spring rolls IMO. 

Overall a good experience, the line was a little long for a sunday but not going to doc them for something out of there control. I'm a fan and will be coming back for some more of these yummy rolls.
author: James C.

description:
My boyfriend showed me this spot only four days ago and we've gotten Dinosaurs sandwiches twice in that timeframe. By now I've tried the Shaking Beef and The Special sandwiches. Both are awesome and packed with fresh, flavorful ingredients at a really decent price. I'm not a huge fan of pate, so I liked the Shaking Beef better, but both are top notch sandwiches.

Also don't forget to check in here for 10% off!
author: Melissah L.

description:
Another awesome obscure find that's actually super popular, and for great reason! You might walk past this going down 16th because their main entrance isn't at the storefront, but look out for the Dinosaurs logo and everyone pleasantly eating outside, sometimes with their dogs.

The store itself is tiny. With the kitchen, front desk, and only like 3 tables indoors, it can feel cramped, especially with the line being out the door most of the time. Do not let that hinder your chance to get a swiftly prepared fresh and super flavorful banh mi of your choice! 

Most banh mis I get, the bread is too tough everything gets too messy and spills out, but Dinosaurs stands out with how proportioned and delicately balanced every flavor is inside their soft light bread. There are banh mis of different kinds and I couldn't decide which one to get! There was also a very interesting Kare Kare (beef with peanut sauce and shrimp paste) banh mi option off to the side which piqued my Filipino interest ha. 

Their smoothies are also something to take a long look at, because not only are their fruity flavor combinations enticingly refreshing (Watermelon Lychee, Mango Mint, Avocado and vanilla rice milk...), you can add alcohol to them as well!

Overall this is a hip and hidden banh mi place that should not go unnoticed! :)
author: Kyrie S.

description: The place itself is nothing special and it has three or four small tables, but the food is quite good and not too expensive. I got the Portobello sandwich (and added avocado) and it was great. I guess I would have to order more stuff to be able to offer more information, but so far it's pretty decent.
author: Marta F.

description:
Yum yum yum yum yum.

The shaking beef sandwich is pretty spectacular. Flavorful vinegary beef, delicious crunchy carrots.

I had the tofu sandwich once and there was some flavor in it that I didn't like that much... but i decided to give it another try and I'm so glad I did!

Prices are not crazy especially considering the neighborhood, food is delish, service is friendly and quick. Great spot to grab lunch.
author: Adrienne R.

description: Had the crispy tofu sandwich been better I would have given four stars. I like the concept. But the sandwich was not better - too much mayonnaise and the crispy tofu not crispy or flavorful enough. As others have mentioned, if judged as an authentic banh mi, the crispy tofu sandwich doesn't cut it. But maybe the pork does? Next time I'm at the library (across the street) I might try again.
author: Tim C.

description:
Dinosaurs is one of my favorite sandwich spots in the city. For Vietnamese banh mi, I would 99% prefer a hole in the wall, but Dinosaurs makes a damn good sandwich. 

My favorite here is the shaking beef, with that delicious mayo. The cost is great, the service has always been fast for me, the Viet coffee is on point and just as importantly dinosaurs = Jurassic World = Chris Pratt = awesome. 

Parking is a trail, but this is SF.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: I eat here every week and somehow the sandwiches continue to taste better every time! One of the best places to eat lunch in the area. Shaking beef sandwich is my go to. Also be sure to get the avocado shake.
author: Danny Y.

description:
I got the shaking beef sandwich that was highly recommended on yelp. It was definitely a good choice. The beef was very tender and flavorful. The bread wasn't too hard. Instead, it was crunchy with good fluffiness on the inside. The picked veggies were fresh and crunchy. They also peel their cucumbers, which most viet sandwich shops don't do. Overall, great sandwich. I definitely want to try their combo next time. And the price is a bit higher (a couple bucks) than what I'm used to for a viet sandwich, $6.

I also got their watermelon w/ lychee smoothie. I was expecting real pieces of lychee, but it's actually lychee jelly. It was also very icy, good thing it was hot outside to help melt it. It was ok, but I wouldn't order it again for $4.

Service was great! The cashier was very helpful in helping me use my paypal app. He also took my order very quickly and got my order started as I was trying to get my phone to work. Watch out, reception can get low in there! After paying, my sandwich was already ready for me! They're so fast!

With the paypal app with $5 refund with a purchase at Dinosaurs and my yelp check in offer for 10% off, I almost received a free sandwich! Except I ordered the smoothie too.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Everything about this place is fantastic, the Banh Mi sandwiches are a little bit more expensive than most traditional Vietnamese delis, but the finished product is well worth the cost. The staff members are awesome here, they definitely know their food inside and out and always use the highest quality ingredients to create a superb sandwich. The menu here isn't the largest around, but does include plenty of options to suit most everyone's taste buds. I personally enjoy "The Special", it has a nice blend of pork slices and pate, and includes just the right amount of peppers to give the sandwich a little kick, without overpowering the other ingredients. Also, the "Shaking Beef" is very delectable, all of the flavors pair really well together and the beef that is used is always juicy and tender. So, what are you waiting for? Go now and get yourself one of these sandwiches, but make sure that you grab an ice cold beer from their cooler, they have a great variety for cheap and they all pair well with any food item :)
author: Joseph A.

description:
I got "The Special" (slow roasted pork, fancy pork loaf, and pork pate) + mayo egg butter (under "Extras"). Literally licked the figurative sh*t out of the paper wrapper to eat the last bits of mayo+pate deliciousness.

Paired the sandwich with a watermelon litchi (fancy spelling for lychee jelly) smoothie. I was 5-stars satisfied.
author: David W.

description:
Dinosaurs = Saigon Sandwich for rich tech people, still a great value...
2x the price justified by +50% better quality and +50% for better setting 

If you don't feel like checking out the homeless flea market on Larkin, this place is yuppily between Ike's & the Castro, and gets you happily full for 10 bucks
author: Roger L.
