The best thing I've eaten all week, and this is after a steady diet of San Francisco's usual suspects (La Note, Mama's, Ike's, Rosamunde, Dottie's, La Taqueria, Souley Vegan) owing to hungry out of town visitors. Absolutely smashing, and under $5 for a substantial sandwich.

Since this is the first time I've ever eaten a 'banh mi' in my life I have nothing to compare it to, unlike the other reviewers - I don't know if this is the typical bread used (French roll), but it was tasty. I don't know if it's usually this size, but it was more than filling, and really, as much as I love bread I don't need to consume more than a foot of it in one sitting. My spicy tuna was as described - zesty, spicy and jammed full of pickled veggies - and handed to me with a smile within five minutes of ordering. What more can I ask for in a sandwich shop?
author: Kat F.

description:
I thought I would give this place another shot since I was in the neighborhood.
This place is not good. If you want good Vietnamese sandwiches go somewhere else. The iced Vietnamese coffee is really gross. I can make better Vietnamese iced coffee.
author: Edie G.

description:
I've checked in so many times here (10% off when you check in on the mobile app!) that I owe Dinosaurs a review. This place has become my reliable, go-to cheap lunch/dinner option in the Castro/Duboce Triangle area. While I'm a Ike's enthusiast, sometimes I can't fathom standing in the lines that it attracts, and Dinosaurs is always a fantastic backup plan (and a few dollars cheaper too!).

I always get the same sandwich, the Pork with avocado. Hits the spot every time. Service is quick and the guys who work there are usually pretty friendly. 

Big fan of Dinosaurs!
author: Joey M.

description: Best Vietnamese sandwiches in San Francisco. They people here have great customer service skills.
author: Anna P.

description: Love Dinosaur!  Their pork + shrimp spring rolls are great and love their banh mi.  Perfect spot for a quick bite
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Nothing stood out about this place accept for the Hipster name. The lemon grass chicken sandwich was not memorable. I expected to be punched in the face with lemongrass flavor. The crispy tofu sandwich was not crispy and rather bland. A they need to spice it up. I feel that Icould definitely make a better Viet Sandwich if I wasn't so lazy. I am inspired now since I know what I want. I would def have a signature sauce or mayo though. 

Vietnamese sandwiches in the south bay are  superior. The only thing I liked was the pickled veggies. They were really fresh. Saigon sandwiches still takes the crown for best SF Viet sandwich in my book. My SF Viet Sandwich quest will continue.
author: Wen C.

description:
This place has some amazing banh mi sandwiches. It's become a place I have to go to at least once every month. It's also relatively cheap at about $5 per sandwich, and I feel like you get a good decent amount for the price. I personally like the Shaking Beef sandwich, with added crispy tofu. And I get their Watermelon Litchi drink every time as well. If you're in the area I'd totally recommend going here for lunch.

Tip: If you want to save money but need to buy 3 or more sandwiches, there's a groupon for this place ($12 for $20 worth).
author: J. D.

description:
Was very skeptical at first, but tried their food during a rush, and was pretty good. Peanut sauce was not good, but eating it with the spring roll made the sauce seem much better than when it was by itself. 

Got my spring roll for about $7 for 3 big rolls. I thought it was worth it. What's not worth it is dining at their place. It's really run down...but hey, their food is good and that's what's important!
author: Elaine N.

description:
These sandwiches are just so amazingly delicious and I love them so much.  I used to live 2 1/2 blocks away and would come here at least once or twice a weekend, or more if I was working from home.  Now, I live 5 blocks away and I still come here all the time.  I'm hooked.. I'm craving it as I write this.  

Anyway, the Special with Extra Meat is heaven.  So is the Grilled Pork with added pâté.  The service is always friendly and quick, and there are all kinds of bonuses for frequent customers (like the FiveStars app which earns points toward free sandwiches, or the 10%-off-for-a-Yelp-checkin).  The jalapeno slices (just 2 or 3 per sandwich) are surprisingly intense and add a bit of danger and intrigue to your meal. Also one of the Banh Mi Artists behind the counter looks exactly like the mother of my childhood friend, so that's a bonus.

My one gripe: the Thai Iced Tea and Vietnamese Iced Coffee are delicious, but their ice-to-drink ratio is a little bit too high, and so they disappear from one's cup a little too fast.  

I love you Dinosaurs, never change. Unless that change involves giving us just a liiittle more Thai Iced Tea/Vietnamese Iced Coffee.
author: C. Diggory R.

description: Great great food. The right price and I m a returning customer. Why rate it at a 4 - you may wonder - because it's super under staffed and not sure the restaurant is doing anything about it. I should not wait 20- 25 minutes for a sandwich and a drink. How about increasing the help during lunch and dinner?  Or using an assembly line for sandwich prep - it speeds things up!  But you know what - it is so delicious I will deal with the wait. (Ps. Don't forget to check in on yelp - u will get a 10% discount! Chi- Chang)
author: Zita M.

description: Just moved over to SF and have been on the hunt for the perfect bahn mi. Look no further. The grilled pork is where it's at.
author: Dawn S.

description: The sandwich was really good, definitely one of the best Vietnamese sandwiches I've had, but the service wasn't to good, specifically this one woman. She was fare skinned and really skinny, but she wasn't very friendly and expressionless. If she was more friendly this place definitely would have gotten five stars.
author: Christina S.

description: Absolutely delicious. Had the shaking beef. Awesome sandwich stuffed with tender beef and TONS of pickled carrots.The sandwich is so filling but I couldn't stop eating because it was so delicious. It was a spiritual journey of flavor. AMAZING!!
author: Adam S.

description: My favorite banh mi on the city. Though there may be better or cheaper, these are the most bang for the buck. Quality ingredients, great selection, and always tasty.
author: SteveTwentyThree S.

description: The sandwiches are all right, but I didn't have enough room for a roll during my weekend lunch. The place was pretty packed on a Saturday afternoon, but I noticed not a single person working behind the counter spoke Vietnamese.  (It's part of my checklist when scoping out a Vietnamese eatery.)
author: Lisa R.

description:
Eh, shops like Dinosaurs overglorifies the banh mi. Banh mi was never meant to be a $6 sandwich. I was underwhelmed by the patè sandwich. Maybe it was the texture, but the patè actually really grossed me out. The chicken banh mi was nothing to write home about either. Nothing about Dinosaurs is worth coming back for. On the same street and for a couple dollars more, I'll go down to Ike's for a sandwich.

Overall...just as I started this review..."eh"
author: Brian L.

description:
Yelp just reminded me to review this place and I have no idea why I never have? If you don't want to venture far into the tenderloin for Little Saigon, Dinosaur is your second best best for Bahn Mi in San Francisco. 

The prices are a bit higher but you always get a fresh loaf of bread instead of the occasional stale loaf you'd get at other places. It's upscale Bahn Mi but it's damn good upscale Bahn Mi.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Asked my co-worker what was a good quick lunch place around the Castro and he recommended this place!

Totally got lost trying to find this place in the Market entrance and walked past 2 blocks before I realized I had missed it. Then I whipped out yelp to find some pics and spotted how the 16th street entrance looked like and went in that entrance.

Anyway, since my co-worker recommended the shaking beef, I got that to go. There's a 10% discount off entire purchase when you check in, but it didn't really make much of a difference.

 $5 was a tad expensive for a Vietnamese sandwich, but it was well worth every penny for this guy.

First bite was completely orgasmic and I devoured half of the sandwich in an instant. I don't eat a lot so I just saved the rest for later. 

This was most definitely the BEST Vietnamese sandwich I have ever had and you can bet on me coming here more frequently and trying their other popular sandwiches.
author: Harriet W.

description: The bahn mi and spring rolls are delicious! But only giving them 4 stars because the price is double what i would pay in Chinatown.
author: Vicky H.

description: My 15 year old and I visited for lunch today. We enjoyed the fresh sandwiches, I got the dark meat chicken and my son got the steak on French Baguettes. The atmosphere is casual. It's in a great environment if you enjoy walking! We will be back!
author: Diana J.

description: The Vietnamese sandwiches here are delicious. The bread was fresh and crispy, the spice was just right, the size was generous, and the sandwich was warm just like I asked. I'll definitely be back.
author: Damian E.

description:
After much anticipation because of friends telling me how good the Bahn Mi is here the hopes were very high that this was going to be one of the best viet sammy's in the city.

Almost $20 later for two sandwiches and a drink left with our heads hung in disappointment.  Both the combo ham and the pork it just seemed like something was missing.  The flavor was just super bland and the sandwich overall was dry.  Very very little meat in both sandwiches.  Was there supposed to be pate in the ham sandwich, maybe that is why?  When the compliment toppings out weight the primary ingredient, not so good.  

I cannot say I would recommend trying, to me these sandwiches are extinct.
author: Grubnoisseur Y.

description: One of the most flavorless, bland tofu banh mis I've ever had.  Why do people rate this spot so highly?  Bleh, everything in the sandwich I ate was boring, even the jalapeños were not spicy.  Pass.
author: CC C.

description: I am addicted to the pork and shrimp spring rolls.  It is all I have ordered there.  I find the staff are nice, the service is quick (one minute for spring rolls more for sandwiches).  I get the peanut sauce and sriracha on the side.  I have also tried the fish sauce, it is good too but I prefer the peanut sauce.
author: Alison K.

description:
After being bookmarked for a while we finally got to try this place. Yeah it was good, but not amazing! 

I was mainly disappointed because of their bread and carrots. The bread was weird, and the carrots were not as pickled as other places which made the samich bland tasting. I wasn't expecting anything special about the fancy pork but just to put it out there, it tasted just like regular fancy pork you buy at a clement supermarket. The pâté was very tasty and plentiful.

I didn't have this amazing samich experience I expected, but maybe it was just an off day. I shall try again!
author: Oriel F.

description:
Dinosaurs was delicious. I've never had a vietnamese sandwich but they are all the rage these days. This spot is conveniently located across from the Castro library so I plan to come here very often from now on to grab a quick bite.

I am a vegetarian so I had their shredded tofu sandwich. AMAZING and only 5 dollars so you can't go wrong. I love that they include big slices of jalapeno in every order. I'm going to try the watermelon smoothie next time I pop in.
author: Vidya K.

description: Special sandwich of roasted pork, fancy pork loaf and pork pate` was moderately spicy, tasty and very filling.  Staff was pleasant and helpful.
author: Phil R.

description:
After moving here from Seattle, one of the things I had a hard time finding was an equivalent to my beloved $2.50 bbq pork bahn mi's from the International District.  Needless to say, I was psyched when I found Dinosaurs.

Don't get a bahn mi anywhere else, k? Especially if you've never had one. These are the best! 

Oh, and my vegan niece who doesn't eat anything went here twice when she was visiting.  Not one but TWO vegan options for her picky palette.
author: Krista M.

description:
I've been supporting Dinosaurs from the very start, and will continue to support them to the very end. 

1. They make delicious sandwiches.
2. They have a friendly staff.
3. They have an awesome Jurassic Park Pinball machine!

Keep up the good work guys!
author: Dennis L.

description: Don't trust anyone who doesn't like Dinosaur. On top of the killer name, the sandwiches are: cheap, quick, and delicious. Standard patio area with a somewhat unfortunate view. Main complaint would be the lack of siriracha bottles to go around the, typically, full 2 seater tables.
author: Regis L.

description: The spring roll and sandwiches your shop has are delicious, we eat often. Your shop is very clean and neat.But that is a tall and slim guy in your shop has a habit of pulling up his pants and touch the food without washing his hands. It is disgusting. Please stop doing that.
author: Denise M.

description:
As a bread snob, I usually disapprove of banh mi bread, but Dinosaurs knows good bread. That alone would have made me happy, but I also love how peppery their pickled carrot and radish are. 

Be careful if the jalapenos! For the longest while I didn't even remember they added jalapenos because they weren't spicy at all. The last few times I've visited, however, it's just been ohgoditburnsitburnswhydoesitburrnnnomomomsotasty. Better order a watermelon lychee slushie just to be safe. I haven't tried their other drinks, but the watermelon lychee is great, and they use real watermelon (you can tell because it's got a few seeds in it) and I like chewing on the lychee jelly.
author: Lady V.

description: Oh my god the smoothies were SO GOOD. Would totally spend $8 for both the watermelon lychee and mango mint and share it with friends again.
author: Ashley Q.

description:
These guys make a mean bánh mì, and to top it off, they take credit and debit cards! A true rarity among Vietnamese sandwich places in San Francisco.

Sure, these aren't your Tenderloin 'namese sammies that go for under $3, the kind you can also arm yourself with to level up your hipster foodie cred. They are, however, pretty genuine as far as I can tell, and pretty darn tasty. And I'll take a sunny sidewalk seat in the Castro over a Tenderloin hole in the wall any day, even if it comes at a $2 surcharge.

I like the pork!
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Banh mi for $5? Score!!! Dinosaurs never fails to deliver, and with the OrderAhead app. I don't have to wait in line for my sandwich either.

If you want to spend a little more, the avocado shakes are a nice treat.

Dinosaurs is such a great inexpensive option in the Castro, where everything is overpriced. I refer people to it all the time who are in the area; it's an amazing hidden gem.
author: Denise B.

description:
Banh Mi in San Francisco has never tasted this good!

I was thrilled that my sandwich tasted fresh, the bread lightly crunchy, and most of all tasted healthy.

Unfortunately, within the hour I was hungry again. I think next time I need to treat myself to two, or take one to go! They're affordable and really light on your tummy, perfect for when you don't want to eat too much!
author: Ivan L.

description:
Stumbled upon this place driving by and decided to try for lunch.
 
Their banh mi was delicious. Tasty, fresh, generous portions and inexpensive. What more could you ask for? I had the special (roasted pork, pork loaf, pate). I also tried the spring rolls but was not a fan. Skip those.

Check into yelp for 10% off.
author: Ashley K.

description: The food was good, but geez was it expensive for some Viet deli food. Sandwiches that I usually buy for $3-$4 were damn near $9 here. Spring rolls were also very pricey but I can't recall how much exactly. Either way, I paid the price and there's not really any regrets. Both the Special and the Tuna were really yummy. The spring rolls were also very nice. I feel like this is a place that you should definitely try out to see if you're willing to pay the price again.
author: Danny T.

description: Between the friendly service, awesome vegetarian sandwiches, occasional bumpin reggae music, and cute patio- this place is amazing for sammie in the Castro! Highly recommended for vegetarian Bahn Mi!!! A little on the expensive side but it has this Bistro type thing going on which separates it from the hole in the wall type shops.
author: Alex F.

description: Tried the Crispy Tofu sandwich and it was $7 each plus tax.  I say it's a very good sandwich but I did find the cilantro was not as much as I would have liked (maybe next time I will ask for more cilantro and jalapenos).  I don't know if this sandwich is 100% vegan and prepared with no animal juices or sauces, but it does taste good and the quality is high.  For $7, I guess I'd expect that.  I was going to go to Saigon sandwich shop on Larkin St. in SF but read from someone's post that it's Tofu sandwich is made with meat juiced Tofu, which is playing around with representing itself as a Veggi Sandwich.  I would go to Dinosaurs again, but not too often.  I will try other places to see.  If anyone knows of another 100%vegan Vietnamese Sanwhich that is real good, let me know!  Thanks!
author: Joe T.

description:
I had only had banh mi once before this and I wasn't sure what to expect, but this place was great! I was pleasantly surprised with the crispy tofu banh mi. The bread was perfectly toasted and true to its' name, the crispy tofu shreds were amazing. The jalapeno slices provided just the right amount of spice.

Quick service and at $5 for a sandwich, it's a steal.
author: Pooja V.

description: Dinosaurs has decent banh mi that's a bit overpriced. I really like the shaking beef and the crispy tofu sandwiches. But, if I hadn't had my Groupon deal (50% off), then I would probably not be eating here. The ingredients are fresh, the bread crunchy and the whole thing cooked just so. But, it's not a great value for a regular meal. Especially since I need at least two to be full.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
I only come here when I'm in the area  because it's quite far from where I live and pretty pricey compared to Saigon Sandwich in the Tenderloin.

Their sandwiches are delicious and very very filling! I'm a big fan of Vietnamese sandwiches probably because of the pickled radishes and carrots and extra crispy bread...ohh and the meat helps too :)

I do recommend trying this place if you are in the area but if you are looking for something cheaper and as good or maybe better try out Saigon Sandwich!!!
author: Vickie Z.

description: Make sure your avocado is fresh, this is the third time this year I received a nasty black, grey avo. Shame, we in Cali blood, need me that fresh ass squishy green.
author: Smoke N.

description:
I live down in Monterey so I don't really know a lot of places to eat here in the city but let me say Dinosaurs is off the hook!! I came up to visit friends for the Castro street fair and we originally were walking to the sushi place next door but they were closed. As we were leaving I happen to glance over at the menu for Dinosaurs and read one of the sandwiches had pâté on it which I happen to really like. So I decided to give it a try after my friend assured me Dinosaurs is always legit.

Walking in that door and ordering "The Special" was both one of the smartest and dumbest things I have ever done. OMG people this sandwich was sooooo good, the sweet and crunchy from the pickled carrots and daikon, the salty and savory of the pork and the bite from the jalapeños!! I was in love after the first bite. As soon as I finished my sandwich I promptly ordered a second one for later cause I was HOOKED!!! 

Now I have to go back to Monterey and figure out what to do with my life with out this wonderful sandwich =[ LOL guess I'll just have to come to the city more often!!
author: Mike C.

description: Out of the way under a Market Street strip mall. Delicious, fresh and pretty cheap. Worth the wait when there's a line.
author: James D.

description:
I love their charbroiled pork banh mi! The meat is tender and the bread has that perfect crisp. There's nothing fancy about it, which makes it even better. Everything always tastes fresh and flavorful. Try their mango mint smoothie, very refreshing. 

I appreciate their outdoor seating because boyfriend and I can bring the dog to eat with us. He usually gets his own chair and table... talk about spoiled.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I agree with Alan P---they need to get a sign on the market street side! Totally missed it, but yes, you have to go thru that sketchy looking alley and it's at the end. or you can just go in thru the 16th street side. 

I ordered the avocado smoothie and "the special" sandwich, and my fiance ordered the beef with extra tofu...my special sandwich was mediocre, but his was amazing! I'll definitely be ordering that next time.

I don't usually order avocado drinks but thought it sounded interesting. It's a little thick for me, but I don't have much to compare it to.  I like the rice milk touch though. I wouldn't order it again though. Maybe I'll try the watermelon lychee drink next time!

The wait for your order is a bit long, but luckily it was a gorgeous day so we sat in their outdoor seating area and enjoyed the sunshine while we waited.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
Really good spot for a quick and filling lunch while not spending a ton of money. Their bread wasn't as soft as I like, but their grilled pork was on point and they have a wide variety of sandwiches to explore. 

I've had better Vietnamese sandwiches out in Richmond, but, if you're not willing to travel, this is a great spot. Didn't get to try their drinks but definitely want to check that out next time.
author: Christina R.

description:
I love Ikes, but sometimes you don't need that much of a sandwich (nor have that much to spend.) This is when Dinosaurs comes into play. 

If you're vegan, you're going to have a hard time finding a vegan vietnamese sandwich anywhere. Like many reviewers have mentioned, Little Saigon's tofu sandwich is NOT vegan. Dinosaurs vegan sandwich most certainly is, and it is good. I like to pair it up with the jalapeno kettle chips and coconut water. Soon I hope to be pairing it up with a coca-cola, as they have a brand new fountain machine. Glad they're coming to their sense, because who drinks pepsi anyway?

To reiterate a tip I've seen here a few times, ask for extra veggies on the tofu sandwich. It's just better that way.
author: Jon T.

description:
This time I had Tofu Sandwich, which was actually great - filled with savory tofu as well as flavorful vegetables.  I also tried the Chicken Sandwich, which was filled with moist and tender chicken and vegetables.  

I really enjoyed my meal and on a nice day it's nice that you can sit outside.
author: Ken G.

description:
Too often, I've seen banh mi as an accessory at a restaurant with more menu options than sense. Amidst the endless choices at these restaurants, the banh mi gets forgotten, relegated to the shadows of pho or bo luc lac. And it ultimately just isn't that good.

This is happily not the case at Dinosaurs. Here, they've gone with the tactic that simple is good, and they crank out delicious banh mi and refreshments with unbelievable focus. It's refreshing to see a small menu where everything is guaranteed to be delicious and fresh, and where every ingredient has received some thought.

The drinks are refreshing, and not overly sweet. If you like honeydew, I highly recommend the honeydew smoothie. Otherwise, the watermelon one is pretty good. 

The spring rolls and chicken salad were also quite good, and tasted fresh. They do not skimp on the meat, and its nice that one order of spring rolls includes 3 of them, all with a good balance of meat, herbs (basil, i think?), and noodles. The dressing for the chicken salad was tangy and sweet, and went well with the cilantro and carrot.

Finally, the sandwiches are very good. The bread is crispy, but soft, and the toppings are fresh. I enjoy the special, which has some pork and pate. The meat is good and they don't skimp on it, but its also not overwhelming, and strikes a nice balance with the toppings (and a little sriracha!). I have friends who don't eat pork, and some that don't eat meat at all, and they've told me that the chicken and tofu sandwiches are also delicious. 

For a few bucks, you get a good amount of fresh food, and you can sit outside on a nice day! its definitely worth trying!
author: Zameer A.

description:
It's been a long time since I've had banh mi - perhaps too long. I know Dinosaurs is in a weird location for banh mi and most of the reviews talk about the 
special or tolu banh mi but in my mind it's the meatball that makes it worth eating at. The special is not as good as many other places (not enough pate) but the meatball, oh the meatballs! Warm, soft and tasty. Great stuffed inside a good french roll (soft bread and crunchy crust) with the pickled veg. I only wish there was more as my taste buds were craving it for a long time after I finished. Hubby and I agreed the meatball was the way to go.  Yes the prices are higher than in the TL, but if an extra $1.25 is a big deal to you ($4.75 for banh mi versus $3.50 in the TL) then you should rethink your eating out frequency.
author: Jean K.

description: Great food but mildly overpriced. It's hard paying almost ten bucks for banh mi, even if it has been 'fancified'.  Great smoothies and their homemade vegan fish sauce is amazing.
author: Martin R.

description: California style Banh Mi. Fresh, simple, with a small menu that is refreshing.  Try the watermelon lychee jelly juice, simply amazing.
author: Song H.

description: Awesome Vietnamese sandwiches! Don't miss the drinks, the watermelon litchi smoothie is amazing.
author: Olivier L.

description:
+6,000,000 stars for having 6 types of Bahn Mi on the menu. Include vegan and veggie options.

+0 for furniture, atmosphere - etc. I'm not even kidding. It's like you'd get at the sale after the bargain basement sale. Don't be butt-hurt DINOSAURS, I just gave you +6,000,000 stars for food, right? We're still pals, good.

Ok, +1 for having tables outside where you can face the sun while chowing. Ok, shake it off. Still pals. Nice.

Thanks DINOSAURS! Keep doing what you do!
author: Mark S. I.

description:
One of my favorite fresh spring roles in the city!
I absolutely love their fresh spring roles!!! It's fresh, crunchy, and healthy.
Their vietnamese ice mint and lime juice is also delicious!!!
I had my spring roles for brunch It's not heavy I always feel light and healthy after eat their roles.
Love this place!!!! I am definitely coming back very soon.
author: Jun Y.

description: Disappointed...tuna sandwich was like tuna fish out of a can, except it was so heavily peppered as to be inedible.  The meat in the shakin beef sandwich was just like a cheap cheesesteak sub.  Bread was good.  But you can tell this place is cutting corners on cost....the mango mint smoothies with coconut milk had no taste of coconut (I watched the guy make it and he carefully measured off only a tiny amount) and too thick and grainy to be drunk.  Also, no ambience, just a tiny room with a couple of two or three person tables.  Try Cafe Bunn mi instead.
author: Jay S.

description:
I love dinosaurs. Their Bahn Mi are more expensive than average, but they are bigger, more flavorful, and you feel really satisfied after having one.

I recommend the beef or the crispy tofu.

They also have a Mango smoothie that is perfect to pair with bahn mi and so so delicious. Also, their Avocado smoothie is one-of-a-kind, I only warn that it is creamy and rich, and is best paired with spicy food. If you like to drown your beef bahn mi in sriracha like I do - spring for the avo smooth. ;)
author: Jane H.

description: I have never heard of a spicy tuna banh mi until I came here. The combination of flavors was something my tastebuds couldn't imagine; boy was it fantastic. Definitely, wanted another one after I finished my first one. It's that good! The store is pretty cute too. They have Calbee shrimp chips and shrimp spring rolls.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Already a ton of reviews on this place, so not much I can add... this place rocks. I had the pork sandwich and the special sandwich, both times delicious. Nice seating area with a few tables inside and on the sidewalk 16th street side.

They do need to get a sign facing the Market street side, I had no idea this place was there until I found it on yelp. If you're going in on the Market Street side, go inside the creepy looking strip mall type place. Supplement store to the right. Alex gym upstairs. Take the stairs down and boom, Dinosaurs is on the left.

They make the sandwiches from scratch so it does take a few minutes. And if they're people in front it will take a little longer, but be patient. Good food takes time to prepare!
author: Alan P.

description:
This place is great! Amazing vietnamese sandwiches at a pretty good price for the castro -- though not quite as cheap as the 3.75 sandwiches in the Tenderloin, but that's to be expected. I've tried the them all, and so far they are all delish! Also, the melon icee drink is a refreshing delight!

My favs:
Special
Beef

Least fav:
Tofu - I prefer big chunks of tofu. They serve tiny shreds.
author: Soysizzle t.

description:
For the banh mi alone, I'd give it 5 stars. It's a tad bit pricy compared to how much banh mi's are usually cost, but the ladies who make the sandwiches are also quite friendly. It is a Banh Mi deli but they can definitely spruce up the place a bit more. But it in the end as a Viet, it's probably the tastiest banh mi I've had in SF, the pork is real pork not just the processed stuff, and the bread taste fresh and has a nice crisp to it. 

The Special + Roasted Portobello = $6.67
author: L V.

description:
I finally got around to trying this place out! I'm really glad I did. The sandwiches are great. There is a good balance of everything, although I do wish there was a little bit more meat in them.  The service is really great too. I actually ordered my food online though the app they link you to on their website. It worked really well and the food was ready when I got there!

The spring rolls are okay. I felt that there was just a little too much basil/cilantro and not enough meat. The sauce was really good, but coud be a little bit thicker. I probably will not get the spring rolls again, but I will definitely be back for the sandwiches!
author: Breniel L.

description: tasty vietnamese sandwiches in a part of the city where there aren't as many options in the same category of food. quick, convenient and price is on par for the neighborhood. Not as cheap as the TL but it's a quality sandwich so it's worth it if you find yourself in the Market/Castro area.
author: Tiffany W.

description: The grilled pork banh mi was solid, but I was a little disappointed with the bread to meat ratio. For a $7 sandwich, I expected more pork. I also enjoyed the refreshing watermelon/lychee jelly drink.
author: C K.

description:
While I'm certain the flavors and style of food here is delicious to many, it just wasn't for us. We happened to be starving after a long day of hiking and traveling, so after reading reviews we decided to check this place out.

We ordered the banh mi and spring rolls. The rolls tasted a bit like they had been sitting for a while, perhaps not as fresh as they could have been. The bread and chicken from the sandwiches were also dry, with the chicken being a bit more chewy than expected and sauces having a slightly pungent flavor. My wife also found an insect in her banh mi which distracted from any redeeming chance for a good meal.

I left two stars because the gentlemen working that night were quite friendly and nice, plus it may have well just been an off-night. We will probably try to go again in the future, but our first impression was definitely lacking.
author: Ben W.

description:
Unlike your typical Vietnamese sandwich joint, each sandwich here is carefully crafted to be easily eaten (yes, it fits in your mouth) and not make a mess. They're also all fully loaded. I'm usually anti vegan, but their crispy tofu banh mi is my favorite. $4.75 a sandwich, yea that's a lot, but it's still better than the typical $6+ American sandwich.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Although its address is 2275 Market St, this restaurant is accessible only through 16th St (a red painted building a few steps from the corner of Market and 16th).

Their Banh Mi might be pricier at $5 if compared to Saigon Sandwich at the Tenderloin, but it's still a steal (and a better deal compared to Subway), considering its location near Church and Castro.

If you're a little bit more hungry and a banh mi (french roll with tofu, beef, chicken, or pork) isn't enough, you can always add some fresh spring rolls (tofu or shrimp), and cool off with a watermelon lychee drink (pricey at $3.50, but so worth it on the warm days). 

Dinosaurs is a great place for a quick bite, and it doesn't seem to fill up as far as the tables/seats on weekdays (can't say for weeknights or weekends).
author: Charles L.

description: Was so disappointed...first off how can you charge 7+ dollars for a banh mi? The grilled chicken was so dry, pickled carrots were very sour and it was not at all filling. Was so excited to try this place but definitely won't be back.
author: Chauanh D.

description: I'm used to this Banh Mi place near my house, it's bang for buck I would say. But what I liked about this place was that my sandwich was served warm. It was different from what I was used too and the meat was seasoned differently.  Definitely recommend trying the Shaking Beef, not something you can find at a typical Banh Mi place. I really wanted to try their spring rolls but they ran out that evening. Super hole in the wall place with limited seating, but definitely a place to try if you're passing by.
author: Alyssa M.

description: Call me cocky, call me picky, call me whatever, but it is not easy for food to impress me because I make some damn good food myself. Dinosaurs, however, has blown me out of the water. I had The Special, which is basically pork-three-ways (not a pork three way, that's different). "Delicious" does not cut it. Just go try it. The sandwich is the epitome of the perfect sandwich in terms of sight, smell, taste and texture. You will not be disappointed with the unpretentious, good-hearted, and great-tasting food Dinosaurs offers.
author: Hunter Y.

description:
We had a groupon and bought four sandwiches -  2 tofu 1 chicken and 1 pork.
I've had banh mi sandwhiches before and simply wasn't that impressed
The bread was great, 
the tofu sandwiches seemed dry i would give them a 2.5
He really liked the pork prob a 4 but the chicken was a meh also

This place was crazy busy, the ingredients seemed fresh I was just underwhelmed in general
author: Coco J.

description: Had the Special sandwich. Pork bahn mi with pate. Perfect ballance of soft bread with crispy crust, sweet daikon, sweet carrots, spicy jalapeno, crisp and fresh cucumber, cilantro, meaty pork, more meaty pork, and a creamy earthy paté. Service was good, quick coming out. About 5 bucks. Sriracha available. One of the best bahn mi in the city. Shaking beef sandwich is hearty and tastes homecooked.
author: Adrian A.

description: All in all, a solid banh mi. For me, shaking beef is the way to go.
author: Evan H.

description:
I can't believe I walked by this place so many times without checking it out. A real gem for fast, tasty food in the Castro. I was recommended to get the bánh mi special and it really hit the spot. At $5.70 it also didn't hit my wallet.

The staff were friendly and efficient on both occasions I've been here to date. I'll be back for sure!
author: Seán O.

description: Can't get enough of this place.  The food and staff are quality.  Highly recommend.  The staff are friendly and freely gave me directions on how to get to my next venue.  Prices are affordable.
author: Holly B.

description: I should warn you, I don't eat of the swine - so you may wish to quit reading this Bahn Mi review.  Go eat some pork rinds or drink some bacon-ice-tea.  If you are still reading, this ain't all that bad a place for a Bahn Mi.  They make a nice sammich here for sure...the chicken is hit or miss (as in sometimes its nicely cooked sometimes its bland) and the veggie comes with some kinda vegan mayo which i cannot stand.  But for the price and location...it keeps calling me back.
author: David S.

description:
sandwichs are reeaaalllly good
fresh bread, good portions of meat, enough but not too much sauce.
Overall, it is a very nice little place to stop for a Vietnamese sandwich.

Also the iced tea was delicious 
quick service considering the fact that the sandwich is made on the spot
author: Jonathan Q.

description: I love this place, I come all the time. However, the last few times I went, my avocados are always putrid. Guys, just throw out the old avocados, that will keep me coming back for more.
author: Patrick S.

description: Dinosaurs isn't exactly the most authentic but the Shaking Beef bahn mi as well as the special Kare Kare bahn mi are BOMB mi (if you can handle it, make sure to ask for extra shrimp paste!) The pork and shrimp spring rolls are pretty on point, but the tofu and taro spring rolls are dry and underwhelming. The mango mint and watermelon litchi smoothies are recommendable!
author: Andrea D.

description: Wow.  Huge price increase.  Nice note saying that SF wage increase causes them to up the price of a sandwich by $1.50 but I can do the math.  Off to Lee's sandwiches for me next time.  But I do like the special sandwich which I have been getting for years.  4 stars for food, minus one for price.
author: Thor B.

description:
Stopped in today to pick up a quick bite before dropping my boyfriend at the airport :-(

I ordered the crispy tofu and he ordered the pork. The crispy tofu was not exactly what I was expecting, it's shredded rather than chunks, but the pork was delicious! I will definitely be getting that next time.

I didn't read the fine print about what they put on the sandwiches very carefully, so I was surprised to get a big bite of jalapeno! If you're a spice wimp like me, I recommend leaving those off... 

$4.75 seems like a bargain to me. I'll be back!
author: Rachel E.

description:
Went back based on managers note to me. The rolls were better. They are not Out the Door level nor should they have to be however they were fresh and the greens had been washed. I went back a second time and enjoyed them again.
Now, based on how the manager was so kind to respond and did so with such grace and care, Id like to share that those that work at the Castro location are not well trained and I often have to repeat what I want a few times.
author: Kate S.

description:
Definitely one of the most mediocre-to-bad bahn mi's I've had in SF and easily the most expensive. ~6pm on Thursday, ordered the (non-special) pork, no mayo (never do mayo), no jalapenos (I prefer straight sriracha). 

The bread was okay, nothing special. Definitely on the chewy side, not very crusty. Reminded me of the Safeway bakery rolls. 

The pork was impossibly tough and concentrated on one half of the sandwich. Seemed like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for hours. In an unexpected twist, the sandwich was coated in salt and pepper, possibly to try to hide the terrible pork. Well-seasoned meat should stand on its own. The pork was definitely the low part of the experience. 

Pickled carrots were overly sweet, but there was enough cilantro to provide some flavor. Edible, but nothing special. 

It's possible that I'm spoiled from my years in the inner Richmond and maybe I should have known better, but I definitely won't return here.  Would have been worth walking to Duc Loi instead.
author: Michael H.

description:
I came across this wonderful place as I walked to catch a show at Cafe Du Nord.  The name of the shop lured my brother and I in easily as we became excited to see the menu that was filled with low prices and promise of delicious Vietnamese sandwiches.  Since I was unfamiliar with how great a Vietnamese sandwich could be, I asked the kind young man behind the counter for his recommendation.  He suggested the "Spicy beef" saying it was his favorite and I decided to take his word for it.  I also wanted to try their spring rolls but have a fear of shrimp so they offered to make me a chicken or pork only version.  When the food came a few minutes later, my brother and I quickly rejoiced as our taste buds met the tender flavorful combination of cucumber, carrots, noodles, meat and bread together as one happy family.  

I highly recommend this little treasure and am excited for when I get to go back.
author: April L.

description: fantastic vietnamese sandwichs  beek and pork   so great taste   i need to return back when i will be at SFO  thanks
author: christophe b.

description: I was skeptical to be getting banh mi in the castro since it doesn't have the largest vietnamese population buuuut it was pretty good! Less gelatinous, more sort of pastrami like which makes sense if you've shooting for more western audiences.
author: Misha T.

description:
Good & Cheap
You have to be lucky to get a seat, so figure on taking it with you.
Staff can seem like they are being short with you, but they just want to move the line.
author: Frank H.

description:
After running around SF a nice toasty chicken sandwich sounds about right.
I love their Vietnamese chicken sandwich. So toasty, warm, perfect amount of sauces, jalapenos and carrots. If your in the area and craving a Vietnamese sandwich this is the place to go.
author: Ella P.

description: Pretty good sandwiches but didn't expect to spend that much on a sandwich. The workers are very nice and Friendly and the location is in a great neighborhood perfect for walking around to get the food down!
author: Vanessa D.

description: This place is honestly the best Vietnamese Sandwich place I have ever eaten in my life. I have had all different types from all over California, but this place is Godly compared to the rest. Everything here is just perfect. I love the Shaking Beef. I highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.
author: Shaneel A.

description: Great lunch spot. Low key ambience. High key food. Bahn Mi sandwiches with portobello?  Yes!  Tuna?  Why not!  Amaze balls spring rolls.
author: Matt T.

description: I walked into this place without any experience in the food but had herd alot of good things. So I decided to drop on in. Wow what a find! Although pretty busy I think his name was Jerimie had excellent timely customer service. I orderd spring rolls an avocado shake and the shaking beef sandwich for dine in and received the sandwich and drink within 5 mins while being informed about my spring rolls great job guys.
author: James H.

description:
So, this is my new after-workout-when-I'm-by-myself habit. I used to go to Thorough Bread & Pastry but (a) they started putting sauce and crumbs on their ham-and-cheese croissant and (b) if I'm going to shell out $4 after my workout, why not come here and get a proper meal for an extra buck? So that's what I do, at least until I get fickle and go do something else :)

Anyhow, bang for the buck, this is the best place to get lunch in the Castro. In fact, it may be the ONLY place (outside of Subway) to get lunch for cheap in the Castro, now that the Castro is a tourist destination and not a dive neighborhood anymore (yes, I'm old). They have fresh carrot and daikon pickles. They have tasty fresh crunch bread that will scrape up your mouth a little bit. Everything on the menu is good, just order something, and if you don't like it order something else. The people who work here are cheerful and seem to have a decent job, which is important because I don't like being served by someone who is being shat on. I'm not sure how many times I've been here, maybe about a dozen. Number Ten and I used to swing by to pick up sandwiches to eat when we were both unemployed if we were going to walk downtown for an evening Meetup.

They open at 10am on Sundays. How many places can you get a sandwich at 10am on a Sunday?

The sandwiches are tasty. So far I've had pork ("special"), chicken, and "shaking" (- though not quite what the name would lead you to expect) beef sandwiches, also a pork wrap (because I know what shrimp wraps are and why not try something new?). I have yet to bite into anything here I do not like.
author: Amy T.

description:
I  cam here for  the grilled  pork a few days ago an it was overly fatty  and I was disappointed.  Today I  got the chicken and it was perfect.   Perfect bread.  perfect  vietnamese coleslaw and the meat lean  nicely grilled and tender and juicy and all for $5.

Finally  I do not know why people are complaining about rolls.  You come here  for sandwiches and they are good as long as you stick to the lean types of meat.  Plus eating out in the castro can be fairly expensive so to only pay  $5  is pretty awesome.
author: Christopher T.

description: Got the crispy tofu, not bad. $5 a little more than usual banh mi but good to try once. Still love Saigon sandwich though it's quite far from me.
author: W W.

description: You wouldn't come to Dinosaurs for the romantic ambiance, but you would come here for the delicious banh mi :) The sandwiches here are inexpensive & actually has a really unique taste. You can definitely sit down here & eat your food, but this place has a more of a grab a quick-&-yummy-sandwich feel to it. If you like meat & you're not too sure what to get, I recommend "The Special". You won't be disappointed :)
author: Alice H.

description:
It's exciting to be able to get banh mi in the Castro now.  Dinosaurs is a cute place with a red façade and simple interior with 4 small tables.  Love the dinosaur theme and the dinosaur artwork (especially the painting of a dinosaur chasing a banh mi dangling in front of him on a stick).  They introduced a frequent buyer card (buy 9 get one free).

The banh mi prices ($4.25 - $4.75) are about $1.50 - $2 higher than usual but it's understandable given the location.  Plus they have some unusual options for substitutions - whole wheat baguette and vegenaise.  They also sell Asian snacks and drinks (yes, soy milk - the perfect drink to have with banh mi). I've also seen spring rolls and steamed buns there.

There are 6 kinds of banh mi: The Special, The Pork, The Chicken, The Cold Cut, The Meatball, The Crispy Tofu.  

* The Special banh mi ($4.75): with roast pork, fancy pork loaf, pate, pickled carrots & daikon, cilantro, cucumber spear, jalapeno, soy sauce & mayo.  The sandwich was average to slightly smaller in size.  My first impression was that the flavors and textures were very good (chewy, crunchy, spicy, tangy).  The toasted bread was excellent - nice and chewy without being too hard.  The pate was great too.  Because the bread and pate were so good I didn't notice the flavorless, underseasoned meat right away. 
* Meatball sandwich - nice pickled, peppery carrots and daikon, the meatballs are soft but hold together, the meatball had more flavor than pork cuts though still on the underseasoned side
* Giant steamed bun: I liked the peppery ground meat but the exterior bun was a bit soggy.  It didn't have Chinese sausage but it did have a hard-boiled egg, peas, onions, scallion, and silver noodles.  

The main weaknesses were (1) carrots and daikon too finely shredded so  they weren't crunchy enough though they seemed crunchier during my second visit, (2) meat sliced too thinly and (3) neither the roast pork or the fancy pork had much flavor.
author: Lolia S.

description:
My friend brought me here when we needed a quick bite before a movie at the Castro Theater. I wouldn't have found it if she hadn't led the way. You can't see it from the street because you have to walk down a 'hallway' and a set of stairs. Once you find it, you'll realize it's easier to come in from the 16th St. entrance.

Great Vietnamese sandwiches. I had 'the Special' and it was awesome. Just enough cilantro and carrot, a decent amount of meat, and a nice fresh baguette. Really good. My friend enjoyed her vegetarian version (I think it had fried tofu).

My only regret was that I didn't get a second sandwich instead of a bag of chips. Don't have buyer's remorse like I did, get two. Or bring a friend and split the extra sandwich.  

When we went, they had a special where you get 10% off if you check-in on FB or Yelp. Not sure if that's a permanent thing, but it was nice bonus. And they had good music playing too. Not too loud, just good eatin' music.
author: Marcus W.

description: Yummy Vietnamese sandwiches. I tried the pork sandwich. My friend who is half Vietnamese informed me the sandwich is really called banh mi thit. I'll be back to this place to try the other sandwiches for sure!
author: Joseph Y.

description:
dinosaurs are now extinct but luckily DINOSAUR'S banh mi exists. 

Voluptuous sandwiches for under $5 that I devoured in merely 6 minutes + 10% off when you check in yelp/FB! 

-The Special Pork Sandwich $5: 3.5 stars. The essential crunchy breads complimented the tender porks and veggies. It consists of pate, "fancy" pork, roasted pork, cilantro, chili peppers, carrots and daikon. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#ZiKh_Zw7vyKXW6ZjE84FfA
-The Pork Sandwich $4.75: 4 stars. the toasty bread perfectly unified the grilled lemongrass pork with the similar cilantro, chili peppers, carrots, and daikon. I personally favored this one over the special because I was not too crazy about the pate. But that's just me. 
-The crispy tofu Sandwich $4.75: 3stars. WELL, my friends and I were HUNGRY and TIRED so we didnt realize it was a whole sandwich and thought it was a crispy tofu... *EMBARASSING* but we still devoured it. We didnt really taste the tofu much.... Nonetheless still good. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dinosaurs-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#ViEdM0QijxJI3Ysu5xEn2Q

I am DYING to try the avacado shake because it's my absolute fav viet drink! NEXT TIME! Customer service was amazing because the staff was friendly, patient, and enthusiastic. Although parking sucked, it was expected since it was in Castro. There were about 5-6 tables but we went when it was empty. BOOYAHHH. 

Definitely wont beat LA's banh mi, but it's pretty good. I will return pretty soon:)
author: Chena N.

description:
4 nom, nom, nom, nom's...... 

meatball banh mi sandwich was delicious!  and big!  i could only finish half... and the other half i finished the next day.  while the bread was slightly soggy after a day in the fridge, the other half of my sandwich was still tasty! 

when it's fresh, its even better.  i wanted to try their special AND their meatball, but could only fit one kind in my belly...... 

if you've had vietnamese banh mi before, you know that inside the sandwich there is usually some pickled carrots and radish - here it is crisp and nicely vinegary.  the bread is also crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside.  

my brother recommends the special or the pork banh mi's.  but don't pass up the meatball b/c that one is good too. 

sandwiches from Dinosaur are fast food that is not "fast food" - delicious! :D
author: Trish P.

description:
The bah minh are amazing! I always get the spicy tuna though I'm not a huge fan of spicy, but they have it just right, not spicy where you have no idea what you're eating and tears come out of your eyes. 

Also all the beverages are amazing, especially the mango shake and the avocado!

After coming here for the first time, I came back the day after and kept going there for almost a week in a row, until got ashamed that the employees already knew me and after realizing that not a good place to go after gym, but always recommend this place to everyone and they always thank me for this.
author: Sasha Z.

description:
"Why the heck does my buddy Mark A, keep checking in to this placed called Dinosaurs?" - me about a year ago

My curiosity was rewarded the first time I came here. I know there are more "authentic" banh mi places in the city but there's nothing that tastes this good imo. "The Special" is a delicious blend of pork and pate, served on a perfectly crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, baguette.

The folks that run this place are also super friendly and they've got some seating outside which is on point for a weekend afternoon.
author: Madhu P.

description:
Love this place! I come here for lunch about once a week. I'm a vegetarian so I can only speak to the fried tofu sandwich, but needless to say, I am hooked. The bread is the best part - so fresh and delicious. The sandwich is a little salty but I have no complaints. Plus, the price (for lunch in the Castro) is extremely reasonable.

Not only is the food consistently tasty, I have to say I admire the customer service. There's usually a young guy running the counter and he's super friendly and laid back. The staff is wicked fast and always smiling. I always appreciate their good attitude!
author: Katelyn C.

description:
Confession: I am a sucker for Vietnamese sandwiches.  So when this place moved into my hood, I was beside myself with joy that a craving would no longer mean a trip to the TL. 

I've had the tofu spring rolls (great!), and the crispy tofu sandwich three times.  The first time I wasn't so sold on the sandwich--the veganaise was a little bland, and it wasn't spicy enough.  The second time I ordered it with the regular Asian mayo and asked them to kick the spiciness up, and that put the missing flavors back in the sandwich.

Dinosaurs doesn't knock Saigon off its pedestal, but it does make the best bahn mi I've found outside the TL.
author: Dana S.

description:
I'm very much torn between 3 and 4 stars for this place. It's a bit disappointing for a banh mi restaurant when there are some really damn delicious banh mi places pretty close by but not walking distance close.

As for the food, itself, it's a little on the bland side probably to not turn people off to the normally sharp, bold flavors you'd find in a banh mi. The ingredients seemed fresh even late at night though. I would definitely rate Dinosaurs higher if not for better sandwiches elsewhere, and I'm not even really considering price.
author: Maciej G.

description: Yum. Friendly service. Outdoor seating. The chicken sandwich is my fave. More expensive than other buhn mi's, but it's in the Castro, they gotta pay rent! Still totally affordable and the avocado shake is pretty good. I'll definitely go again.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
I liked their bread... but there was way too much of it and not enough meat :(

The amount of meat in my "Grilled Pork" bahn mi was about a third of what was in my bf's "Special". The first thing my bf noticed when he saw my sandwich was the amount of bread. We traded halves of our sandwich and I actually enjoyed his more even though I prefer only grilled/roasted pork when it comes to bahn mi.

Howeverr, their Mango Mint drink was delicious! I enjoyed it much more than my sandwich so +1 star for that.
author: Stacey H.

description:
This place is hidden away on the lower level in the back of a building in the Castro. It was a bit tough to find, and parking can be a problem if you go during peak hours because there is only street/metered parking available.

However, I got the special, which includes pate, and it was definitely a great-tasting bahn mi. Not the best I've had, but I would have it again. The wait was a bit long too. But still, very tasty bahn mi.
author: Junel S.

description:
I have been to this place a few times now and finally feel it's time to write a review.

The first couple times I came here, I definitely thought Dinosaurs was worthy of a 4 or 5 star accolade. Given it's in Castro or Mission Dolores area, it's hard to find a good and affordable banh mi sandwich that doesn't cost you more than $5. On top of that, the place is warm and welcoming, ingredients are fresh, and the pickles are perfectly preserved, I think it's time to finally give my first 5 star review. But after going there yesterday, I have changed my mind and actually subtract that 1.5 stars..

It's fine that they want to just specialize what they are good at and stick with just 5 or 6 sandwiches. But a spicy tuna banh mi?? Umm I don't think so. That's the -0.5 star for adding this weird sandwich. On top of that, they changed the way they make the spicy pork sandwich, my favorite! Now why would you do that? The pork they now use is this weird cured pork. It's almost like a salami and not the real grilled pork that they used to have. Unfortunately this change is not for the better. Hence the other -1 star. 

Overall, this place is still decent and worth your time. Service is fast and staff is nice. The chicken sandwich and the spring rolls are still yummy. I will still recommend it.
author: Winnie A.

description:
The vegetarian bánh mì is fantastic! And that's saying something, since it's hard to come by in the first place. Pleasantly spicy, crispy, and the shredded tofu is perfect.

Yum.
author: Max E.

description:
Very, very tasty place for a quick, filling (and inexpensive!) lunch in the Castro. I mean, a terrific bahn mi and a drink for under $10? Hard to beat that!

I showed up around 3 pm and ordered their most popular sandwich, "The Special" (roasted pork, pork loaf and pate) and an avocado shake. The food came out quickly and was excellent. They serve their bahn mis on terrifically crusty/chewy baguette bread, with a little bit of mayo; cilantro, cucumber, pickled carrots and daikon radish (all the fresh vegetables are a great balance to the richness of the meat), plus some jalapeño for a little extra kick. The flavors are balanced and all meld together for one tasty sandwich, made even better by the...drumroll please...

AVOCADO SHAKE! People! This should be mandatory with your sandwich order! It's just avocado blended with vanilla, rice milk and a little bit of sugar and put simply, it's kickass. You get the richness from the avocado, the sweetness from the milk and sugar and it all comes together for a tasty, unique treat. And it's avocado so it's healthy, right? Right. *ahem*

Anyway - Dinosaurs is kind of tricky to find (I walked by it twice before realizing it was INSIDE the little shopping center), and it's small and not super pretty to look at, but again - great, quickly prepared food for an unbeatable price.
author: Sarah S.

description: I've lived here for two years. I come here all the time. Get the special. Mint mango smoothie is great. Seriously eat here.
author: Brian L.

description:
This place doesnt scream an authentic banh mi shop but.....
I did enjoy my banhmi!

I ordered the special and added pate and "crispy tofu" 
The banh mi was ginormous and I can see why it is call Dinosaurs.

I was a bit disappointed that the crispy tofu was actually not crispy at all.
The cafe sua da was not bad.

I was not a fan of the spring rolls... I will not get that again.
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
In love with this place. The sandwiches never fail in the taste and freshness department. Traveled through Vietnam and sandwiches here are on point and authentic. Spring rolls are always fresh and best crispy tofu rolls in the city! 

Two wonderful vegan sandwich options which is super nice. 

Workers are always welcoming and wonderful. 

Enough reading do visit them!
author: Jhon T.

description:
Dinosaurs is amazing. Instead of waiting fo 2 hours across the street at Ikes, why not get a sando in 5 minutes from Dinosaurs? The Bahn Mi is bomb.com for reals.  They have an interesting "hipstery" take on peanut sauce, but the spring rolls are still pretty good. 

Overall, delicious stuff and well worth it.
author: Daniel K.

description: I know Ike's is just down the street, and I've never tried their sandwiches but the lack of hipster douches makes it so appealing. Besides their bahn mi, they also have yummy fresh spring rolls with big honking shrimp in them and nice salads all prepackaged. I usually grab a sandwich and some spring rolls for myself and my fiancé and can get out for under $20! A real bargain in the horrendously overpriced Castro!
author: Jesse B.

description: This was my go-to lunch place when I used to work in the Castro! Ok, you got me - I'm actually not a fan of the authentic banh mi with pork and pate, so I'm completely obsessed with the fried tofu and taro banh mi at Dinosaurs. The pickled daikon and carrot are very well made. You can taste the vinegar, as you should be able to! Yes, you can definitely find cheaper sandwiches in SF, but this was most convenient for my half hour lunch break. I've also had the watermelon w/ lychee and mango mint drinks here, both were yummy. I'll be coming back here when I get back to San Francisco in a couple months!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Not impressed with the tofu rolls! All dressed up with lots of fillers!

When looking at the rolls, what you see from the package is really a thin layer of the tofu (probaby a teaspoon worth of it)  that covers half of the rolls. The inside of the rolls are fillers with mostly boiled cold rice noodles and a few greens.

Looking good from the package, but very little is good for your body!
author: Mango M.

description:
Overall a decent sandwhich, with fresh ingrediants, good price and quality overall.

We got the combo ham and grilled pork samis.

Grilled pork had very little meat although the bread was right on point
The combo ham was good, but didnt have the tradition headcheese meat that you get at say saigon in the tenderloin or from other "really' vietnamese sando places that gives you that nice chew and spice. 

We liked it, but wasnt in love with it, and certainly not mind blowing, the taste was missing something - the carrots and daikon didnt have that strong pickled flavor you get in traditional places either. Both me and my husband said something was missing. Jalopeno not the least bit spicy, something was just off.

Overall i think a decent choice of a "americanized vietnamese sami' but surely not the real thing.--oh and I've been to Vietnam. 

Glad i tried it? Yes. Would i go again prolly not.
author: Petri Y.

description:
I've never really sought out Vietnamese sandwiches before but after watching the Great American Food Truck Race on the Food Network I had been craving them.  We went this past weekend and had a great experience.  It's kind of tucked away so you definitely have to be on the lookout for Dinosaurs and the parking situation around here can be a little dicey.

The inside is pretty basic which is fine because the prices are very reasonable ($13 for two sandwiches and two drinks).  We had the special and the pork sandwich based on their recommendation.  I thought he special had more flavor and was a little different but was very enjoyable.  We liked both of the sandwiches and will come back here again.

I would have given it five stars but think they need to figure out better seating as there were a lot of people looking for seating and line formation as it was a little confusing.
author: Blake B.

description: We discovered Dinosaurs on our first day visiting SF. My husband and I ordered the pork sandwich which was absolutely delicious! I think we will go back before our week long stay is over.
author: Adriana S.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!! Came here with the guy friend & thee food is yummy and customer service is awesome!! 

Ordered the Mango Mint drink ($3.75), Shaking beef sandwich ($5), roasted chicken sandwich ($5), and chicken and shrimp rolls ($5.25). 

Mango mint is refreshing and it hit the spot. 
Sandwiches was I would say, the best I have ever had and the rolls was to die for as well. 

Come with you can!
author: Melissa G.

description: Some of the BEST banh mi sandwiches in The City!  I love this place!  Highly recommended!
author: Craig W.

description:
I heart Dinosaurs!  Had "The Special" sandwich last night after a day of debauchery in the Castro.  Walked in close to closing (10pm on a Sunday :) and they happily made 2 amazingly tasty sandwiches. The Special has pate and other pork products that was OUT OF CONTROL GOOD!
My roommate had the chicken and loved it.  This place is so small and cute, I hope they make it!  Straight forward and flavorful Banh mi, you can't go wrong.  The spring rolls, salads and vegetarian options looked delicious too.
author: Dawn D.

description:
Roaming around the Castro and wasn't really feeling like having an Ike's Place sandwich, but I was definitely craving a Vietnamese sandwich.  I turned to Yelp to help me find.  Came across this place and read that many people quite frankly enjoy this joint.  Since I was in the hood and it was close to Ike's while the hubby was waiting on his sandwich, I went for the go! 

Place is tiny with maybe three small tables indoors and three small tables outdoors, kind of a cramped place.    You see a lot of people placing orders and grabbing it to go.  Friendly staff, and total fobby Vietnamese women working in the back making your sandwiches and drinks.  It seems the only people with perfect English are the guys that take your order at the front.  When I got there I ordered my sandwich, iced coffee and spring rolls in Vietnamese which took the guy by surprise cause he said he's so NOT used to people ordering in Vietnamese.  Reason being is that I think this place attracts more Caucasians than they do Asians.  Not a problem with that at all so long as the food is good.  

I ordered the Special sandwich with no pate or mayo...not a big fan of either.  Meats were tender, bread was warm and crunchy, not your usual French baquette when you order a Banh Mi at any other Vietnamese Sandwich place, pickled carrots and daikon were seasoned just right with a hint of black pepper on top, jalapenos had the right amount of kick, but I did without them since they were too much of a kick for me.  I also ordered the Goi Cuon (Shrimp and Pork spring rolls) as listed on their menu.  These were huge, comes in 3 pieces with the Hoisin peanut butter dipping sauce...add some sriracha sauce to it and the sauce will taste even better.  I also ordered the Cafe Sua Da (Vietnamese Iced Coffee) a lil on the stronger side for me, but still tasty.  I came again the next day since we were in the area for Bay to Breakers and got the same thing without the iced coffee, but this time, got the chicken salad, it was OK, nothing special.  

Food was legit, prices are a bit on the high side especially compared to what I'm used to.  I can go to Chinatown in Oakland and get 4 Vietnamese sandwiches for $8.25 (buy 3 get 1 free) whereas here, the sandwiches are $5 and above.  The only downfall about this place would be the price considering I know I can get these things for much cheaper and space.  Quality of food is good, people are friendly, and a nice location.  They don't have a large variety of sandwiches as you would see in a normal banh mi place that has a large selection such as fried fish cake (yum), grilled chicken, dac biet (which is a combination of everything), etc...but it will do.  Would love to come back and try their other sandwiches.  You know what the place is also missing, tapioca drinks of all sorts...now that would make this place bomb!!!  Just a suggestion! 

As for the name, Dinosaurs...I have no clue where or how this came about...but I'm sure it must mean something to them.  So again, not your typical Vietnamese sandwich place which are normally called BC Deli, Banh Mi Ba Le, or something else of that nature.  Expect to spend close to $20 bucks here on lunch considering how many items you are planning on getting.  Otherwise, enjoy!
author: Mary T.

description:
my new go-to banh mi spot. This place is a no frills easy little sandwich shop and all their sandwiches are great.  They often have groupon specials too which is cool.

They also have a shaking beef (or a reasonable approximation to it for a sandwich place) which is somewhat unique and very tasty.
author: D D.

description:
My husband went out and found this place cause I had a craving for a delicious banh mi.  He found Dinosaurs tonight in the way home.  I'm glad we tried a new place. 

The sandwiches were ok. I've had better banh mis. The ingredients are fresh, but they're lacking in flavor.  The jalapeños had no heat and the other veggies very slight pickling flavor.  The special was my favorite. The combination BBQ pork, fancy pork and pâté were delightful. The grilled pork banh mi had very little meat.  

I'd go back for the watermelon litchi drink and to try some other dishes.  The extra star is for the watermelon litchi drink. Yes, I liked it that much!
author: Emily Y.

description: Great spring rolls, generous with the peanut sauce. I asked for more and they were cool about it!
author: Jon T.

description: We decided to come here on our way home from the peninsula and it was a great decision.  I decided to get the spicy tuna and my wife got the BBQ pork.  The bread of the sandwich had a nice crunch to it, the carrots, mixed greens and jalapenos were good but the spicy tuna was where it was at.  It had a good mellow but building spicy to it.  I am not usually a fan of tuna sandwiches but this one was fantastic.  When I was done with the sandwich, I really wanted another one and wish I had gotten a second with our takeout.  I would come here over and over again just for this sandwich, we will be back!
author: Scott P.

description:
Best bahn mi sandwiches in the area!

I'm mostly a regular here and you can get them for pretty cheap (around $5-6)

I've had the spicy tuna which was awesome until I realized its most likely canned tuna with siracha sauce (lame), but still good! Just don't expect anything too fancy.

Pork patte is also really good. I'd suggest the BBQ pork which is standard banh mi for most places but still pretty good.

The folks here are fast and friendly. I'm not really sure when all of a sudden Dinosaurs became really popular but I used to remember there were no lines long time ago but it seems like the popularity is catching on and every time I come here now there is a line almost outside the door. Good for Dinosaurs for getting more business.

Highly suggest.
author: Kameron K.

description:
Who would have known that this place existed? I was in the area for the Castro Street Festival.  Its a small place and somehow a tiny sign that said "dinosaurs" caught my eye. (I LOVE dinosaurs despite being a 23 year old girl) so i read on.. and it was my favorite- bahn mi.  I love vietnamese sandwiches.  So much I've driven at 3am 45 minutes to go to a 24hr lees sandwiches.  This is how much I love bahn mi.

I must say, it's WAYYYYY better than lee's! Their bread is good, sandwich is shorter but thicker, I don't know.. I just enjoyed the taste of this banh mi more than any other place i've had it.  I do wish they put more cilantro and jalapenos but I can always ask for it, and I do prefer the thicker cut picked veggies that they put in, but who cares, it was yummy! 

The guy behind the counter was super friendly and was chatting with us the whole time which was cool.  This place needs more publicity cause it's bomb!  If I lived in the city, fo sho it'll be my go-to spot!
author: Meena N.

description:
Go now, because it's only a matter of time before Dinosaurs has the same lines that plague any decent SF sandwich place within walking distance of a park.

They're a tiny bit more expensive than other Banh Mi places in the city, but the ingredients are all super fresh and service is stellar. These aren't super traditional Bahn Mi, but the changes they make are all improvements in my book (chief improvement: your sandwich does not smelling like a dirty diaper 10 minutes after you unwrap it).

Seating is fairly limited, so grab a Special and head over to Dolores on a nice day. Make sure you pass by the folks in line at Ike's and take a big bite out of your sandwich as you strut by. Nothing tastes better than being the subject of sandwich envy.
author: Mark A.

description:
Update: Went back and had another sandwich, and it was excellent. 3 kinds of pork in the Special! Three! Yum-mo! There are so many different kinds of drinks available, like a couple of kinds of coconut juice and thai chai tea and even water, great selection.
Family owned and run, I think, friendly folks, and did I mention there are 3, count 'em, three kinds of pork in their Special, and that's it's only $4.75? Such a deal, enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Cute local find. Good ole Yelp did me well when I made it to Ike's and it was packed so I found something else. This was BETTER. 
My friends ordered the spring rolls and the tofu bahn mi and I got the chicken bahn mi. Best bread I've ever had with a bahn mi. Hands down. And the veggies were nice and pickled without losing their crunch. The chicken was a little too fatty for me (wish it was breast instead of thigh meat but it was still delish). Definitely coming back.
author: Megan B.

description:
So. Good.
Eat. Here. Now.
I had the chicken sandwich and it was amazing. I also had the steak one, and it was amazing as well.
The mango mint drink is also great!
It can get quite busy, but it's great to take a sandwich to the park on a sunny Sunday afternoon!
author: Cami J.

description:
Been walking by this place forever - so glad I finally stopped.

The pork sando is sooo friggin delicious. The bread is very crispy too. Delish!
author: Monica S.

description: Yum. Love the pork and shrimp spring rolls and how there are choices for the sauce. Recommend ordering and paying before you get there as there is always a lunch line.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Tried the pork and spicy tuna sandwiches. Both really tasty. Service was prompt, prices are low, and we got a discount for checking in on Yelp. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Miffy Y.

description: Woot Vietnamese sandwiches! Exactly what you're expecting which is always awesome.
author: Medina C.

description: I just tried Dinosaurs yesterday with a client and they were great!  I ordered the special sandwich, salad and watermelon/leeche smoothie and it was all delicious!  I highly recommend!
author: Dave C.

description:
The Crispy Tofu Sandwich is likely the best sandwich I've EVER eaten. It was flavorful, delicious, and unique. If I had food like that at my disposal, I might actually consider becoming a vegetarian. 

The prices were reasonable, I thought.

The only caveats are that the selection wasn't as large as I had hoped, and they could work a bit harder to keep the tables clean. 

But the sandwich was so life-changing that I'll give a 5 anyways.
author: Brittany R.

description:
It's quite simple. You can either...

1) wait in line for an eternity at Ike's for an $8.00 stomach-killing sandwich that will ruin the rest of your day

or 

2) simply stroll up the street from Ike's for an amazing, simple (yet delicious) 'Nam sandwich for less than $5

PS: As all my fans know by now, any place that provides Sriracha automatically gets 5 stars.

Done!
author: Scott G.

description: Good cheap sandwiches. Not a lot of seating but I usually get food to go from here. The meatball sandwich is super good. Everything is pretty good I guess. I hate parking in this area though. I also hate parking anywhere in SF. I hate lots of things but dinosaurs is not one of them.
author: Wizardbunz Z.

description:
Tucked away across the street from the library is this little sandwich shop that is ridiculously good! The food is amazing and the cheapest you can get! I've been here about three times now since finding this place and I absolutely love it. They don't have too much on the menu but what they do have (for all those vegetarian/vegans out there) is vegan options! How great! 

Definitely will be coming back again and again!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
I love Dinosaurs. I also love dinosaurs, but that's another story.

This place has awesome banh mi. It's not exactly traditional, and it's more expensive than you'd find in Little Saigon, but I think the quality is definitely worth it, as is the peace of mind if you're vegan to know that what you're eating is actually vegan.

The sandwiches are assembled carefully with delicious pickled vegetables, cilantro, jalapenos, and whatever fillings you choose, like the crispy tofu + taro with vegenaise. It's great that they even have vegenaise.

The decor is also delightful, with lots of dinosaur-themed stuff.

All in all, tasty sandwiches (including a vegan one), inexpensive prices, and a fun decor/theme make this one of my favorite places in the city.
author: Edward C.

description:
This review is for their veg fresh rolls only. BLAND! TEXTURE = TERRIBLE! 

The roll was so dry The cripsy taro is just weird. The rice paper stuck to each other so the rolls came apart as I was eating them. I used up all the peanut sauce with one roll since it was so dry. Fresh Rolls downtown is much better in comparison.
author: Vrushali P.

description:
Yum!
I didn't want to wait forever at LIME to fill my tummy so I walked down the block and paid a visit to Dinosaur and left happy. I enjoyed the Chicken Bahn Mi which was about $5 (a tad bit pricier than most bahn mi). The bread of the sandwich was crunchy and soft at the same time which in my opinion, pretty close to perfect. Bonus points were given because the bahn mi had a hefty amount of meat and just about the right amount of dressings! My hat goes off to you, Dinosaurs!
author: C M.

description: I love their fresh rolls. The pork one is amazing. They're really fast and it's always fresh. Choice of three different dipping sauces and they're pretty generous with it. Three rolls in each order. Plenty for a meal for me.
author: Art L.

description:
My roomie and I found this place on Yelp after hanging out at Dolores Park on a sunny day, and we were not disappointed! Very tasty sandwiches, inexpensive, and nice outdoor seating. 

I felt like the spring rolls were slightly lackluster, but it didn't overshadow the rest of my good experience here.
author: Sean D.

description: 4 stars only for the shaking beef banh mi. everything is just average.
author: marc v.

description:
UPDATE 7/29/2012: The owner of this sandwich shop wrote me a very polite and respectful message. I think that says a lot about a business owner who clearly has had great reviews from other people. When I am in the area again I will be sure to check it out and update my next experience.

*there are better Vietnamese sandwich places*
#smallportion
#okfood
#betterplaceselsewhere

So I am new to the city and craving a good Vietnamese sandwich. Yelp pulls it up and I blindly follow. Dinosaurs are awesome too so how could this fail!

This place is a tiny little shop which is fine. Seems more of a takeout place anyways. I order my sandwich (the combo special) which had everything on it. I think it came out to like 6.30 which is more expensive than what I've seen.
