It comes out on this...what looks like barely a 6 inch roll. I'll give it 7 inches to be generous. Sandwich was ok, the pickled veggies were tasty. However, the jalapenos had absolutely no flavor, and it had this fatty mayo sauce that I think took away from the sandwich because that's all I could taste. The bread also wasn't the toasty french roll that got all over myself when I bit into it. 

All in all, enough for a quick snack, but there are definite better places here.
author: Kevin T.

description: Cheap Vietnamese sandwiches. My sandwich had lots of vegetables which was different from the regular ones I'm used to eating in San Jose. I tried the grilled pork which was tasty. If , i'm craving cheap sandwiches instead of Ikes i'll probably make a stop at Dinosaurs.
author: Jason L.

description: Pretty disappointed in my banh mi here.  Seems like store bought french bread that doesn't have that crunchy-soft texture that seems the trademark of the typical Vietnamese sandwich bread.  The veggies are too thickly and clumsily cut and the meats are overseasoned to make up for the inferior quality of the meat.  No subtleties to the flavors at all.
author: David O.

description: Great sandwiches, very affordable. Have tried the special and the roasted chicken, can't go wrong with either.
author: Krish P.

description:
Great Vietnamese Sandwiches. Good prices for the quality ($5-$7). Friendly little place. I've heard good things about 'The Special'. I went with the Spicy Tuna. Well made and toasted to perfection. Usually Vietnamese sandwiches don't fill me up, but these are pretty hearty. They don't look big, but they pack a punch. 

10% off for check-ins.
author: Arthur C.

description: The grilled pork goes hard, especially if you add avocado and siracha. Same goes for the chicken. The guys that work here are super cool, and put care into their craft, which all make for one happy camper.
author: Ashwin B.

description:
Mmmmm....delicious banh mi.  I'd been introduced to these via office lunches and suddenly got blindsided with a craving over the Christmas holidays. So I convinced my husband we needed to experience the banh mi and NOW. 

Dinosaurs is a bit tricky to find if you are following directions from Google maps or Yelp or your iPhone. It SAYS 2275 Market, and that's technically true, but what you will see from Market Street is a sort of stairwell, a couple of shops and a sign for a sushi place. What you have to do is head down the stairwell, and head towards the back. 

Once you have located Dinosaurs, prepare for tasty goodness. The rolls are nice and crispy, a good texture contrast with the pork and pate. The sandwich is just the right amount of spicy--and for me, priced pretty decently. My husband and I both had a sandwich and a drink each for just over 10 bucks. My husband who had never had banh mi before found it pretty tasty and said we'd have to come back. I'm always pleased to find something that appeals to his taste buds as well as mine, since I tend to like more arcane food combinations than he does.
author: Lis M.

description: This place is a gem.  The Mango Mint smoothie is phenomenal! Try it! The veggie bahn mi is great and I hear wonderful things about the carnivore portions as well.  Also Thai iced tea with soy milk just makes my life!
author: Emily T.

description: One of the better banh mi places in the city - not sure where the name of the store comes from? Maybe a ploy to get non vietnamese people to frequent the place? Anyhow, the banh mi sandwiches here are mostly well done, if a bit on the smallish side. I wish they put more pate in them and less mayo. Otherwise, Dinosaurs and Duc Loi are the two top Banh Mi's in the city in my opinion.
author: Henry W.

description:
I'm amazed at how often I find myself here, ordering the crispy tofu sandwich. You don't have to be vegan to enjoy. I bring all my friends here, and enjoy this sandwich almost daily for lunch. 

*Quick
*Friendly staff
*Good eats
*Clean space
*Simple menu
*Vegetarian/Vegan options

I will continue to be a loyal patron. LOVE LOVE LOVE!
author: Thomas Nathan S.

description: I had the The Special (pork) and it was just OK.  I've had better at other places.  My husband thought the Spicy Tuna was pretty good.  Surprisingly, the Meatball was probably the best.  Thumbs down for not accepting the 10% Off offer they currently have on Yelp.
author: Rose A.

description:
Finally I have found the ONE place in San Francisco that has amazing Vietnamese Sandwiches.  Honestly,  I am doing back flips!

YUM!
author: Faye D.

description: A nice hole-in-the-wall type place with very tasty sandwiches.  I frequent there regularly when I'm not feeling like stuffing myself with an entire meal.  They are the prefect size to put away that hunger in your stomach.  Always a good bet, and the folks that work their are very friendly.
author: Shane E.

description: My favorite bahn mi in the city! Not too big and not too small. Fresh, crispy bread, and perfect protein to veggie proportioning. They even have a dairy free vietnamese iced tea. Friendly folks at the register and over the counter. I heart dinosaurs!
author: Melanie N.

description:
Meh. I've experienced better...at Dinosaurs way back when. The chicken banh mi must have been boiled with no seasonings. It relied too much on the condiments for flavor - spice from the jalapenos and mayo. I did appreciate the cucumber, though. 

If this sounds super debbie downer, the real downer is how slow these guys work. There are 5 people working and prepping, but for some reason the only guy who works the register is also the guy making sandwiches, while one guy portions tiny amounts of sauce into equally tiny little containers and another girl works at a snail's pace rolling spring rolls.

Perhaps Saigon Sandwich has spoiled me with its flavorful sandwiches and quick service. I don't know. But if 50 year old ladies at  Saigon Sandwich can take orders and hand over a cheaper, better tasting sandwich in a minute, than certainly Dinosaurs could do the same.
author: NickJess S.

description: As someone who's a pseudo-vegetarian and hates mayonnaise, I always figured that banh mi just wasn't for me. Dinosaurs changed the game for me. Their crispy tofu with veganaise is delicious- full of crunchy pickled veggies, fresh jalapeños, flavorful sauce, and crispy tofu strings on a warm toasty baguette. The portobello sand which is tasty too, but has a very different consistency. They're really friendly and fast. There's a great selection of chips, canned/bottled drinks, and fountain drinks. They also make an avocado shake that's amaaaazing. Dinosaurs is one of my favorite lunch spots obviously.
author: Rocio G.

description: Great Bahn-mi sandwiches with veggie / vegan options. Quick and cheap, staff is very polite as well.
author: Anitha I.

description:
my all time favorite Bahn Mi from a place with an unlikely name, and probably in my top favorite sandwiches of all time (switches to Kanye voice) OF ALL TIME!

the pork special is what keeps em coming back, the mix of shredded, crisp pork and the "fancy pork loaf" spread complement each other so well among the other pickled vegetables and sauces they add on the delicious fresh roll. As a side note the spring rolls are also surprisingly fresh and wonderful for something handed to you pre-packaged. Get an avocado shake to go with at all and head over to Dolores park for a pretty great and tasty way to spend the day. 

I've honestly been here about a million times...
author: Andy H.

description:
I love 'The Special'.  Oh my god is it good!
They recently did a little remodeling and added a soda machine with a variety of teas as well.

They are all very nice and get your order ready quickly.

But seriously....The Special!  You have to try it!
author: Stacy Y.

description: UPDATE: So I came in to try their Spicy Tuna Banh Mi. Yep, it's official. This place is yumsters.
author: Ann S.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

This is as good as it gets. I don't even LIKE sandwiches, but this one was amazing. I had the pork sandwich (which is supposedly the most popular). AND ONLY $4.50. But according to other reviews apparently $4.50 is a lot....I'm ok with it though :)

Please don't get too popular like every other tasty spot in SF!!  I will return.
author: Melissa N.

description: The food is great, but I just had a sandwich and after eating it started feeling terrible. I called and turns out the use MSG in there seasoning. So bummed out, I can't do MSG.
author: Amber L.

description: Why am I paying $12 for this? It's good but every time I go in there I want to help them rearrange and paint this sorry little place. Too bad cuz the sammies are large and fresh. Just please god, care a little huh?
author: Smelly S.

description:
DINOSAURS!!! *ROOOOOOAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAWWWWWWWWR* 

What an interesting name for a sandwich shop! 

Would the lady making my sandwich be considered a dinosaur because she looks like one?! Just kidding. xP 

I had the Spicy Tuna Banh Mi here. I gotta tell you this place is bomb! 

The prices for a Banh Mi..eh..$5.. I guess its the location since this IS the Castro.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I put up my Yelp thumbs to any Vietnamese-American establishment that is unafraid of subscribing to an unpredictable name (e.g. Vietnamese Restaurant & Grill).  I mean, screw all the patrons that are too afraid of venturing into a restaurant without first needing to know exactly what they are walking into!  (Wait, besides Yelpers!)  Anyway, my point is, the name "Dinosaurs" is so beyond the realm of Vietnamese sandwiches, let alone food-esque ideas, that it is very admirable.  Kudos!

As for the sandwiches, Dinosaurs is a great place to try Vietnamese sandwiches, if you have never had one before.  The latter point is because the sandwiches are good, however, the ingredients are very mild in flavor.  The meats and pickled veggies lack the intense layers of flavor normally found in a quintessential Vietnamese sandwich.  Nevertheless, the food is good and the service is friendly.  For anyone in the area, it is worth the trip.
author: Diane N.

description:
Once you find the place (front of building is like GNC type store and there are a bunch of businesses in this building), this is as good as it gets!

The awesome: fantastic bahn mi sandwiches (shaking beef is my favorite), the bread, the prices, the guy often working the counter
The bad: not always the quickest
The ugly: the only con I can somewhat think of is that I didn't prefer the peanut sauce
author: Chris H.

description:
Holy crap do I love this place.

$5 gets you a delicious banh mi with your choice of pork, spicy tuna, crispy tofu, meatball, or special (pork plus pate and meatballs). The bread is crispy, the pickled carrots are tangy, the meat is tender, and there's just the right amount of mayonnaise, cilantro, and jalapeño.

They have a good selection of drinks and chip-type snacks to have with your sandwich.

Service is fast and friendly.

A great alternative around the corner from Ike's if you want a sandwich sooner than 45 minutes from now to take to Dolores Park with you.
author: Sam K.

description: The sandwich was good. The spring rolls were not. The dining space could be cleaner.
author: Grey Z.

description:
Vietnamese sandwiches in a place called "Dinosaurs"...Name alone drew me in.  Great sandwiches, for about $5, wonderful service and vibrant vibe of the cafe.  Everytime I've been there, great hip-hop or old school jams are playing.  The entire staff greets you with a smile and within minutes your order is served.  

The only negative to the place, is indoor seating is tight (3 tables) and a few more outdoors.  But the service is so quick, the sandwiches are fantastic and did I mention great hip-hop and old school.  Never had a bad experience and will be there again soon.
author: Jason A.

description:
Love this place!  I have loved their special Bahn Mi for quite awhile now, I simply think it's the best - don't understand why (I've tried many places in little saigon, richmond etc) but the way they  combine their flavors is simply amazing.

Though I'm writing this review because of my most recent experience - I placed a pretty sizable order (50 sandwiches for my church function) at 6pm on Sunday night and at first they said maybe 7:30 but I asked for 6:45 and they said they'd try their best.  When I got there at 6:45, they were really nice and really accommodating even though they had to rush the order, they also gave me the 10% discount anyways even though I forgot my phone and couldn't check-in and helped me bring the large box of sandwiches to my car.  Lots of people were very excited I brought Dinosaurs for dinner and I completely agreed - yummy!!
author: Daniel K.

description:
What do I love about Dinosaurs:

a) The people. They all seem AMPED to work there, even if it's 9pm at night they've always been full of energy and life and are always so happy to feed you. Also the guys are hellaaaa cute and the girls are so sweet. And they always are open to helping me switch out one of my orders (I can't have rice milk, so they swap in coconut milk for me. Thanks guys! I love you!)

b) The food. Oh god the food is uhmazing. What's good? 
- The sandwiches. The bread is fluffy and toasted to perfection. The pickled carrot/daikon is just perfectly tangy and sweet. The cilantro is always fresh and springy. And the fillings are ON POINT. My favorites: shaking beef and meatball. Oh jeez. Yes. More please.
- The salads. They're just the perfect blend of salty, sweet, sour and spicy. I can't decide which one I love more. Chicken or shrimp? BOTH!
- The spring rolls. The ingredients are fresh. And they are literally springy. Springing into your mouth with fresh flavor. And the sauce is really good.
- The drankz. AVOCADO SHAKE. YES. MORE.

c) The prices. They are really reasonable. Yes. More. Eat all the food. Now.
author: Jireh T.

description:
Fast, tasty, reasonably priced, what more could you ask for?
Their banh mi sandwiches aren't like others i've had. There are fewer vegetables, it is served on legit sandwich bread, all not stuffed into a tiny cut in the bread.  i prefer this to the other ones i've had which tend to be stuffed with a million things, overflowing to the point of discomfort.
ftr i had the meatball one, would recommend it.
author: Sandy K.

description:
First off, customer service is amazing. They're super nice and friendly.
The menu is simple. Pick a sandwich, any sandwich. I've chosen one though, and I've stuck to it... twelve times over. I'm addicted to this place. It has some sort of symbiotic relationship going on with Bi-Rite Creamery when it comes to luring me in.. my addiction to both is relentless. A tag team of deliciousness...  I sound like a fatty! I don't care.
I always get the spicy tuna. I've tried the crispy tofu and it's really good too. The chicken wasn't bad but I am not a fan. I've been meaning to try the grilled pork but the Tuna makes me forget. 
I love the artwork, location, and atmosphere. Great place. 

NOTE - I've come here before closing with a friend who was eager to try it. We parked, then walked and drooled about a block only to find that they closed early due to a stock-out of delicious bread. Though we were turned away, they didn't lose my loyalty, and they gained another customer as well. Also, they used what seemed to be Safeway sourdough baguettes to abate another bread stock-out during my next visit but it didn't change the awesomeness of the sandwich. 

Takes about 5 minutes or less to get your sandwich made from the time you order it and out the door you go. You can eat there too, if you'd like. I just had some for dinner - spicy tuna to go. YUM.
author: Rosavida C.

description: Went with my hairstylist on 11-30-13 9:05pm'sh.  I ordered the grilled pork viet sandwich ($5), it's surprisingly good, they toasted the baguette, added sliced jalapeno peppers, lemon grass fused into pork with sliced carrots. My friend ordered the fried tofu with taro($5) and added pate(+$2?) to it, also had the yeo soy drinks(about $2).  Service is friendly.  She left half of her sandwich in my car (I ate the rest and it's good also).
author: Jer W.

description: No frills but very light and good. Would highly recommend if you are looking for a fast, healthy, and good priced meal. I only wish the peanut sauce was chilled and not warm.
author: Aaron S.

description:
My first experience with Vietnamese food. It was great. The sandwiches were very well priced and tasted delicious. Great value for the dollar.

I would pass on the spring rolls.
author: Max C.

description:
Love the crispy tofu sandwich! Flavors were perfect with just the right amount of heat. If this place was in my neighborhood, I'd probably be eating here way too much.

Beware that this place gets busy -- we waited awhile both to order and to receive our food.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: While the address for Dinosaurs on Market is correct, better access to this sandwich shop is actually on the other side of the block on 16th street.  Entrance on Market to the sandwich shop is through the mall and down the stairs.  Dinosaurs is a small, intimate sandwich shop with self service beverage machines and array of various chips and drinks to choose from.  "The special", a Vietnamese sandwich, with slow cooked pork on a mound of shredded carrots, a few slices of jalapeño peppers, slices of pork, and a good smear of pork pate on a very crunchy French bun.  It's overwhelmingly a big sandwich that could feed two comfortably. It gets 3 stars for the casual atmosphere, the simple service, and location access.  While the quantity of food may be impressive, the crunchy bread a plus, the pork filling with veggies was okay. The help staff was friendly, but reserved.  I'd return to try other items on the menu.
author: K C.

description: Sorry the price increase is too much. 30 percent increase in the past couple of months is rather steep even with the changes in minimum wage. Eight dollars for a sandwich, no gracias
author: Mark A.

description: This place is great to pick up a quick meal. The shaking beef is my go-to. Lots of flavor and the bread is great. The price is higher than usual, but if you can't find anything else as tasty, its worth the price.
author: Cassie C.

description:
Red light #1: $5 banh mi sandwiches?! I am not accustomed to paying more than $3 for a good banh mi sandwich... 

Red light #2: This is a Chinese owned and operated Vietnamese sandwich shop...??

Red light #3: No more bread?! It was about 2pm Saturday, and they had somehow ran out of bread and were waiting to be restocked...

Skeptical of the operations going on here and the high prices... I ended up going for it anyway - to see if it was worth any of the current Yelp hype, and more so just to appease my BF's persistence in me trying his new great find, in combination with my previous 3-4 underwhelming visits with Ike's down the street... 

We ended up sharing the last of the bread Dinosaur still had, and doing half spicy tuna and half grilled pork. I've never had or seen spicy tuna in banh mi, but the girl behind the counter recommended we go for it, and so we did. Out came two tiny little baguette ends that would make you feel like a giant dinosaur in comparison... hmmm, I guess the name "Dinosaur" didn't come from nowhere??? Expecting only dissappointment at this point, the grilled pork was actually not too bad and the spicy tuna was actually down out delicious. Served with fresh pickled daikon, jalapenos, and cilantro... these provided fresh takes on my once narrow view of a good banh mi. 

Despite Dinosaur's banh mi being a good $5 a piece and being TINIER than any sandwich/banh mi I've ever eaten - though possibly due to it being their last bits of bread, I find myself craving their (spicy tuna) banh mi more than any other sandwich I've ever had... I know, the blasphemy!!~ But really, Dinosaur may be on to something here... so if you're getting tired of Ike's, or even if you're not... come give this place a try! Dinosaur may not compare to the epic-sounding world of Ike's sandwiches - with their menu of hundred different calorie-bombing sandwich combos that range from $10-20, but Dinosaur does go beyond Ike's when it comes to overall taste, imo... and is still a great meal find for under $10! Yay for this new SF sandwich find!
author: Lana N.

description: Pretty delicious Vietnamese sandwiches. The grilled pork is too yummy. I enjoyed the veggies. The bread could be better. One time it was a little stale
author: Andrew V.

description: Love the name, love the food.  Very chill spot with delicious banh mi.  It's easy to just take it out and go to a park to eat it.
author: S L.

description:
I always thought dinosaurs were gigantic, prehistoric beasts but it ends up they are just some Asians who are awesome at making sandwiches.

The moment you step in the door you are greeted by a large collection of dinosaur memorabilia including a Jurassic Park pinball machine which is both fun and can probably be considered educational (physics, dinosaurs, gravity ... i'm sure you can find a way to justify plopping in a couple quarters).  

While the menu is simple it gives you all the essentials:

The Special - Roasted Pork, Fancy Pork Loaf and Pate
Meatball - Minced Garlic and Shallots with Ground Pork
Pork - Grilled Pork with Lemongrass
Chicken - Chicken Thigh Cutlets, Seasamed and Marinated
Spicy Tuna - Chunky, Light Tuna with Spicy Mayo
Crispy Tofu - Fried Tofu, Rice Noodles and Taro with "Vegenaise"

The meatball sandwich was delicious.  Perfectly cooked bread with fresh veggies and tasty chunks of meatball.  While there could have been more meat, overall it was a tasty treat.

Parking sucks around here but if you feel like going all mesozoic on a Vietnamese Sando you really don't have any other options, do you?
author: Tyler B.

description: Why is it so hard to find a good banh mi place in San Francisco? I've had some pretty bad banh mi where there wasn't enough meat or the bread was rock hard, gladly Dinosaurs did not disappoint. Bread is perfectly toasted and the sandwich is a pretty good size. On the other hand, the spring rolls aren't as good. They had a couple seats outside for me to enjoy the weather and sandwich.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I love this little place.  All of the sandwiches are very good and fresh tasting (my favorite is the pork).  They are also under $5 which is a pretty good deal.

I'm a little sad that they've changed the staff and there are no more cute guys behind the counter.
author: R. S.

description: Dinosaurs is crazy good.  I never would have suspected such a great place could have such an unassuming and unrelated restaurant name.  Who would know that prehistoric animals make such great Vietnamese sandwiches?  I kid.  I kid. Here's the deal.  The food is reasonably priced.  The new Chicken sandwich is worth every penny.  Their "special' isn't AS good, but its still pretty awesome.  Top it off with Thai iced tea or watermelon drink and you are money.  Enough dollar references for you?  Invest in your future, check out Dinosaurs.
author: Jeff G.

description:
HOLY BAHN MI BATMAN!
When you go to this place a couple times in a matter of days, you know it's good! Call in your order and pick it up. Tag team with someone because parking is tight (Castro).
The vegan Bahn Mi rocks my world, even vegan mayo!
Hopefully this place will not go extinct any time soon.
author: Katie S.

description:
Walk through Market, find a building, go down some stairs, turn to your left... and you'll find the little treasure trove that is Dinosaurs. 

For the convenient location, I was very happy to discover the banh mi here. It is a little different than traditional banh mi - the sandwiches are very generous in portion compared to the cheap $3 minibites I've had to contend with in Boston. They add jalapenos - at least to the port special one that I had. It is very filling and perfect for a grab-n-go lunch. I will definitely be returning. Also, make sure to check in for special discounts!
author: Shang S.

description:
I seldom give a 5 star rating but this place has been consistent since the first time I started coming here. 

The staff is always courteous, place is clean and the food is D-E-L-I-C-O-U-S. My favorite is the shaking beef sandwich. The bread is baked to perfection. I don't even like sandwiches but would eat here on a weekly basis. 

Not much more I can say. If you've not been here before, go!
author: May G.

description: Really tasty and cheap Vietnamese sandwiches.  Their spring rolls are also freshly made and really good.
author: Jeff H.

description: This is what a great sandwich should be: a fistful of mind-blowing, mouth dazzling flavors crammed in a sliced baguette and served quickly and cheaply. My bahn mi was packed with plenty of tender savory beef, fresh cilantro, carrot and daikon, a heaping pile of jalapeños all nestled between aioli slathered buns perfectly toasted. It's the kind of perfect sandwich that has you smiling the rest of the day. And the kicker? The restaurant's location on a quiet stretch of 16th around the corner from crazy Market gives it a secret little hidden gem quality.
author: Alexander G.

description: The most consistently delicious and low-priced banh mi. Complete with melt in your mouth pate and baked to perfection baguettes, these are the real deal. Mmmmmmmm nom nom nom.
author: Ali C.

description: I came to Dinosaurs a few months ago to check out their version of the banh mi, but thought the sandwiches were just okay. However,they are still way better than Lee's!! The banh mis here aren't very authentic, but their pickled vegetables are solid, and I think I liked the chicken (Grilled Lemongrass Chicken $4.75) the best (this is what happens when you don't write a review right away.. doh). I definitely remember the Special (Roast Pork, Fancy Pork Loaf, Pate $4.75) being disappointing, but pork (Grilled Lemongrass Pork $4.75) wasn't bad either. Parking can be tough in this area, but they make your sandwich very fast. Worth stopping by here if you're in the mood for banh mi!!
author: Amy D.

description:
Decided to stop at this place after sitting in the left turn lane near 16th and Market. Good choice. Yes, there's cheaper. The guys here put together a tasty pork special for me. Plenty of veggies and a nice combo of pâté and mayo. 

Wife ordered the chicken. Just as good. Bread was lightly toasted and almost perfect. I'd love it if they had something a little softer on the inside.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Sandwiches under 5 dollars in the mission with no lines out the door and not pretentiousness. OH HELL THE YES!

Are these the best Vietnamese sandwiches in the city. hell no. Are they the best and cheapest sandwiches you can get in the Castro HELL YES.

Is the bread right. YES
Is the meat good YES
IS the service fast YES
Is the price right YES
Is the vegetarian food good enough from the picky French Spouse YES!

We have a winner boys and girls!
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
i was pleasantly surprised after finding this cute little cafe in the castro area.  the sandwiches were pretty authentic for the most part.  the ingredents were fresh and tasty...each sandwich was around $5.  there are a few tables inside and a handful of tables outside.  

i ordered a vietnamese iced coffee, the chicken, and the special.  the coffee was good and strong...but it was mostly ice. wifey and i enjoyed both sandwiches but the bread just didn't cut it for me...it wasn't bad...it just wasn't what i expect for a 4 or 5 star banh mi sandwich.  

the guy at the counter was nice...although there seemed to be so much confusion between him and the guys making the sandwiches.  there were a couple of scuffles here and there while i was waiting for my order.  

parking is super difficult around here...and it's really hard to go anywhere else with the prices and the junky, delicous, and dirty quality of saigon sandwiches...i do love the hours and that this place has the ability to satisfy a late night banh mi craving.  if i'm in the area and want my banh mi fix...sure, i'd come back again.
author: Jen W.

description: So my predictions in my last review have come true! I am craving these crispy tofu sandwiches all the time! I just had another one today for lunch. I actually went to the location myself this time! It is a very small restaurant with a few tables for indoor seating. You order your food at the counter beforehand. I love the dinosaur pictures on the walls and the Jurassic Park game they have inside! I'm a fan of this place! =]
author: Anthony H.

description: This place is now hands down my fave banh-mi shop in the city and surrounding Bay area.  I got to try the special and the crispy tofu sandwich, and now I don't even care what the other sandwiches are, I'm a believer.  The special is super hearty and flavorful, and the crispy tofu is interesting and it's hard to believe it's tofu, it tastes like meat or onion rings and deliciousness.  This is coming from someone who orders tons of vegetarian items as a preference.  There is usually seating inside or outside.
author: Terry K.

description:
I pride myself on knowing most of the hotspots around town, including those that are somewhat under the radar (i.e. not much hype but great food).

Sooo ... how in the world did Dinosaurs escape me?!!

Just discovered this place last night after catching up with a friend over drinks.  It's somewhat hidden, a little bit off the beaten path (away from Market St.) but man oh man, is it worth the search!

It's a simple menu with a selection of 5 or 6 banh mi (all for $4.75 except for the Special which goes for $5).  I got both the Pork and the Special (different types of pork and other meats) and it was freakin' delicious.  Loved the pickled veggies (which I asked for extra) and the jalapeno heat.  They even have srirarcha, which completes the otherwise perfect sandwich.

True, there are other places in the city where you can get banh mi for less (and taste just as good) but nothing within close proximity of Dinosaurs.  So given the convenient location and the delish yet affordable sammies, I'm sold.
author: F. P.

description:
Amazing! Simply amazing. Best banh mi ever!!!

Had the BBQ pork, twice in two days. The pork was nicely charred with a really deep flavor, all the veggies were super fresh and the bread was the best hands down, crispy and delicious.

Biggest spring rolls I have ever seen. It's a little out of the way and you have to look to find it, but trust me, it's well worth it!

Oh and all this amazing delicousness is cheap too.
author: Brad F.

description:
My beau and I have started making a weekly Saturday pilgrimage to Dinosaurs post-gym, errands, and Castro walkabout.  In short, we love this place - grab yourself a sunny table on the sidewalk and order either the chicken or pork banh mi.  Or both.

What sets Dinosaurs apart from other hole-in-the-wall banh mi vendors is their consistency and speed - the sandwiches are always well assembled with good crispy fresh bread and a good balance of flavorful meat.  I echo Shannon B in ordering the extra veggies to create the perfect sandwich, but you're good without... and invariably the team will throw in extra veggies at no charge if you ask politely.  The speed is phenomenal - I often wait 10-15 minutes downtown for my sandwich, but these guys turn orders around in less than five minutes.  Plus all staff members are super polite and friendly.

Don't get me wrong - the sound of the pinball machine inside can drive me insane when trying to chat, but the quality of the food and the reasonable price point drown that out - besides, you can sit on the sidewalk, so all is good.  Given the usual quality of fast food in the Castro, these guys stand above many others.  Thumbs up.
author: Paul G.

description: Super tasty crispy tofu and mushroom sandwiches. Bread is perfect and it's so great they offer vegan options. We always call in the order and they're ready really quick.
author: Katherine G.

description: Omg, I wish we had a Dinosaurs in SoCal!!! My boyfriend and I ordered the grilled pork banh mi sandwich, it was to die for. The bread was freshly baked, the veggies were fresh, and the pork was grilled to perfection. I would definitely come back when I am back in the bay area. Oh and not to mention the unbeatable price of only $5! If you check in, you get 10% off! This place is amaze-balls!
author: Sharon C.

description:
I live in Orange County, you know, by Westminster, where I can get all the bun mei and ngoc mum I want, but for some reason, when I was in San Francisco, I decided to stop by this place.  At first, I was incredulous, "A bun mei shop in SF?  There's no good Viet food here!"

Then I sat down and tried a sandwich.  Didn't completely knock my socks off, but I thought, hey, they make it good here.  

If I ever find myself back up here, I'll probably try it again, just to make sure the first time wasn't a fluke.
author: George U.

description: This place is diamond! Delicious spring rolls and sooooo cheap! A perfect spot for lunch in the sun.
author: Kate H.

description:
I've been coming to Dinosaurs since they opened. The most critical thing I have to say about these guys is that they recently reconfigured their shop and stopped offering Mountain Dew in the process, while adding a soda fountain of Coke products. Oh noes.

San Francisco is a city of great sandwiches, and Dinos belongs at the top of anyone's Sandwiches To Eat list.

Is it the most authentic banh mi, just like you might get off the cart in Vietnam? Nah. But I'm here for taste, not for authenticity. Dinos kicks up the sandwich a notch with AMAZING bread, delicious mayo, and fresh and crunchy vegetables. Don't forget the sriracha.

Next time you're headed to Ike's to stand in line, turn around and head to Dinos instead. No line, half the price, it's not so huge that you'll want to puke afterward, and authentic enough that you won't come here and think "This isn't banh mi!" unless you're really snooty.

Eat this. Seriously. Soon you'll be evangelizing just like me.
author: Michael W.

description:
Near Ikes, on 16th Street. Dinosaurs has a $4.75 for the tofu bánh mì, (vegan with vegannise) get the extra veggies including cilantro, pickled carrots and cucumbers (extra 50¢) otherwise it can be a bit dry.

My dining partner likes the chicken, which he remarked was slow cooked and marinated or the "special" which involves way too many bits of meat of all varieties.

Warning:
Not all Dinosaur sandwiches are created equally, sometime the bread is all big and fatty other times it narrow and long bread. And sometimes you may need 1 and 1/2 sandwiches to make up for the bread issues if your starving.
author: Shannon Z.

description: Dudes, where's my BOBA? Only thing missing from this place.  Giving you a bribe star....hope it works!
author: El B.

description:
+ delicious and affordable sandwiches, really like the portobello (~$5-$6)
+ AWESOME avocado milkshake (~$4)
+ also sells shrimp chips AND hi chew...mmm yummy
+ friendly staff who will give you a to-go box if you can't finish the sandwich
+ good seating

- no restroom in the place, but I think there's a public place right outside (haven't used, can't attest to cleanliness)
author: M W.

description: Very very good. Love the flavors.  Never had a sandwich like this.  Spring rolls were good, but not the best I have had. Would come back for this one.
author: Scott W.

description:
These Bahn Mi's are the sh!t. The wifey brought me the pork combo and it was one of the best ones I've had. Great meat quality (real pork), and not just the plain processed meat you find in most places. It had a good amount of pâté and the bread was spot on. Little pricier than most but worth the $$$. 
I have to go back to Saigon Sandwich on Larkin to see which is the best Bahn Mi in the bay area.
author: T L.

description:
Hooray, a nice place for Vietnamese sandwiches!  Can't beat the price either - $4.50??  Nice.

As mentioned by other folks, not a whole lot of options, but on the bright side you avoid the paradox of choice!
author: Corey C.

description:
After an underwhelming experience at Bun Mee, our perception of banh mi that is priced for the "gentile/hipster/yuppie" population was marred.  I get it.  Try to familiarize a "plebian" product and package it in a way that people perceive it as hip and happening hence justifying its price tag.  You know, it's kinda like bottled water.  But, this is dang dong pretty ok bottled water.  Like, Fuji?  Mind you, I still like tap water.     

I have to say this place is pretty good.  For 4.75, you get a larger combo banh mi than at Bun Mee, PLUS, the bread and stuff was pretty good.  It was so good, that we ordered more.  And, I didn't fidget as I did at that place on Fillmore St. 

It may not be a swanky a place, but there are tables and a cool Jurassic Park pinball machine.    So, it can be a place to hang out after walking from Dolores Park  for a quick meal.

So, overall, me likey.
author: John L.

description: Nice vegan Bahn mi choice. The portabella is better than the tofu option. Add a little sriracha and you are ready to rock and roll. The baguette was delicious and soft with the right amount of crunch. Fresh cilantro and jalapenos - YUM! Reasonably priced too!
author: Aneilia M.

description:
Great value for money ($4.75). Use Yelp or Facebook check-in for 10% discount!

I had the pork banh mi. The pork could have used more grilling and marination. The bread, spread and pickles are really good. I found the iced Vietnamese coffee ($3.50) to be on the weaker side.

Not bad for a quick bite.
author: Saran R.

description: Customer service isn't spot on, but the affordable price, convenient location, & consistently good food makes me return over and over again. If you have a hankering for Bun Mee and are in the Castro, you cannot go wrong with Dinosaurs. I also recommend trying the Mango Mint and Watermelon Lychee drinks as they are superb. For a little hole in the wall they have both indoor and outdoor seating which allows for you to go with plenty of your friends.
author: Jason C.

description: Delicious, reasonably-priced banh mi sandwhiches, right in the Castro.
author: Randy M.

description:
I'm addicted.  My coworker turned me on to Dinosaur banh mi and I can't stop eating them.  The veggie crispy tofu sandwich is the best. I like it better than the meat ones!  There's something they do with the flavoring of oil and salt and pepper to make the tofu just the most delicious stuff you've ever tasted.  One never fills me up. Two gets me close.  I haven't tried 3 but I suspect you could feed me these all day.  At $5 a pop that gets a little pricey for what it is; maybe they should go Subway and do a $5 foot long?? :)  Please? 

This is a casual counter-order cafe. It has big windows, a couple tables outside, but don't expect a whole lot of ambience. Think cafeteria. They serve banh mi and only banh mi (well, there's your standard soda machine and some chips too).
author: Becky N.

description: Nothing particularly wrong with this Banh Mi. My problem was the sandwich was actually overstuffed with pate and meats. Proportion thrown off. Too much meat is normally not something to pick at but you don't wanna feel sleepy after eating a Viet sando and after this guy I almost had that post-pastrami glaze over. Flavors were pretty nice, though.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Minus the scavenger hunt-esque trek to find the place, Dinosaurs was a great place to enjoy lunch with friends.

The staff there are really friendly and nice. The sandwiches are good. Not the best Vietnamese sandwiches I've had, but then again, having grown up in San Jose, I'm spoiled with good Vietnamese sandwiches and cuisine. I think it's cute how they took the Vietnamese sandwich concept and made it "cute" and "cool." Very smart for Castro, in my opinion.

The critique? Pricey. A $5 Banh Mi? No thanks. But alas, Dinosaurs, you've got me hooked on your modernization (even more so than Lee's) of a Vietnamese classic.
author: Mike N.

description: So I just inhaled a spicy tuna with crispy tofu and a mango mint smoothie. I might have been starving but that was a tasty sandwich! I was greeted by both staff behind the counter and were waiting patiently for me to decide which sandwich to get. (I was debating whether or not to get the portabella, but I'll save that for my next visit.) The veggies were nice and fresh, and the roll was perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Definitely going back!
author: Denise H.

description: My favorite banh mi in the whole city. The Crispy Tofu is the best! We go here often.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Reviewing only the Crispy Tofu banh mi:
Texture of the crispy tofu was really rough (it reminded me like when you burn your tongue and try to eat... you can't really feel it.. ya that's what I got from it). There wasn't much of the actual tofu instead more of these crispy bites? not sure what they're made out of.. Any who everything else was fine, it could do a bit more of veggies in it.

Thai Iced Tea: 
really good, not deluded at all, good ratio of tea and condensed milk.

Overall, I won't be coming back for the sandwiches, but definitely for the Thai Milk Tea!
author: Stephanie W.

description: At $5, the grilled pork banh mi was cheap and good. Grilled chicken and shrimp spring roll was also decent. Prompt and friendly service and you get a 10% discount if you check in with Yelp.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
It seems like I've been here so many times within the last two weeks!

I've been on a Vietnamese sandwich craze lately, and I just can't get enough. The sandwiches here are a little different from what I'm used to having growing up, but it still hits the spot when you have a serious craving. 

All the sandwiches are super tasty, but my favorites are the pork and the chicken. The tofu sandwich is also worth trying!

Location is easy to get to, and the employees are extra friendly...even when you ask for extra veggies. =)
author: Christine C.

description: Pretty OK sandwiches in a very diner/dive atmosphere. People seem to like this place, but to me it was lacking in pizazz. I love banh mi sandwiches, but the quality of the ingredients wasn't great.
author: Laura C.

description:
My favourite bånh mi in San Francisco!

Now that Ike's (I first wrote "ICK" which is more true) is reopened near by I hope its stupid shop does not pull business from my dear Dinosaur.

This little shop right off of Market in the Castro-ish area is a delight. Small and modestly decorated in dinosaur themed chuffa.

There is a Jurassic Park pool table, toy dinos and dino art on the walls. They have a theme and they commit.

On the menu side of things, very simple. I always get the crispy tofu because it is vegan and delish! They use veganase and I always ask for more jalapeno and less cilantro.

The sandwich hold up really well. I have bought multiple sandwiches at a time just to have them for lunch multiple days of the week. I just leave them out, no refrigeration. It is still great days later even though there is the law of diminished returns in effect and right after it is made is best.

The staff are super nice and seem to enjoy being there and my food is always ready within ten minutes. The prices are awesome! So cheap. Less than five bucks for a very good meal!
author: Jonathan JayLando D.

description:
Oh my... I'm so happy this place opened up right around the corner from my house. These sandwiches are soooooooo tasty. Not sure why they don't have a line out the door the way Ike's used to because these sandwiches make Ike's look like... well, let's just say I'm not a fan of Ike's. It's not all about size Ike.

Dinosaurs sandwiches are a delightful lesson in contrast: sweet and tangy, squishy and crunchy, meaty and vegie. I'm 100% sold. The gang running this place is super cool and laid back too.
author: benjamin p.

description: For delicious, consistent, affordable eats & friendly staff. Have never ordered anything that didn't taste incredible or had wait long for it. Everyone who works there is super nice & the spicy tuna is my personal favorite.
author: Christa C.

description: Really yummy subs. Toasty bread, good fillings. Bought several this weekend to share with my cousins visiting from LA. They said the quality was comparable to some of the best from their area. Friendly service staff. Only reason for four stars: subs took longer than expected to be ready...and the size of the sub was a bit small. I'm a petite girl, and I could eat two myself, easily.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Saw some other folks bitch about the price here.  No, it's not Tenderloin prices, but they are paying Castro rent.  Where the hell else can you get a yummy lunch in the Castro for 5 bucks?

The staff is really friendly and cool and efficient.  

The sandwiches are good not great.  They are yummy and filling and the meat is delicious.  The meatball is my favorite, but I've tried and liked all but the vegetarian.  I wish they would get a different baguette distributor.  I want it a bit more crunchy on the outside and fluffier (less chew) on the inside.  And I wish the veggies had more pickled flavor.  

But I come here at least once a week for a great inexpensive lunch.
author: wineporn S.

description: I was sooo hungry I ordered a fried tofu and meatball sandwich. It was the perfect lunch.
author: Thomas L.

description: Three words: Sriracha kettle chips. Not to mention, amazing banh mi at amazing prices! Limited seating and non-existent parking are the only downsides I can find with this great little Vietnamese sandwich shop.
author: Matt T.

description:
Very tempted to give five stars, but I'm still new to the banh mi scene, so I don't want to get over-enthusiastic and blow my stars too early.

I grabbed a tofu sammich this evening and was delighted. The veggies are crisp and flavorful, the bread is pure baguette goodness, and the service was quick and friendly. Most of all, they use Vegenaise. Not just any fake mayo, no, they use the best stuff. I could eat Vegenaise straight. The stuff is so goddamn good. I never in my wildest dreams imagined that I would be able to get a sammich pre-Veganaised, but lo! Just such a magical thing was achieved tonight.

My main concern was the fact that the staff was voluntarily listening to Justin Timberlake while working. But I will accept that, if they continue to bring tasty back and serve me those sammiches!
author: Vivienne P.

description: The recipe was tweaked a bit and okay....I have to admit I love their sandwiches now. haha :)
author: Kayla I.

description: Good for the price, for sure. The tuna and the shaking beef banh mi are my favorite, but all of their sandwiches come with baguette bread and good veggies. Certainly the best option for a sandwich in the area (not a big fan of Ike's Place).
author: Michael D.

description:
5 stars for the adorably cute guys working there.

4 stars for the sandwiches.

3 stars for the price (almost double how much the sandwiches cost in those Vietnamese shops in Chinatown) (BUT still affordable by ANY standards) (except cheap Chinese ppl standards)
author: Joshua L.

description:
This is a dedication to their vegetarian (fried tofu) sandwich.  After eating at Dinosaur's, I think I did not understand the depth and deliciousness that a Vietnamese sandwich could be.  It surprised me because the restaurant location is low-key, the menu was simple, but the FLAVOR packed real punch.  The pickled carrots, peppercorn grinds, and sauce really melded together in a symphony of WOW.  

Now I really wanna go back for their other specialties and deliciousness.

And this is coming from a person who is not exactly a sandwich lover.

Dinosaurs, I will be back...
author: Amy W.

description:
These guys are so great and bring a positive new energy to the once ornery service one would get from a certain (now-closed) unnamed eating establishment up the street. Plus, I don't have to trek to the Tenderloin for good Bahn Mi!

Also, catered a meeting for 50 I did early this year. They were on time and the guests loved them, too!
author: David S.

description: Quick, delicious, affordable, all around fantastic. Had the shaking beef and loved it! I'll definitely be frequenting this place
author: Gabbi R.

description: My friend just hit on the cashier. LOL. Aside from the eye-candy, the sandwiches were really good. The service was fast and they have good music. Great place to grab something quick!
author: John P.

description: Fantastic sandwiches. A must for a quick, tasty, fresh meal in Castro.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Pros: yum and inexpensive sandwiches, amazing iced coffee, and, ahem, a very good-looking sandwich-maker.

Cons: not that much seating.
author: Laura K.

description: I don't know why I don't just give this place 5 stars. The new shaking beef sandwich is excellent!! The veggies are always super fresh and everything on the menu is under $6. What more could you ask for?
author: Erin L.

description: Oh dude. Shut up and eat here. Ban mi sandos for DAYS. 'Nuff said. Vegans can play, too.
author: S B.

description:
Solid bahn mi sandwiches for about the same price as those authentic places in the TL (Saigon Sandwiches, Lee's). I had The Pork ($4.75), which was fatty, juicy and perfectly delicious. It can get a bit oily so don't forget those napkins. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Vietnamese sandwiches. 

There are a few tables inside and a small outside dining area. They also offer some random Asian snacks and drinks. Staff is friendly and efficient.

Subscribe to SF Weekly's email newsletter and you might spot a BOGO coupon :)
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: The sandwich is sooo goooood. I was wandering around in the Castro when I got hungry. This was the only Vietnamese restaurant  around. It took me awhile to find it because it was hidden in the sub level of a small shopping center. The prices seemed a bit high at first until I got the sandwich. It was huge and packed with meat. The beef one was especially good. Same with the spring roll. Worth every penny.
author: Olivia C.

description: Great food, great people, great location and great prices. What's not to love. I was there today and every time I go i wonder how these guys can serve such nice clean food at such great prices. They are hard working folks who will do great in the Castro.
author: Duncan W.

description:
Bahn mi in the Castro? What?! As soon as I saw the sign out in front with a t-rex holding a sandwich, I knew I had to try it. After peeking in, I see the menu with just 6 things. Always a good sign for a small cafe like this, keeping things simple. 

I had the Special, which had some roasted pork, and a good amount of pate, which was quite creamy and delectable. Bread is super crunchy, along with the julienned vegetables inside, just how it should be.

The Pork was next, with grilled pork. Tender meats, very flavorful. No complaints whatsoever about the food. Friendly staff. Random dinosaur toys, drawings on the walls. Note: Not so much seating inside, just 4 small tables. 3 more tables outside. A library is right across the street, so maybe you can sit on the steps over there to enjoy your dino.
author: Ray C.

description:
The actual shop itself is really nifty.  It's fun to walk inside and see the different T-Rex pictures and paintings.  It really gives the shop some character.  

The one tiny downside is that Vietnamese sandwiches are supposed to be cheap.  At 5 dollars a sandwich, that's about double what I usually expect to spend.

But rarely do you ever find Vietnamese sandwiches with this much heft. They don't skimp on the meat, which makes up for the usually sparse sandwiches you get for half the price at other, more traditional shops.  The best thing about them? The rolls are baked to perfection.  Crunchy on the outside and crispy on the inside.  

If you haven't done so, at least try it out once!
author: Andrew T.

description: Great Vietnamese restaurant a few blocks down from the Castro. They'll make anything protein style for you and they HOOK YOU UP when you ask for it like that. So much meat and it's very fresh. Pâté is delicious wrapped in the pork. Everything was delicious and there is outdoor seating for those sunny days.
author: Patrick M.

description: The bahn mi sandwiches here are ridiculously good. I seriously eat here once or twice a week.
author: Brendan m.

description: The sandwiches here are good but nothing special and we all know you can get a Banh mi sandwich anywhere in the city for under $5. Dinosaurs keeps raising the prices on their menu and gouging customers.  I'm a total foodie and know better not to let some Vietnamese sandwich shop fool me into paying 8 bucks for a sandwich made from the cheapest part of the chicken.  No thanks!
author: G A.

description: Beautiful staff, delicious food, comfortable and casual environment. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Niki M.

description:
Oh hell yes.

Come here if you love dinosaurs. Hardcore. But also, subtly.

At first, I was a little underwhelmed by the seeming lack of dinosaur presence. Then, I started looking around...

dinosaur pinball? don't stress...it's here.
dinosaur paintings on the wall? for sure.
i heart dinosaurs sticker on the tip jar? you betcha.
creepy/kinda cute mini dinosaur figurines poking out of random corners? of course!

AND delicious Vietnamese sandwiches? OH YES.

Super duper friendly service - they were eating lunch when I got there but cheerfully took a break to take my order + deliver my delicious pork bahn mi. Pickled daikon was a plus. And the baguette was freakin amazing..fantastically fresh, crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside.

Truly...this was probably a 4.5 stars. Since they had a scoutmob deal going, and TWO sandwiches cost about $5, they get all 5 :)
author: Monica C.

description: Nom... Nom...nom... Most places are stingy with the jalapeños, but dinosaurs is just right. Plus they have vegan options. I'm in love.
author: Amanda S.

description: Wow! Ordered spring roll and sandwich, both amazing! The sandwich had so much flavor, and so fresh and healthy. I want to come back tomorrow. The Thai tea is great too.
author: Bob G.

description: My absolute favorite Banh mi sandwich place in the entire world. I live near little Saigon in Orange County so I've had my fair share of Banh mi. The sandwiches here are so unbelievably flavorful. I prefer The Pork or The Chicken, though I've tried The Special and it's not for me. The thai iced tea is way too sweet so if they watered it down a bit then this place would be perfect. 4/5 because most things are great but not everything.
author: Annaliese B.

description:
Dinosaurs is one of my neighborhood regulars -- cheap, reliable, quick, and good.  

I can count on almost one hand my favorite banh mi places in the city, and this is one of them.  I think one of the keys to a good banh mi is the bread, and Dinosaurs has the bread part of the equation down.  It's the right amount of bread (not too much, not too little), and it's got the right amount of crispy to chewy ratio.  

I always get the chicken banh mi so I can't speak to the other meats, but the other big key to banh mi's for me is well-seasoned meat, and the chicken is moist and well-seasoned, meaning that the sandwich is not dry.  The pickled accompaniments are also well-seasoned.

The older-ish Asian woman who prepares the food to the side is super nice too :)

Thank you, Dinosaurs, for being a reliable and cheap neighborhood destination.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
Banh Mi in Castro. + Star
Price. - Star
Solid sandwiches. + Star
Chill workers. + Star
Not much seating. - Star
Dinosaurs. + Star
Price in Castro. + Star
Potential. + Star

(Yes it adds up to 4.)
author: Charles T.

description:
Totally A-OK and yummy!! Also, a really good value and friendly service.

I had the fried tofu vegan sandwich and it was very tasty. The veganaise and jalepenos added a ton of heat and flavor, while the fried tofu and crispy bread gave the sandwich great texture.

I'd totally stop by again if I was looking for a quick bite in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't die if I never went back.

Also, if you're looking for a place with ambience and a warm, inviting atmosphere, this is totally not the place for you. But a for a quick and easy sandwich, it's perfect!
author: Theresa P.

description: Very very tasty!! Probably as good or maybe better than Café Bunn Mi, and sambal hot sauce at no charge, I will definitely come back!!
author: Anna N.

description:
I give this place 3 nomz. NOM NOM NOMZ. 

Serious business if you like vietnamese sandwiches. Their bread is off the chain here compared to most regular Vietnamese joints. 

The spicy (Sriracha laden) Tuna sandwich was sooo good. 

But my fav to say the least is their Pork Sandwich. Bomb (dot) com (dot) biz (dot) net. 

I actually learned of this place through Scoutmob, and I'm sure as hell glad I did. Whenever I'm in the mood for some vietnamese sammies, I'll come here to satisfy my cravings.
author: Eric A.

description:
I'll admit it. I'm a Saigon Sandwich devotee, but I'll sample banh mi pretty much anywhere when the craving hits. Dinosaurs was a random Saturday morning adventure for me and I'd probably return if I'm in the neighborhood. I got the Special, which is roasted pork, fancy pork (I will never understand what fancy pork is, but it shows up everywhere), and pate. Bread was good, flavor was solid. Texture was a little weird. The only way I can describe the roast pork is to compare it to the texture of corned beef? Weird, right? Like it was shaved roast pork? Dunno.

Anyway, service was super friendly, loved the outdoor seating option and the fact that it wasn't in a sketchy area. Definitely will be back to sample some of the other flavors...maybe the spicy tuna?
author: Karena Q.

description:
BEST BAHN MI PERIOD. I've eaten vietnamese sandwiches everywhere and hands down Dinosaurs knocks it out/ of the park! Spring rolls are packed tight & stuffed with flavor, not all loose, soggy & bland like some places. I don't live close but when I'm in SF this is where I'm going first & taking home an extra bahn mi for later or tomorrows breakfast :-)

Oh and we usually call in our order since parking in the Castro is horrible, I wait on the side street by the library & my lovely wife picks up our order.

I miss the old skinnier buns, my wife says I'm imagining things but I swear the buns changed. I think they are less crunchy now and can get a bit soggy after a couple hours without eating.
author: Aidan R.

description:
Dinosaurs Vietnamese sandwich shop in the Castro is a great find. The sandwiches are not only delicious but cheap. Being able to get a banging sandwich for $4.75 in San Francisco is quite a deal. 

We wandered upon this place last Sunday and I have been thinking about it ever since. John was a bit tentative about the whole Vietnamese sandwich place as it's not his normal 'turkey and swiss on Dutch Crunch" kind of sandwich, but he was pleasantly surprised. Ordering is quite easy as there are only a few choices, chicken, pork, tofu, etc. John and I both enjoyed the chicken. He went with just the meat and sandwich bread as he was still a bit weary of the place. I ordered the chicken sandwich just as it is on the menu with sliced jalapenos, pickled radishes, shredded carrots, fresh cilantro and just the right amount of mayo. It was delicious! Be aware that Dinosaurs puts all the toppings on their sandwiches, so specify if you want a variation of the norm. The meat was delicious and the toppings fantastic. My favorite part was the pickled radishes. 

Dinosaurs has outdoor seating so be sure to check out the place when you can take a seat outside and enjoy the Castro's sun.
author: Alice S.

description: Dinosaurs makes a good vegetarian bahn mi sandwich. I wouldn't recommend dining in, as the small cafe was pretty dirty when we visited. I also tried one of the vegetarian spring rolls, and honestly, they were gross - super chewy, weird texture, cold and old tofu. But the bahn mi was good and worth the visit. I'll be back and next time I'll take my sandwich to the park.
author: R. J.

description: Alright so since I'm broke I thought I cash in on my 2 free sammys here the owner was nice enough to give me after my mediocre experience there last time. I gave them a while to see if there were any improvements done and YES it improved! So I ordered a specialty and a meatball both with no jalapenos please. Got home took a  bite of the specialty and I got a mouth full of um, jalapenos! Well it didn't bother me too much. The vegetables are now done right, well pickled! The meats tasted fresh and not processed like other places and it was a good amount of pate, I liked it. The next day I had the meatball one and the vegetables again nicely pickled. The meatballs were tasty, it was solid. Thanks for the complimentary 2nd chance!
author: Karen T.

description:
The staff is super friendly. The sandwiches are really tasty. And I live a short walk away in the same neighborhood. What more can a girl ask for?

I always order the Crispy Tofu or Chicken sandwich and I'm never disappointed. I have also had the Spicy Tuna, which I like to eat when I'm feeling adventurous. It's not a typical Vietnamese sandwich, but it's good and pretty damn spicy. The sandwiches are always consistently delicious every time I come here, which makes me a repeat patron.
author: Zona P.

description:
I've been here a few times now so now I feel like I can give a more accurate rating.  Other than the bread and pickled veggies, these bahn mi are not very authentically Vietnamese.  The meat choices may sound authentic, but the way that they're prepared  and marinated aren't completely true to Vietnamese style.  The meat serving size is also a bit meager.  This doesn't mean that the bahn mi don't taste good though!  The sandwiches are made on a delicious roll that manages to have a crispy crust and the softest inside.  Just know that you're not getting a completely authentic Vietnamese sandwich.

It's a nice alternative to Ike's and convenient to pick up on your way to Delores Park.
author: Denise C.

description:
Best bahn mi I've ever had.

This is probably the single thing I miss about San Francisco the most. I could eat these every day. Get the bbq pork....
author: Bob S.

description: Loved that we got the Yelp Check In discount! As for the sandwiches we tried the vegetarian versions as well as the watermelon lychee jelly drink. The sandwich bread was a bit tough, we prefer a softer baguette and both sandwiches felt a bit overly stuffed with carrots. The drink was really really refreshing and had a good balance of sweetness.
author: Josie C.

description: Just ate at their Pacifica location (50 Eureka Square). Sparse surroundings in an outdoor mall, but more than balanced by warm, friendly service and great food. Went here with a Groupon voucher and will be back. Delicious tofu Banh Mi as well as many others. Appreciate their use of Vegenaise on sandwich. Recommending it to all my Pacifica friends.
author: Howard S.

description:
I honestly crave the crispy tofu sando more than ANY other sandwich or type of food in SF. Serious.

Dinosaurs is a great place, with super nice people. You can call ahead and they'll have your sandwich ready in about 5 or 10 mins.

I love the crispy tofu but everyone I know has a different favorite so I recommend trying them all to find the one you'll like best!
author: Erica B.

description:
As a San Jose native I know good Vietnamese food. Undoubtedly, Dinosaurs does it right! The grilled pork bahn mi is excellent. I will go out of my way to get my hands on another. 

To elaborate, each ingredient in the sandwich is fresh and flavorful. The bred was soft and crunchy, but not excessively crunchy. The pork was done right, and the pickled veggies were crisp with the right amount of sweetness. More over the jalapenos had a strong kick so you know Dinosaurs is authentic!
author: Itzcally P.

description: My favorite is the special sandwich. It has pate, and all little slivered meat pieces inside. It's conveniently located in the Castro,tucked in a back street. If you're in the mood for a quick and delicious bite head on over.
author: Kenson K.

description: Very filling sandwiches for their size. Yum yum for your Tum Tum. They have vegetarian choices too. Looking for a place for a inexpensive first date instead of typical "coffee" this is a great place to go. It's about the same prices as if you went to Starbucks anyway.
author: Veronica P.

description:
Absolutely consistent banh mi....
Still great layers, flavors and crunch.
Good job guys!
My friend Valerie (who's Vietnamese) also tried the crispy tofu banh mi and definitely loved it except maybe she was expecting a different crunch.
True, they do use a baguette-like bread, not the usual roll with rice flour, but I actually love it that way :)
author: Dario B.

description: Dinosaurs is the perfect Vietnamese sandwich for an afternoon picnic at Delores park. This place is Vietnamese sandwich fusion and it is a kind of american twist on traditional French/Vietnamese sandwiches. They are a little bit more pricey tan most vietnamese sandwiches but they are the best in my opinion. i just love the beef and bbq pork sandwiches. The sandwiches are perfect perfect amount of meat the cilantro and the cucumber everything about this sandwich is awesome..get a drink and some chips and you got yourself a picnic at the park for two. it is located on market near the castro and for whatever reason i always have luck finding parking when i drive. this place is dope and i guess the owner use to own the streetwear brand invisible stripes which i remember being out for a minute so that it is kind of cool the owner is a young entrepreneur.
author: Miss M.

description:
I like Dinosaurs. It's unpretentious and has all the basic bånh mi flavors. To my surprise, the crispy tofu became my favorite sandwich there. 

The only reason the place doesn't get a full 5 stars from me is that the sandwiches are a little dry and require a little extra veggies (I think that's $0.50 extra) and maybe a tad bit more mayo.

So close my flat, I'm there almost every week. You should to. Avoid that special trip to the Tenderloin.
author: Trinity M.

description: I really liked the watermelon lychee drink! Their bahn mi's are also good, too
author: Eric J.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM

Dinosaurs is one of the best kept secrets in the Castro. Modestly sized, but competitively priced, these sandwiches have me waking up in the middle of the night with cravings! All of the sandwiches have the same relative ingredients, but they are all delicious in their own way. I usually get the chicken because I'm a little boring sometimes, but I've ventured out and been surprised by how good the meatball, pork, and especially the crispy tofu are! And for only $5, it's easy on the wallet. Or go with a friend, and split 3 sandwiches for a little taste of everything!
author: Geno B.

description:
[Reviewed by Kel]

Finding a $5 sandwich in the Castro is about as mythical as a vampire sighting.  So, when I stumbled upon Dinosaurs one weekend, I was pleasantly surprised and the frugal husband was mighty pleased. We paid $10 for two sandwiches plus a drink from the short list of menu options. 

Sure, it's twice as much as the Vietnamese sandwich shops in the Tenderloin. But we also saved ourselves the hassle of side-stepping human urine puddles on the TL sidewalks. I'd say that's worth my $2.50.

Sandwiches were tasty, bread was crunchy, and we were happy to find a cheap Castro eat (although still, no vampires). But, it is the Castro, and we did eat here on the weekend of the Folsom Street Fair, so maybe a vampire sighting wouldn't have been so far fetched. I have seen stranger....
author: Kel S.

description: I got a Groupon for this place ($12 for $20) and got more than enough food for me and my friend. the shrimp papaya salad was tangy, the banh mi sandwich was delicious, the spring rolls were big portions, the thai iced tea was hella good, and the mango mint tea was deliciously refreshing. Overall, a great deal and you'll definitely get the most bang for your buck
author: Jamie L.

description:
Thanks to ScoutMob I got 2 sandwiches for $4.75! At $4.75, the sandwiches are a deal as it is, and I would definitely say it's a 5 bucks well spent. 

First off, yay for Dinosaurs cause they have crusty toasted bread that doesn't cut the top of your mouth when you're eating it - it's just the right ratio of soft to crisp! The sandwiches are warm and fully packed with goodness. I got the special and the pork. The special has roasted pork, fancy pork, and a pate spread (so yum) along with all the pickled veggies and jalapenos. Sweet, salty, tangy in every bite. The pork is grilled and lemongrass seasoned, just as good as the special! Each sandwich is served warm and though it may look petite and you may question if you'll be hungry after but it packs a punch and you'll be satisfied after your last bite.

Service was slow when I stopped by. Though there isn't a line, there is a constant flow of people coming in and ordering, and with only one person working the cashier and assembling sandwiches you can imagine that everything takes a while to happen. There are 4 tables inside though, and spring rolls you can get instantly - it did slightly bother me that the shrimp spring rolls were sitting outside of a coldbox during a hot day.

Overall, Dinosaurs was great place to get a banh mi without having to brave walking through the Tenderloin. Cheers to more banh mi's!
author: Nicole L.

description: Get The Special - pork 3 ways with perfect bread! Great value and amazingly delicious, especially with generous squirts of sriracha.
author: Runqiu C.

description:
I would post a pic of my sandwich but it's gone already. 

Under $5 for a HONKIN sammich?!  Yes please!
author: Matt V.

description:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to get a sandwich from here. Anyway, I love it and thanks to Dinosaurs, the banh mi is pretty much my new favourite sandwich of all time. I had the 'Special' which was $4.75 and had crusty French bread, roast pork (slightly cha siu flavor to it? Or maybe I imagined that), another type of pork, pate, plus all the pickled carrot, daikon, cucumber, jalopenos and most importantly, fresh cilantro. What more could you ask for?

Can't wait to go back and try them all. It's gonna be my new stop-off place before Dolores Park...
author: Annie C.

description: Dinosaurs got my order wrong. Again. I don't really understand why this is so complicated for them. Every time I order take-out it is the same thing: two sandwiches with no jalapenos and vegannaise instead of mayonnaise. Usually they get it right, but there have been too many times where they have gotten it wrong on one or both. Open up your sandwich to check that it's right before you drive off. Attention to detail here is wanting.
author: Kelly D.

description: YUM! i wish i could have The Special everyday for lunch. Definitely come here for your Banh Mi fix. Goes well with their thai iced coffee too. Great value, friendly service & outdoor seating when the weather's nice :)
author: Adrienne C.

description: Awesome! Fast & tasty! Vegans will be stoked. There fried tofu Banh mi sandwiches are amazing! The shaking beef is also really tasty. Defiantly a place I'll be coming back to.
author: Daniel T.

description:
YUMMMZZZ!!!  This place is great!

I love Vietnamese Sandwiches!!! I love that it's in my neighborhood!
I tried their Pork Sandwich and it was DELISH!!  The service was great, there was no line and the sandwich was made in 5 mins, not bad at all.  It's also perfect for those sunny park days!  

I'll be back for more bánh mì, as I can never get tired of them!!
author: Alvin M.

description:
THE PORK 
delicious, fun area as well as cute little shop
the flavors in the meat and as well over all in the sandwich are very good and its hard to stay away at about $4.50 for a sandwich.
the service is super fast and they have a good selection of asian beverages.
also they have a Jurassic Park pin ball machine!
author: Adriana K.

description: Delicious sandwiches. Ordered the special, shaking beef, and chicken. Reasonable prices. Will definitely be back.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Last night I was walking in my neighborhood and noticed this place and stood puzzled for a few minutes, vietnamese sandwiches in my neighbz?NO WAY.

YES WAY

I had already ordered food elsewhere,so I decided to come try it today.Glad I did.This place is delicious.Got The Special which is the pork and pate and all the fixins and it's delicious(im chomping on it as I'm typing this ). Nice staff including let me mention the hottest dude with dimples and a great tattoo sleeve.I am sorry if you are reading this but I was staring at you the whole time you made my sandwich you are so cute!!!

back to the food ...this place is great.I'm with Abby P with the closure of overhyped Ikes maybe Dinosaurs will get more traffic.Delish!
author: Lauren V.

description: Had the special sandwich which has pork, meatloaf, and pate without the mayo.  Everything tasted well together.  Lots of veggies (carrots, peppers, radish, and cilantro. The bread was nice and crunchy, as it should be.  A little bit more expensive that what you'd expect to pay for a Bahn Mi, but a good alternative to the other sandwich places around and under $5.  The person working behind the counter was very friendly and quick to make the sandwich and servicing the other customers orders.
author: Marck N.

description: I love the bread on their sandwiches! The sandwich is good too and so is the service. Something nice and quick on those days that you need to be quick.
author: Heather R.

description:
Ok, I must say that I was a little skeptical to try.. but, since I was really craving for some good Bahn Mi, and not too far where I was staying.. I tried this place. Got the special one I think that is the name. Anyway, came to my surprise.. It was good!!!  

Price wise? not bad at all. Well, since I didn't want to catch the muni to Chinatown, I think it's as good as I would get!
author: Daisy S.

description: I'm waiting at home at this very moment while my GF brings home the crispy tofu- I customize it with extra veganaise and avo. I'm not a vegetarian but I'm addicted to this sandwich. The French bread n veggies are always fresh n the gals n dudes who run the joint are always friendly.
author: Sabine L.

description: This is actually one of my favorite places in the Castro. HOWEVER, I've noticed their service getting worse by every visit. I recently dropped by in the evening to grab a sandwich. There was no one in line, though there were a few other customers waiting for their order. The man working the register was making an avocado slushy, and he let me know that he'd get to me. He was having quite a bit of trouble and spent 10 minutes trying to crush the ice. At this point, all the customers waiting for their food had already left. Yet I was still waiting to get my order in, even though the dude making the sandwiches was free. I ended up walking out of the store. Yes, I was a bit hAngry, and got impatient, but I must say that that's terrible service.
author: Garen K.

description:
These sando's are so tasty. I love them so much. The grilled pork that comes in "The Pork" (my favorite) has spot-on flavors and texture, the white roll is crispy and substantial and the ingredients-to-bread ratio is well calculated. I also enjoy that jalapeno kick every few bites. It's not your grandmother's banh mi but dare I say better?

The young Vietnamese dudes that run the shop are super friendly. Good job, young dudes. You guys are my heroes.
author: Kevin W.

description: Very very good sandwiches! The most important thing on a sandwich is the bread, and the bread at Dinosaur's is exceptional. Everything was fresh and the staff very polite and helpful.
author: Chris S.

description: Dinosaurs offers delicious affordable fresh banh mi sandwiches and other great fast Vietnamese options. I'd recommend the lemongrass pork banh mi or their new item, shaken beef banh mi. I was a vegetarian for a number of years and also like the tofu banh mi. The vegetables on all the sandwiches are super fresh and the service is always very pleasant. I just found out that they have another sandwich shop on Ocean Ave at Junipero Serra. Dinosaurs and Dinosaurs II are highly recommended for a fast bite to eat!
author: Christopher C.

description: While on vacation I came here twice. I ended up trying four different sandwiches and each was truly delicious. The staff was incredibly kind and welcoming. If I lived in the city I would make this a regular stop. 5 dollars for an amazing sandwich can't be beat. This is a must try place.
author: Tyler B.

description:
It's tasty! And cheap! I get the Special and an iced coffee: $8 total.

My only gripes are the lack of sandwich choices (come on, what kind of Vietnamese sandwich shop doesn't have barbecue pork?), and the price of the coffee. Exorbitant? Sure. Delicious? You bet your ass.
author: Phuong M.

description:
Just a breath away from that hellhole known as Ike's and way more healthy, Dinosaurs is cheap, precious, simple and fresh. You can even get vegenaise on any sandwich. That's how much they care about your arteries.

There was just one small girl working the counter and making the sandwiches, so we decided to give her a run for her money. We ordered three sandwiches for the two of us to get the old stamp card a few hits. The bread was super fresh, and the crispy tofu was almost as good as Saigon Sandwich's. I also tried the pork meatball sandwich, and that was delicious! My only complaint is that it could have used a couple more meatballs. MmmmmmmMMMmmmmmmm!!!! Definitely coming back because I can't resist a stamp card! It's like a challenge staring you in the face.
author: Laura M.

description: I'm glad I finally stopped in at this slightly hidden hole in the wall.  I ordered the special bahn mi which has your standard pork, pork loaf, and pate.  The bread was fresh and nicely toasted and the pate, which makes the sandwich, was spectacular.  The shredded carrots were sweeter than I'm used to but where a very nice touch.
author: Alan C.

description:
Vegan mayonnaise (for my healthy heart). Jurassic Park pinball machine (for my 16yr old self who loved that movie...and still does). Less than $5 grilled chicken cutlet (for my wallet). Delicious (for my taste buds). Super friendly (for karma).

All based covered. A strong four stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Just opened up two weeks ago!  The banh mi special is reallly good....the bread is cooked perfectly, and its loaded with pickled veggies meat and pate.  It's easy to hold and easy to eat.  The banh mi is also a really good size - I was pretty full with one banh mi and some spring rolls.  

Dinosaur's is located right next to Ike's place...but hey at least if you can't go to Ike's you got another good sandwich option spot next door!  Either way, definitely coming back!
author: Justin L.
