description: The lemongrass pork sandwich is tasty, as are their shrimp (only) spring rolls. I would have rated 5 stars, but I have issues with the restaurant's cleanliness. The walls and windows don't look like they've ever been cleaned, the floors are filthy, and the chairs and tables are sticky. I still eat here though
author: Tim G.

description:
Sorry but this place doesn't deserve 4 stars unless you've never tasted a real Vietnamese sandwich and think this place is a "cute ethnic restaurant."

The sandwiches tasted "good" but fell far from the mark for true, good Vietnamese sandwiches. I don't mean to say that I'm a purist, but that real Vietnamese sandwiches would be 6 stars on a 5-star scale, so "good" just doesn't cut it. They were "ok."

I wouldn't hesitate to pick one up for convenience, but not a place I would crave or go out of my way for.
author: J C.

description:
Perfectly sized Vietnamese sandwiches for less than $5.

No frills menu, not trying to be anything more than a sandwich shop, super friendly staff, kombucha and coconut water in their drinks fridge (So SF, I love it!!), seating outside when it's nice out. No brainer. 

I'm totally a fan.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Had lunch here on Friday.  
Tried 4 of the 6 sandwiches, combo, chicken, meatball, and tofu

The combo was no-bueno. The pork had turned a bit and was completely inedible.  The chicken was the best.  Good grill flavor, but small portion of meat.  The meatball tasted very bland and steamed.  The tofu was interesting shreads (advertised as crispy, but not) and overall kind of odd.  the vegan mayo helped it as the sweetness created some flavor complexity.  

They use Bakers of Paris rolls like Saigon Sandwich does.  They don't appear to have much in terms of cooking equipment and it shows as everything has a cooked/cooled/reheated blandness to it.  

The guys who run the place are cool. Young, friendly and energized.  I hope they can work on the food, as it has no cravability at this point.
author: Aaron N.

description: Waiting in a block-long line for Ike's on a weekend? Take a sandwich shortcut and sneak yourself down to Dinosaurs. Ike's is great, sure, but you could have enjoyed a crispy-tangy-spicy-meaty banh mi from Dinosaurs twice over for a fraction of the price and the time investment.
author: Connor Skye R.

description:
I love vietnamese sandwiches. I was once the mayor of Saigon Sandwiches on 4square (my only foodie claim to fame). When I heard about a vietnamese sando place opening up in my neighborhood, I had to check it out.

Overall--simply great! I've come back five times! Great job guys!
author: John M.

description: I don't have anything bad to say about this sandwich shop.  I love everything about it and I think as they grow and expand they just keep getting better and better.  The ingredients are fresh.  The sandwiches can be made to order and the special drinks are truly "special".  They have great customer service.  What makes me happy is that even with a few new staff members, I'm still impressed.  This place is worth checking out if you are ever in the area and crave a quick bite or if you're in the mood for a vietnamese sandwich.  I'm glad I live close by and I get to stop by whenever I want.  :) I recommend the portobello or the shaking beef extra spicy.  Cool it down with the mango mint smoothie.  It'll bring sunshine to your life or your meal.  ;)
author: Marita S.

description: Definite repeat when I'm in the area.  Wishing sandwich had more meat, but what was lacking there was made up in flavor. My son especially loved the bread roll
author: Deanne M.

description: Great bahn mi place, very reasonable price, I think around $8 all in for a massive sandwich.  Best cheap lunch I've found so far in the Castro.
author: Anon A.

description: Quick, Cheap Authentic Vietnamese treats. Local regular. Excellent rolls and sanwiches.
author: Wendy P.

description:
Definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood.  I don't consider this real banh mi, since the place is run by hipsters instead of elderly Vietnamese ladies and the bread is not the light, crispy baguette that banh mi traditionally has.

Also, their prices are normal for a sandwich, i.e., around $5, which is probably for the best since I always feel really guilty buying banh mi from said elderly Vietnamese ladies for some price like $2.25, which I assume is bankrupting them.
author: Ethan R.

description:
The meat to veggie ratio is off and is weighted towards the meat.

Annoyed to eat cilantro stems. This is a sign of laziness on the sandwich maker's part.

Service is good. Location is good. 

You are better off going to Duc Loi's on 18th and Mission--where Vietnamese aunties, instead of high-schoolers, will make you a banh mi.
author: Jon H.

description: Dinosaurs has dino decor, asian snacks like yan yan and your basic banh mi. Sandwiches include your basic banh mi fixins but are on the smaller side of most banh mis. The bread is also soft with a slight crunch. I tried the special pork as well as the tofu banh mi which were good but not impressively flavorful. Also, although no other customers were in the shop, service was still pretty slow.
author: Maya S.

description:
I just recently found this place off of market and 16th. I have to say I am hooked on the sandwiches they have. I have found myself going at least 3 time a week. The sandwiches are amazing, the price is great (average sandwich is around $4.75) The people are very friendly

Definitely recommend trying the special hmmm ;)
author: Mike D.

description: One of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten.  Hands down!
author: MT D.

description:
Dinomighty...finally a Vietnamese sandwich shop that speaks English and delivers for large catering orders!  I've been eager to order banh mi for my office lunch since I started months ago.  It took a few calls to get a copy of their menu.  Once I emailed my order to Chris, he confirmed they'd be able to accommodate my order of 30+ sandwiches and spring rolls.  He was running a little late with our delivery, but the weather was bad and he had to fight with all the last minute holiday shoppers downtown for a parking spot, so I don't blame him.  The food totally made up for it!

I grew up taking banh mi to school instead of pb&j sandwiches.  These were pretty legit.  Not the cheapest or best like I used to get in San Jose, but still half the price of the typical sandwiches found in the FiDi and pretty tasty.  Watch out for the jalapenos...they are spicy!  Vegetarians and meat eaters alike were pleased.  I'm definitely keeping this in the office lunch rotation.
author: nini t.

description:
Hits the spot. A welcome addition to the hood. Nice people, good sandwiches, really awesome prices. 

Great place for a quick Vietnamese sandwich fix.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Half way down the street from the craziness that is Ike's is this Vietnamese sandwich deli.  There are a few places in the Castro that offer Vietnamese sandwiches (yes there are other places that do sell Vietnamese sandwiches) but this is the only one that focuses exclusively on them.  

I've been here twice and I really want to love this place but must admit that I only like it.  Both times I've been I've had the #1 Special.  The first time I went, it was at closing time and the sandwich that I had was filled with cold meats and was a total dud. 

 I wanted to give this place a second chance  This time I went at lunchtime and the result were a little better but not perfect.  I was famished so I was totally looking forward to a yummy sandwich.  What I got was a fairly ordinary sandwich...ugh soooo disappointed.  The pork was bland and the pickled vegetables were under-pickled.  The good news...the bread was toasted to perfection and the pate was good.  Maybe I should try another sandwich the next time.

Overall, the sandwich selection is limited.  The prices are about a $1 more than most Vietnamese sandwich places.  The service was a little slow.  But I do suggest that people give it a try as I want neighborhood businesses to succeed.
author: Thang H.

description: Best lunch value ever.  Check in on yelp to get 10% off.  All of their sammies are amazing.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: I used to not care for Vietnamese food.  Recently, I have been experiencing a whole new side to Vietnamese cuisine.  These sandwiches are out of this world.  I love the crispy bread, the sweet and spicy flavors mixing with some solid slices of meat.  No one ingredient rules this sandwich; they all blend together and I dig that type of cohesion.  Killer deal for lunch.  Or really any meal.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Sandwiches are tasty, they had a great variety of snacks, and drinks! 

The staff were very friendly, and played really good music.

Atmosphere was cute. Great for on the run lunches.

I recommend the special. 

The price is perfect for the meal.
author: Mars D.

description: It's a tiny little place, very comfy and cozy. When we arrived all the table were taken, but the kind fella behind the counter move the chip racks and brought in another tble for us...very nice!! The pork sandwichs are AMAZING! I will go back the next time I'm in the City.
author: Kayte T.

description:
I was so excited to hear that a bahn mi shop was opening in my neighborhood.  I am constantly craving the food of my peope so I had to check it out immediately.  I went by for lunch last week.  The shop was empty and I had to double check that it was, in fact, the Dinosaur I was looking for (heh).  

Like any respectable bahn mi shop, the menu is limited to 5 or 6 sandwiches, all of which were fairly recognizable combinations to me.  I ordered the pork special, which had roasted pork, pork pate, and pork terrine (gio).  They also had a nice selection of canned drinks that would be recognizable to anyone familiar with Vietnamese food (soy milk, grass jelly, chrysanthemem tea, etc.). 

I was going to get the sandwich to go but I felt bad seeing all the empty seats so I got it for here and plopped down in a chair by the window.  A few minutes later my sandwich came out.

It was fantastic.  First off, it was STUFFED to the brim with pork.  My mother would probably chastise them for using enough meat for four sandwiches in one.  But believe me, I wasn't complaining. The pork was flavorful and moist, the pate was tasty but not overwhelming (I actually usually ask bahn mi shops to hold the pate, but this was great), and the gio was a nice touch.  The pickled carrots and daikon were fresh and crunchy.  I usually like my pickles more tart but I think these were great for an American palate.  Add some mayo and jalapenos and a nicely toasted and crunchy roll, and it really was a fantastic sandwich.  I much prefer it to the bahn mi from Castro Tarts.

I liked that the place was quiet (with some nice hipster music playing).  It was a pleasant refuge from the craziness of the Castro on a nice summer day.  And at $4.75, it's a deal that can't be beat.  I'll be back for sure.

So seriously, all you hipsters standing in line for 45 minutes waiting to shell out $11 for a sandwich the size of your head at Ike's*: Give Dinosaurs a try.  There really is enough room on that block for two awesome sandwich shops.

* No knock. Believe me, I'm one of you.  Just a more impatient version.
author: Courtney N.

description: I have been here a handful of times and have not been disappointed. I am not a vegan or vegetarian, but I love tofu and they happened to have a crispy tofu sandwhich. It was awesome! I have never had anything like it (in terms of bahn mi). It can be a little on the dry side since the contents are slivers of fried tofu, but the flavors are great! I did not miss the meat at all and I am usually a fan of the bbq pork bahn mi.
author: Angelito R.

description: The bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the side. The sandwich was exploding with filling. I wouldn't say it is the best I have had but if I am in the neighborhood and I am in the mood, I would go back. Like other reviewers, the prices are definitely more than the usual bahn-mi but it is in the Castro, so I am guessing that is why the prices are more.
author: Eve C.

description: We used to come here almost 3 times per week until our move to NYC. My wife and I always ordered the same thing. Spicy tuna for her and Crispy tofu with extra veggies for me. Every time the sandwiches are amazing, with perfectly crispy bread. Miss this spot and I miss the fabulous location in the Castro.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
3.5 

Maybe it is just me, but I think their sandwiches are overpriced for the sandwich size. Their spring rolls were also $4.75 which I thought was pricey. Comparing it to San Jose, you can definitely get a bigger Vietnamese Sandwich for $4.75 and 3 spring rolls for around $3 bucks. But then again, I should probably take into consideration I am in the city, and in SF everything is always a little bit more expensive. Besides the pricing, the food quality was good. I really enjoyed my sandwich. I had "The Special" with roast pork. I like how their buns were not hard and difficult to bite into, like other Vietnamese sandwich places. The staff working there was super friendly. They made conversation and made my experience enjoyable and made me want to come back.
author: Katrina T.

description: Tried the Crispy Tofu vietnamese sandwich.  Not bad.  There was a little too much Vegenaise for my taste.
author: Teresa C.

description: Great tasty sandwiches. One of my local favorites. Fairly inexpensive. 'Hole in the wall' type location. Definitely recommended.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Food and service are consistently decent. Usually get the shaken beef sandwich and chicken cabbage salad to go.
Not a fan of the decor; ergo, food taste better away from premise.
author: teatzar s.

description:
Quite nice food and efficient service. 

I have tried all of there sandwiches. Never let down.

Keep up the decent work.
author: Leonidas G.

description: Best bahn mi I've ever had. The bread is always fresh and perfectly toasted. I recommend getting the pork sandwich and add pâté. The staff is always friendly and nothing beats sitting outside on a nice day.
author: Brooke N.

description:
Summary.
To sum everything up, I wouldn't go out of your way for these, but if you're looking for a quite bite at a decent price its definitely worth it. Decent but not cheap like tenderloin's vietnamese sandwiches. Tofu is interesting pork is good, chicken is ok, meatball is boo boo. Service is friendly!


-----

I'd like to say I've been a fan of Bahn Mi's for quite sometime. I also respect the different types kind and variations in Bahn Mi's. I went to Dinosaurs to get a Scoutmob coupon (50% bill max $10, but actually turned out to be only $5) which turned out to be wrong (per the owner). 

The lady at the counter was nice, and the owner was friendly, despite the misunderstanding on the Scoutmob deal.

What I ordered and what I found out:

Tofu: Neat, never had a tofu bahn mi before. Crispy with pieces of taro root deep fried to round it out. Not bad at all. 

Grilled Pork: Slight hint of lemon gras, done cleanly, but not that flavorful.

Meatball: Kinda iffy, It was sorta bland, wouldn't order it again. 

Chicken: Good flavor, I didn't care for the texture of the chicken, sorta creamy slimy. The gf did however, like it. 

Overall sandwich: The bread was great, mayo, veggies were fresh. 

The place is clean, and people are friendly. I kinda like the dinosaur theme, although weird for a Vietnamese sandwich place (you would think its hamburgers or bbq). 

The price is more expensive than normal Vietnamese places, but its also not in the tenderloin with not as friendly service. Given that, parking is easier in the tenderloin than in Castro. Castro is 100x more clean though. Only problem is I always get Vietnamese sandwiches on the go. 

To sum everything up, I wouldn't go out of your way for these, but if you're looking for a quite bite at a decent price its definitely worth it.
author: Steven C.

description: I love the food here. BUTT prompting for a tip for just picking up my to go order? Remove that from your terminal.
author: Loren S.

description:
i've had the special and the meatball. both were decent. $4.50 is a bit on the pricy vietnamese sandwich side of the map for me, but this is a game of supply and demand. near here, there's zero supply (that i know of).

the place is obviously new, with big sheets of exposed plywood for the counter, and stacks of beverages in the front area. but if they keep it up, perhaps ike's line will get just a tad smaller and dinosaurs won't go extinct (har har har).
author: Ameer N.

description: A delicious sandwich joint tucked into the back of an open mall like building on Market.  You can get to it from Market, but it's easier to find off 16th street with a red marked off outdoor table area.  It's a deli-counter type establishment, but a damn good sandwich - I had the special, which was roast pork with a pork pate along with your other standard Bahn Mi ingredients - excellent bread, veggies, jalapenos, etc.  Not sure why the name, but the sandwich was damn good.
author: Dave N.

description: Found this place on the Yelp app because of their check-in offer (10% off when you check-in on Yelp). So glad I did because this is a great alternative to the famous Ike's Place down the road. To me, Dinosaurs is a nice alternative to Ike's because it's not as crowded and the sandwiches aren't as heavy (not to knock Ike's Place, because they are terrific if you're hungry and alright with a bit of a line). The tofu sandwich is excellent and the service is always great, so this is my new favorite sandwich spot.
author: Blake H.

description:
This was a favorite lunch spot of mine while working in the neighborhood because of the delicious sandwiches, quick preparation time, low cost and friendly staff. 

My favorites are the chicken and the meatball. The tofu is also delicious. Nice to wash it down with a coconut water or chilled green tea. 

It's a great place to go on weekends especially when nearby establishments are swamped with long wait times. Grab a sandwich and enjoy yourself in one of their outside tables (frequently in the sun) or  grab a sandwich to go and head to Dolores Park. 

While I still consider their sandwiches cheap ($4.95) I guess for a vietnamese sandwich it is on the pricey side.
author: Paul M.

description:
This place has a tiny tiny menu - like 5 sandwiches. It's also only got 1 vegetarian (vegan) sandwich. But it was a perfect sandwich: just the right size, tasty as get-out, and very very affordable. I am very glad I stumbled upon this little place and go back regularly. If you get there early enough they often have fresh spring rolls and sometimes buns too.

There are various Asian candies and drinks like jelly grass, coconut, and sugar cane. I haven't tried them but it's quite a selection.
author: Nik G.

description:
I LOVE vietnamese sandwiches... and these were pretty good. 
I got the Special, and it was pretty good. Love the pickled veggies, ate loaf, pork, cilantro and the jalepenos. However, for the price ($4.75), it's just more than a Banh Mi should be. Also tried the chicken, which was also pretty good. 
A plus though is that the guys who run the place are super nice, and it's closer (in the castro) than going down to the Tenderloin (saigon sandwich) so the price might be worth it. 
So pretty good sandwiches, just a little pricier than Banh Mi should be. Definitely worth a try!
author: annie p.

description:
Seriously one of the best Vietnamese sandwiches I've ever had.  A little heavy on the mayo but the bread is amazing.  I had the pork sandwich and it definitely delivered. 

I'm giving them five stars because of the price ($5!) and how quickly they made my sandwich.  Seriously saved my life as I was broke, starving, and in a hurry!  Definitely try out Dinosaurs if you're hungry and in the Castro.
author: Heidi B.

description:
Just happened into this place last week and have been back twice since. Awesome Vietnamese sandwiches at great prices, less than $5! Skip the pork bun, they don't make them there, they are just okay, but the sandwiches are off the charts. Word of warning, unless you are into fire-y hot spicy, order the sandwich without jalapenos. 

The guys who run this place are really cool, I hope their business does well!
author: Philip M.

description: Place is great and love the sandwiches, but prices are a bit high and if there's a line, it can take around 20 minutes to get a sandwich.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: Had the Shrimp spring roll, Pork Banh Mi, and Papaya Salad. The Pork Banh Mi was very good and what you would expect. The Papaya salad was heavy on the papaya, which is good since a lot of places cheap out and use other fillers.
author: Brian C.

description: I love the simplicity of this place.  It's a great, cheap and yummy place to grab a sandwich before heading into (or after) Fitness SF (formerly Gold's Gym).  I am a big fan of Vietnamese Sandwiches and Bun - the sandwiches at this place are on par and the price is right.
author: Nathan V.

description: 1st Avocado smoothie ever and it was amazing!! these guys set the bar high!
author: Stephanie W.

description: As a vegetarian, I tried the fried tofu sandwich. I felt unfulfilled since the tofu shreds were tiny fried pieces with little substance. I communicated this to the cashier, and he heard me and said he would communicate this to the restaurant superior. I appreciated his willingness to incorporate my feedback. Nevertheless, I feel content knowing that a vegetarian option exists here.
author: Matthew F.

description:
YUM! There are a few good places to go when you are in the mood for some Vietnamese Sandwiches....one is Saigon Sandwhich...and now DINOSAURS! 

Usually when you order a  banh mi sandwich, you get a soft flaky roll, BUT at Dinosaurs you get a REALLY REALLY GOOD Crispy and Crunchy Baguette. It is something different but in ALL THE GOOD WAYS!

Not the cheapest Banh Mi but still pretty inexpensive about $4 for a sandwich. Next time I am going to order 2!

ENJOY!
author: Nick C.

description: Wow a surprisingly good banh mi place. Its tucked away under some buildings and the place is pretty small. I ordered the specialty sandwich which had various meats in it but i mainly got it cause it has the pate in it. It was pretty good and for the 5 dollar price tag Id say it wasnt too bad for a decent meal. Its a cute local find so Id say definitely try it even though I wouldn't consider it authentic or the best banh mi place ive been to. I wonder why they call it dinosaur though...
author: Andre W.

description: Great roasted chicken sandwich and love the tofu spring rolls
author: Chad H.

description: Dinosaurs is such a cool little sandwich shop located in the Castro. It's VERY easy to miss and you probably wouldn't just stumble upon it. A friend of mine had suggested I stop in to try one of their sandwiches and I'm glad I did. The meal was fantastic! I ordered the spicy tuna sandwich and was pleased. The portion was average and the price was perfect! I could have ordered a second sandwich, not because I was hungry, but because my budget would have allowed it. The seating area is quite small inside but there are tables on the outside. I can't wait to come back to try another sandwich!
author: Tommy C.

description: one of my favorite banh mi go to spots in SF. Grew up in the LA/OC area, all the sandwiches are pretty classic and reminded me of home. Especially love the location, don't have to go to the Tenderloin for Saigon Sandwiches (although if I'm in the neighborhood, I'll still stop by)
author: Richie P.

description:
Chomp chomp!

I ordered the pork sandwich and it was delicioussss!  The bread was a perfect crunchiness, the pork  tender, warm, and well marinated, and it was filled to the brim with toppings a vietnamese sandwich usually comes with - pickled vegetables, cilantro, peppers - but fresher.

My only complaint about the sandwich is it had a tad too much mayo mixed in, which i'm sure I could have solved if I had applied Burger King "have it your way" techniques to my ordering.

They also have a bunch of cold asian drinks to wash down the sandwich such as coconut milk, soy milk, green tea and asian snacks like shrimp chips to complete the mix.

Oh and lastly, if you download the Scout Mob app on your iphone, you can get a free 50% coupon.  My whole meal cost $3.  It probably expires soon so try it out!
author: Andrea L.

description: This place only has five things on their menu and I can only eat two of them, but I never get tired of eating here. These are perfect Vietnamese sandwiches in a fun atmosphere where the staff is friendly and obviously short on storage space because the store is full of boxes. Dinosaur has some of the best sandwiches in SF, and all for under $5! You can't go wrong.
author: Joaquin E.

description:
Yummy in my tummy.  Ok, it's not Saigon sandwich, but then again, it's not dirty and not in the TL.  That immediately earns it an extra star.  Say what you will, and yes, there is delicious food in the TL, but every time I go, someone unsavory butts into my life.  Last time, it was a woman who claimed to have just been released from the hospital after being treated for MRSA.  Not cool.

Dinosaurs is brand spanking new, so new they only just got an ice machine.  But their sandwiches are good: the bread crunchy, the pork tasty and salty, and the vegetables not soggy.  The jalapenos lacked heat, but that's not their fault, that's the pepper's fault.  And I love the random Asian snacks they offer there, like Yam Yams and Squid jerky.  I think it's funny how people complain it's expensive...um, it's $4.75 for a sandwich.  Yeah, welcome to SF.  $4.75 for a sandwich is amazing.  Seriously, how many crappy $9 sandwiches do you need to eat to realize that this place is an amazing deal and amazing food for that deal.

I'm sold.  Definitely coming back for more.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
If you are a sandwich lover like me especially Vietnamese sandwich you will fall hard for dinosaur. This restaurant is able to add a twist on the traditional Vietnamese sandwich like no one else has. The staff is great and once you try it once you will be wanting more. 

A must try is the spicy tuna sandwich.
author: Kevin L.

description: Meatball bahn mi,  And always order two because one just is never enough! Tried the watermellon lychee drink last week and was so refreshing on that hot day! Unlike Saigon Sandwiches, the line is always reasonable (if there's one at all), they are open relatively late (10pm), and it's three blocks from my new place!  Perfection!
author: Alex A.

description: Inexpensive and good tofu vietnamese sandwiches. Didn't fill me up all the way, but definitely a great place for a substantial snack!
author: Isaac R.

description: I had the crispy tofu - nice light crunchy bread (essential to an excellent bahn mi IMO) and pickled vegetables.  Unfortunately the vegannaise combined with something like a thick soy sauce was too salty.  And, it would be awesome if they had a vegetarian option with actual tofu instead of shoe-string fried tofu bits.  I'm rating a little generously because I suspect the meat ones are better.
author: Negien M.

description: This is the place we go to when we want a tasty but inexpensive meal.  It's just a few short blocks from the bf's place, and we can generally count on it being a solid lunch option.  Granted it's a bit pricier than traditional bahn mi's, but it's also fancier than a typical bahn mi.  The roasted meats however are not quite as flavorful as Saigon Sandwiches, which is still my all-time favorite, but it is a really great stand-in and I can't complain that it's much more accessible and cleaner!
author: Janet L.

description: Cheap and delicious. Plus there's a gym, so I get to cruise all the hotties who walk by.
author: Lana P.

description: In a city full of great sandwiches, Dinosaurs stands out. It may not be the most authentic banh mi, but it is certainly affordable and quite good. Also great for my vegetarian friends (you end up with a lot more of those in San Francisco).
author: Justin R.

description: I love the crispy tofu sandwich! Though this place is a little pricier than some of the city's other Vietnamese sandwich places, it is in walking distance from my house and they have a vegan sandwich on their regular menu. Though I truly miss LA and the ability to get a vegan sandwich (w/fake ham!) for $2.75, I will happily return to Dinosaurs for the yumminess that is their crispy tofu sandwich! I hope one day soon they will include more veg and vegan options on their menu...
author: Valerie L.

description: Last Sunday I heard about dinosaur from seeing someone's foursquare. What, there are vietnamese sandwiches in castro? Hmm I decided to check it out! I got there near closing (which is 7pm) and it was pretty empty. I got the  banh mi special pork sandwich, which is only less than $6, so super cheap. The interior is very pizza/sandwich shop, I got mine to go. The sandwich was delicious! I loved it. Such yummy flavors, well made.. The only thing is, it's small. One sandwich is not a full meal, so get it for just a snack. Next time, I will get two. The girl at the counter was nice, and she also gave me a stamp card, so if I buy enough sandwiches, I'll get one free. Great! I will be back.. Ps I also love the name!!
author: Merredith L.

description: Recently had the combo and the lemongrass pork sandwiches. Yummy! Definitely digging them banh mis. They do a great Thai Iced Tea as well. However they put a whole bunch of ice in it, so I wish I got more drank than ice. It's okay. Got the shrimp and pork spring rolls as well. Heartier than other spring rolls that I've had. I would come back! Nice location too--easy to get to. :]
author: Mariel A.

description:
We've been here 6 times in 6 weeks, and really like the sandwiches. Each time the quality was excellent, garnish was perfect, the bread was fresh and warm (and NOT soggy, a huge plus). We tried the chicken, pork and meatballs. Twice a young woman made them, and 2 different men made the rest. Very consistent!  Super friendly youthful staff, a couple small tables, and a promising future. Oh, and did I mention clean? This place is so much cleaner than the others. I hope they can keep it that way as time goes by. This shop saves me a trip to Larkin Street. 
Larry
author: laurence c.

description: This place rocks.   Solid bahn mi offerings that rival most establishments at this price point.  Outdoor seating avail for those nice sunny days.  The special honeydew smoothie was to die for.
author: Ian F.

description:
Dinosaurs and Vietnamese sandwiches? Had to do a double take on this one, and once it registered that this was in fact dinosaurs and Vietnamese sandwiches, we HAD to stop and check it out.

Cute dino pictures on the wall. And the sandwiches that we had were not bad either. I we got the tuna one and the pork loaf one. I can't really recall, but we weren't displeased that's for sure. I've had some pretty bad banh mi in my days and I'm happy to say this place didn't give me one of them.

However, more dinosaurs please!
author: Jennifer N.

description: This is the best meal for under $5 in SF.  The tofu sandwich is delicious - perfectly spiced tofu with pretty much the best bread I've ever had.  Keep up the good work, dinos.
author: Robby W.

description:
When you get tired of waiting for an hour in a long line to get a greasy sandwich from Ike's, try Dinosaurs just a few feet away.  REAL Vietnamese sandwiches.  Super CHEAP!  

The owner told me that they might be getting whole grain bread as an option soon - not really an authentic thing to do but I wanna be healthy . I like authentic food that skews healthier.  Ask for it.
author: Shane F.

description: Everyone loves the Vietnamese sandwiches - they are great but, I really like the spring rolls - love the freshness of the mint and noodles....but, the other day I ordered the avacado shake - it was so delicious....I just want everyone to know---it was sooo good...will return for many more
author: Marianne C.

description: I think I've tried most banh mie sandwiches in the city (from clement st. to the tenderloin to San Bruno ave. to the mission and I can say that the Dinosaur Cafe has one of the best in the city. I recommend the grilled pork, my favorite.  The price is right for being in the Castro and they have a few outside tables for those beautiful sunny days.
author: Monkey B.

description: I love the spicy tuna sandwich here, and now they use Fivestars so you can get rewards for being a frequent customer (which I already am)!
author: Hannah P.

description: $6 bucks for a filling delicious sandwich? Heck yes!  I've had the spicy tuna and the special and both are great although I recommend the special.  The sandwiches are simple, pickled vegetables jalepenos and meat on bread but they are delicious.  Super cheap and quick food.  If you're hungry and in the area check it out.  If you're chilling at DP and want a sandwich, skip Ike's and come here!
author: Jack M.

description:
Dinosaurs is a bánh mì shop located next door to where Ike's Place used to pack 'em in on 16th (between Sanchez and Market), placing it within walking distance of the Mission and smack dab in the energy vortex that is the Castro.  The shop itself is on the small side, occupying a retrofitted basement like space, sparsely decorated with three or four tables, a "Jurassic Park" pinball machine, and a fridge stocked with the usual variety of cold, non-alcoholic beverages that you'd expect to find at most Vietnamese sandwich shops. The employees look to be in their twenties, and I've read recently that the owners are as well, so they could be one in the same.  Whatever the case, I've found them to be welcoming and friendly, creating a comfortable vibe in a space that is probably best suited for takeout orders, although I've always been lucky enough to find an open table awaiting me.  The menu is straight forward, consisting of about five or six styles of bánh mì, and if my memory serves me right, one of those options is usually vegetarian.

On my most recent trip to Dinosaurs I had the special pork bánh mì, which was  pork pâté, slices of roast pork, and pork loaf (ch la: lean pork, potato starch, and fish sauce).  There was also a generous portion of the standard bánh mì vegetables, namely thinly sliced (julienned) carrots, cilantro,  daikon, and jalapeño. The bread was warm and crunchy on the outside, while remaining soft inside, and it didn't distract from the balance of flavor.

Dinosaurs is an affordable, friendly, conveniently located spot to enjoy some freshly prepared bánh mì when you're in San Francisco, and especially if you are near the Mission, in the Castro, or heading in the general vicinity of the lower Haight or Western Division.  If you are in San Jose,then I wouldn't recommend that you jump in your car and immediately head over to Dinosaurs so you can find out what bánh mì is all about because the opposite is still true, but if you happen to be out in the city, then by all means give Dinosaurs a try.
author: Jay U.

description:
I admit, I came here mostly because of the name. But a Vietnamese sandwich placed named Dinosaurs is pretty awesome. They really do have dinosaur pictures everywhere, which is even more awesome.

Only if their sandwiches were better, than this place would be the awesome-est. Their sandwiches are not bad by any standards but not as delicious and mouth watering as some other places in the city. Dinosaurs is lucky they are in the Castro because there is no competition when it comes to banh mi. At around $4.50 a sandwich, they are cheap considering other options in that area but they sandwiches are about $1 - $1.50 more expensive than the places in TL or Chinatown. But if you are in the area, Dinosaurs may be the best option.

I ordered the crispy tofu sandwich, the only I can eat. I didn't think the tofu would be in super thin strips, but it was, mixed with fried noodle like strips. I don't like the fried noodles things all that much, I wish it had more tofu and in bigger strips, I think that would have helped. It was hard to tell it was even tofu. But aside from that, the rest of the sandwich was good, with a good amount of pickled veggies.

They have a buy 9 get 1 free card!
author: Angela T.

description: Went there again. Wanted to see if any differences. Got the shaking beef.Very good. Ill eat at VY coffee and Dinosaurs. Great two places in Pacifica!
author: Cassedee L.

description: i love their servuce and are super friendly. Good sandwiches and drinks!
author: Captain Muffin D.

description: I like this place. it's more expensive than saigon sandwiches and not quite as good, but it's one of the best choices in the 'hood. i actually like it better than the revered Ike's down the street. their combo banh mi plus an order of spring rolls to split = perfect lunch.
author: Erica W.

description: ok...so clearly from all my check-ins here, I have grown to love Dinosaurs. :-)  It's my safe bet for a full, consistently good meal under $10.  The guys are really nice, it's a convenient location, and it's across from the library!
author: Ben T.

description: Took the kids here  to have lunch and loved it.  Just the right  amount of vegies vs. meat, could have been hotter though.  Would loved to have some sambal to go with it but still liked the flavor.  Had the pork , kids had the chicken and the cost was great.  If your looking for a cheap meal in a pinch go check them out.  Siagon sandwich has got nothing on them.
author: Shirley W.

description: Love this place! Great sandwiches! Always makes me happy!
author: Scott H.

description: Came here a while back and had their spicy tuna banh mi which was pretty good . Very unique and creative . So far , I haven't seen any other places in the bay area that offer spicy tuna banh mi .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Finally, the Castro is starting to get good food.

I had the vegetarian/vegan sandwich with crispy tofu strips. The pickled veggies were good. The bread was GREAT.
author: Villager E.

description:
I've been going to Dinosaurs for the past year and a half.  It's fresh, consistently good, and the service is friendly.  The sandwiches are well balanced, e.g. the bread is crispy and not too fluffy or dense, and there is a good mix of carrots, daikon, and cilantro.  I've been to about a dozen Banh Mi places in SF and this place is my #1 favorite for fresh-tasting sandwiches, and second only to Saigon Sandwich in the Tenderloin overall.

My favorite thing to order is the BBQ Pork banh mi -- ask for pate.  IMO, this makes the sandwich and should be required.  They also started serving a shaking beef banh mi, which might not be "authentic", but it's awesome.

The spring rolls are also pretty good if you are looking for something light.  I don't eat shrimp, but the veg ones with tofu and taro are pretty tasty.  Spring rolls can get a little tough if sitting around for a while (they aren't typically made-to-order at Dinosaurs), so I could see how they might be hit-or-miss.  My fiancé, who doesn't eat meat, likes ordering the Spicy Tuna and shrimp spring rolls.

The one thing I've found annoying is that recently when you get a sandwich to-go they just wrap it in paper once, rather than wrapping it in paper, slicing it in half, and then wrapping it again, as to prevent you from making a hot-and-cold mess all over the place while eating the sandwich.
author: Eytan B.

description: Yummy spicy tuna sandwich for only $5,25. Great service!! These guys are so nice! Good atmosphere!!
author: Alex R.

description: Delicious bahn mi sandwiches! Love the tofu option!
author: Rocio P.

description:
4 Stars??  Really???

This is the first time i have a vietnamese sandwich in SF and i have to say, it was all right, but not great.  I have had superb vietnamese sandwiches in Milpitas, Emeryville and even Concord.

Dinosaurs' sandwiches were okay.  
The bread was crunchy but it felt as if it  was yesterday's leftover and re-heated.  I had the crispy tofu and it tasted like old, hardened and dried up hash brown.  My friend had the special pork sandwich and there was barely any pork inside.

The service was good.  The place is small.  I didn't expect much, it's fine.

But i did expect a delicious vietnamese sandwich and instead i got an okay vietnamese sandwich.  

I will not be going back there.  I'm sure there are way better vietnamese sandwich joints in SF.
author: Rita F.

description:
I absolutely love Vietnamese sandwiches - all elements meld together so splendidly: cucumber, carrot, jalapenos, daikon, tofu [in my case], yummy vinaigrette ... yumm-o!

my neighborhood Viet sammy shop closed a few months ago, and it has been that long since I had one. until now!!

Dinosaurs does it well! my sandwich had the above yummy elements + taro [wonderful touch for richness and crunch] + crunchy rice noodles. just the right amount of food at just the right price!

$4.75 a pop? yes please ...
author: Rachel W.

description:
YUM!
I love Vietnamese sandwiches because of the tender roasted meat, pickled veggies and crispy bread. This new spot is my new favorite for sandwiches in the neighborhood. So far I've been there about 5 times and have tried the Special (twice), the Chicken, the Pork and the Tofu. Every thing is consistently good. Way better than waiting in line at Ike's which is just a couple doors down, plus, Ike's sandwiches are overrated, over sauced and dirty inside. Trust me, for a better sandwich head over to Dinosaurs for a fresh treat!
author: Foodie F.

description: Stumbled across this place by accident, and my husband and I were pleasantly surprised at how good their Vietnamese sandwiches are and for a great price!  Will definitely be coming back for more.
author: Julie P.

description:
ive never had a better sandwich in my entire life.... so fresh and yet so satisfying! the minimal menu makes it easy to order and faster to eat, the salad and spring rolls are the best! if your ever in the area of Castro or upper Market please stop by and enjoy a Dinosaur Sandwich! 

mmmm mmmm good!
author: baretta v.

description: Stopped by for a quick dinner after walking by a few days earlier. Delicious! I had the grilled pork sandwich. Very reasonably priced, the ingredients were fresh, and the portion generous. The staff were friendly and answered my and other's questions in a courteous fashion.
author: Trina L.

description: Special Pork Sandwich: Fresh ingredients. Pickled veggies weren't as pickled but still good. Bread wasn't as crunchy becuz the sandwich wasn't eaten right away. But overall good.
author: L T.

description: Great place. No BS, right price, simple yet fulfilling.
author: Tim B.

description: Absolutely LOVE their bahn mi sandwiches. You can't go wrong with any one of them!
author: Ganesha B.

description: I was pretty excited about their crispy tofu vegan bahn mi I saw talked up on some vegan blogs but was mildly disappointed. I wasn't a fan of the bread, it wasn't the crispy but soft get crumbs everywhere french bread that I am used to. The shredded tofu also wasn't very seasoned and I felt the taro really took away from the flavor. While the veggies were good I think it needed more. I also didn't notice any rice noodles in my sandwich. The staff were super friendly and it's probably a good bahn mi for the area.  While not vegan, the perfect tofu bahn mi can be found at Little Vietnam Cafe in the Inner Richmond.
author: Cori W.

description: The crispy tofu is pretty darn good. We also had the spicy tuna which was good, but not at the same level.
author: Benjamin T.

description: There are definitely better banh mi places in the City, but for the Castro, it's as good as it gets. I think there might have been an ownership change, because the sandwiches now are much better than they were a few months back (like 2011). I've been twice in the past month now, and I'm pretty sure there has been a change in the recipe. In the past, the sandwiches were thin on meat, didn't have enough pickled veggies and jalapenos. Now, the Special actually tastes ethnic, albeit a bit more expensive than what you'd pay in Inner Richmond. Still,  it's fantastic for the Castro. I consider it the "Chipotle" of banh mi- it's tasty, clean, and more expensive. It's also a great option when you've got a hankering for ethnic food. I love having the option of a tasty banh mi in the neighborhood!
author: Cindy S.

description: Pretty good!  A bahn mi is a bhan mi is a bahn mi.  The Pork was great, but the meatballs were a little anemic.
author: California B.

description:
Yum yum yum yum yum. Went there over lunch today. Sammy was gone by the time I got back up to Market. GONE!

It's a cheery little place and I hope they will do well even though that other sandwich shop which shall not be named closed. I'll be coming once a week for my "The Pork" fix. Spicy and Sweet and Salty and Crispy and Tasty. Makes me want to go back and get another.

Eat Dinosaurs!!
author: Abby P.

description: Well worth the 4 stars. Delicious, inexpensive Vietnamese sandwiches. Small simple menu with a vegan option. Indoor seating can be challenging when they're busy.
author: Timothy D.

description: LOVE this place. dont know how i never knew abt it, living in the hood for 4 years. its REALLY GOOD. light sandwiches with perfectly cooked bread- have tried pork chicken and spicy tuna, all were good, i think the chicken was the best, followed by spicy tuna. even the apps are tasty. the food is pretty cheap and the food comes quickly (for take out or not) and i will certainly be coming back here often. its a gem
author: Emmie B.

description:
Got a deal from Scout Mob for 50% off the sandwiches. Was totally shocked to walk in and see that the most expensive sandwich was under $5! This has got to be one of the best deals in town!!! 
Had the tofu sandwich, which was totally delicious, laced with crispy noodles, lightly seasoned shredded carrot, fresh crunchy cucumber, served on a toasted baguette. Absolutely yummy. Sweet service by two lovely, hard working guys.
author: Carla B.

description: I decided to take a day trip and make my first stop for lunch here. I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was delicious! It was a perfect lunch. Everything from the service and the food was wonderful. I will definitely be dropping by the next time I'm in the city.
author: David H.

description: Seriously this place is so good! Crispy tofu sandwich yum! I've keep turning to dinosaurs for my lunch break. It's cheaper & more convenient than making my own lunch. Love this little spot!
author: Heather K.

description:
Great bread + good tasting meat + nice prices = YAMMY!

====

I've been here twice and both times the sandwiches were very tasty. I keep missing out on the steamed buns, but hopefully will get there early enough one day to partake in their savory goodness as well. I wish that they offered Vietnamese coffee...and Vietnamese iced coffee with boba would be even better! 

I like that they have seating inside with huge windows so I can tie my dog up outside and still keep an eye on him. The people are really nice, and the lines are short (for now). Also, as I mentioned above, the prices are very reasonable ($4.50 for a sandwich) and the loyalty card is a plus.

Definitely going back...maybe this afternoon...mmmm....
author: Audrey L.

description: I wanted to like this place so badly. They even have a jurassic park pinball machine. Took about 15 minutes to make a to go sandwich. The chicken tasted like the chicken you get at subway. This suspicion was reinforced when i saw them microwave a big vat of it already diced up. I definitely don't think they're making it in house. And if they are, it doesn't taste good. The pickled veggies don't carry enough flavor either. Place has awesome potential. Sad.
author: M K.

description: What a gem! Delicious banh mi sandwiches. Get the pork. Yum!!
author: S Y.

description: So i went here, ordered the spicy tuna... This cute lil azn dork made my sandwich. The bread was good, a lil better than lee' s bread, not soggy and soft, its juz crisp perfectly. Took a bite and it was bomb!!! At first i thought it tasted like bumblebee tuna but man! It tasted way better than any canned tuna out there. The carrots and daikon tasted fresh, didnt taste like a day old vegetable... The tuna was well seasoned juz about the right salt and pepper. I loved it!!! I will come back here for sure! I always wondered what that nerdy lookin guy's name is... Hes really nice...hes so shy maybe hes a virgin hahaha but honestly i love this place...
author: Mara G.

description:
what they have is a straightforward menu and simple, no fuss vietnamese sandwiches. not too complicated and cheap, really. although, something special that they do with their sandwich.. they have their own blend of sauce on their sandwiches. 

eventhough i still prefer those vietnamese sandwiches in San Jose, this is unheard of in the neighborhood. not really hard to find this place, but it took me a little while to know that this exist. oh wells.
author: Marc K.

description:
The menu is a bit limited, but if you are in the mood for a tasty bahn mi, this is a good option. Nay, at less that $5 for a sandwich, this is a great option.

I do have to counter a previous reviewer who stated "this is the only Vietnamese sandwich place in the Castro" (or something similar). Not true - Castro Tarts on Castro between 19th and 20th have been doing bahn mi for at least 10 years. Personally, I like the bread better at Dinosaurs, but either provides a decent bahn mi at under $5 - which for the Castro is a good find.

Update: Just returned from a new trip to Dinosaur. They've added steamed buns and Vietnamese spring rolls. Very nice.

Update 2: Nice customer service. They mistakenly put jalapenos on a "no jalapeno" sandwich, but more than made up for it by offering free sandwich on next visit.
author: Scott B.

description: Pretty good sandwiches, not comparable to Saigon Sandwiches though! The wait for the food to come out was horrendous.
author: Le T.

description: Hands down the best bahn mi ever.  Had the chicken and it's yummy and cheap!  I'll try the crispy tofu next time...
author: Joe O.

description:
I had never had banh mi before today, but I'm very glad I did! I was walking from Mission to Market (to visit the ever-lovely Creme Brulee Truck) and about half way decided I should grab some food before indulging. I walked by Ike's, looking quite sadly at the long line, and then noticed this place where Ike's used to be. I decided to give it a shot, and for about $6, this was a great choice. I got the chicken with lemongrass sandwich, and it was just delicious. The bread was crusty, the chicken was warm and tasty, and the vegetables were crisp and light. The location was pretty cute, and they were super fast and friendly, asking how everything was when I returned my basket. Plus the seating on the street is awesome! Caught a bit of late afternoon sun while enjoying my meal!

To highlight: Delicious, well worth the price, friendly, fast, and I will definitely be back!
author: Aimée S.

description: Been to this place a ton of times over the past year, can't believe how good it is, how big the portions are, how cheap it is. Love the strawberry lichi too. Please open another location in SOMA. Nothing new to say, see other reviews :)
author: John K.

description: Vietnamese sandwich in Castro for less than $5! Please check in using YELP/Facebook you get 10% off. Sandwiches are yummy! my favorite is the Chicken! They also serve tofu for the Veggie lovers also try the strong ice coffee. It's pretty cool that they have an outside seating, perfect of sunny days.
author: Aemar E.

description:
We had the Pork and the Crispy Tofu.  Both need a lot more savory seasoning.  The pork was not roasted, more like boiled or stewed, but still fatty.  Ick.  The tofu was a shredded mixture of fried noodles and shredded tofu or something.  Better than the pork, but not great.  Everything else on the sandwich was good.  Service was friendly, but slow.  Almost glacial.  

A better bet for banh mi in the Castro is Castro Tarts http://www.yelp.com/biz/castro-tarts-san-francisco -- very saucy, flavorful meats and more choices.  Plus pho.  And baked goods.  And ice cream.  And breakfast.  And super fast, super nice staff.

Good luck Dinosaur's.
author: S S.

description: I love this place. You can get an affordable, decent Vietnamese sandwich, with great customer service. I always get a bite to eat here when I'm in the Castro.
author: Banksy R.

description: Mmmmm I really loved their tofu vietnamese sandwich.
author: Grace M.

description: This review might be a little picky since I'm Vietnamese myself. I give this place 3 stars only because the service wasn't that great. It's an Americanized establishment that sells  viet sandwiches. They don't take too long to make, but I waited nearly 15-20 minutes and the place wasn't even crowded when I went. Another thing is that the bread is WAY too hard. However, the place itself is a little trendy spot in SF if you want to grab something cheap and chill out at Mission Delores park. The sandwich itself is extremely packed with flavor, more than what I'm usually used to, it's really good. They also put a lot of black pepper on the #1 special and it adds a little spice to the sandwich. Overall is a chill spot on the corner and I would come back
author: Shelly N.

description:
taste wise, its definitely 4 stars. but price wise... im thinking more like 3 because for $5.50, i can get TWO sandwiches from saigon sandwich but i guess its understandable for its location in the castro.

tried the special - roasted pork, fancy pork loaf, and pate. the pate tastes a bit different from the others ive had, not in a bad way, just different but cant quite put my finger on it. everything tastes really fresh and i love how they put a lot of veggies in the sandwich.

even though i consider it to be pretty pricey for a vietnamese sandwich, its still a good sandwich nonetheless and would recommend people to check this place out.
author: Katherine C.

description:
- food: tasty, fresh sandwiches with lots of flavor
- atmosphere:  basic sandwich shop space
- staff:  friendly
- price: great deal

additional info:
- there's some outdoor seating
author: J. B.

description: Had the special sandwich and a spring roll... I couldn't help but think how someone used to the Little Saigon prices might think they're overpriced at $5. Well, they're definitely worth it here.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
A fun place to have lunch.

Great quality at great prices.  

The staff is friendly every time I have gone.  Food quality is consistent and fast.

Highly recommend it.
author: Glenn S.

description: Still awesome.  But sadly, no more pinball.  I guess you gotta focus on what you do best.
author: Patrick C.

description: For a cheap and deerishus treat, Dinosaurs is a megawin. Destroy a crispy tofu sandwich, you won't regret it! NOM NOM NOM.
author: Amber K.

description: They make the kind of sandwich that you cant stop thinking about and you dont want to go anywhere else to get. The tofu bahn mi is off the chain! And the staff and owners rock!
author: M K.

description: Decent little whole in the wall. Pretty good sandwiches. Price is spot on.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Awesome Sandwiches for a Awesome Price. Fresh Ingredients and Great Customer Service. I'm glad they opened up a Dinosaurs at ocean right next to SFSU. Gonna stop by when i can :]
author: Andrew C.

description: A good cheap tofu sandwich.  Great crispy tofu rolls -- really, take a moment and try these.  The menu selection is tiny, but if you know you just want a quick vietnamese sandwich, this the place for you.
author: Douglas P.

description: Small place with great sandwiches (try the crispy tofu) and really nice service.
author: Julie K.

description: Great Vietnamese sandwiches. Nice warm bread and fresh ingredients. One of the best in the city.
author: Revant K.

description: Yummmm dinosaurs is my favorite vietnamese sandwhich joint in SF! The staff is friendly, the service is quick, and the menu is simple, delicious, and healthy.  The bread is so crunchy, the meat well spiced, the carrots and daikon pickled perfectly.  I have to say the roasted pork is my favorite sandwhich, with the crispy tofu coming in at a close second.  Sandwhiches are 5$ after tax and fill you up as long as your not in an all-you-can eat mood.  Compared to other bahn mi in SF, Dinosaurs is the most consistently cheap, delicious, and fresh. Hands down.
author: Max K.

description: I've been going here since it opened. It's a great sandwich--gentrified vietnamese! I like their crispy tofu sandwich!.
author: Ryan N.

description: I would like to start this review by stating I dont like sandwiches. I never have and I dont expect this to change any time soon. I however have found an exception to the rule. Dinosaurs' veggie yummy somethingerother is super good. It has so much flavour and taste to it! I think of having to go work in that neighborhood every other month and I start salivating for that sandwich. I dont know what you do but job well done.
author: Cy W.

description: Love it, got some bahn mi sandwichs and hiked up randall hill for a yummy view and a tasty meal. A jalepeno really got me for a minute, but it's supposed to!! Yummy.
author: Hillary L.

description: Nothing special. Castro Tarts (on Castro Street) has more variety of and better Vietnamese sandwiches.
author: Paul L.

description: Delicious and quick sandwiches made with the freshest ingredients for $5.  To get here from Market St, head into the same building as Books Inc and walk down the stairs.
author: Naomi F.

description: Excellent food, no line.  Friendly service.  Would come here every time over that ridiculous *ke's on the corner.
author: Tom H.

description: If Ike's is too much for you...this is the next best thing! I  ordered to-go and it was my first time the other day. I had always wanted to come here and I'm glad I did. The place is small but the sandwiches are nice and big. At least for me it was. I ordered the pork sandwich (because the guy who helped said it was the most popular). Now, I know why! It was hell-to-the-yes good!!! It has everything you could want in a sandwich. Great textures and flavors. The pork is nice and flavorful. They don't skimp on the veggies which is great. I like that it had a slice of jalapeno in there. A sweet and sour flavor. Subtly is good. The bread is just yum. I could eat this sandwich again and again. Just thinking of it now, makes my mouth water. Can't wait to go back and try out the other sandwiches.
author: Mel P.

description:
Yummy and affordable sandwiches. Fantastic customer service. They messed up my order, but when I called back, they were super nice and even gave me a free sandwich. 

They really care about their customers.
author: Andy A.

description: Awesome sandwiches on crispy dutch crunch. And dimples. YUM
author: David W.

description: Super tasty sandwiches at a great price, the staff was friendly,  A relief from those $10 sandwiches elsewhere in the Castro!!
author: James P.

description: A few months after returning from a trip to Vietnam, I stumbled across dinosaurs. This place is the real deal. Amazing sandwich spot for lunch. The pickled carrots an radishes give the Special roasted pork sandwich a tangy crunch. Perfect bun.  At $4.75, It even comes at the super low price that is more likely to be found in Vietnam than SF. Check it out.
author: Adam C.

description: The tofu sandwich is great and you can sit outside in the sun an enjoy the afternoon unrushed.
author: Ron N.

description: Fast, inexpensive, and delicious sandwiches.
author: Kristen C.

description: I've never been here but the other day my friend bought me a Pork sandwich it was so good. The carrots and radish are just right. The bread is crunchy and fresh. Few days after I made a trip down there for the first time. Looks like a simple regular store with boxes stacked everywhere and basic decorations. Overall the sandwiches are worth the trip down especially The Special sandwich with various pork slices.
author: Sam L.

description: Yummy!!  This is our go-to spot for cheap eats in the Castro.
author: Chris W.

description: 4+ Stars - had the spicy tuna sandwich here after a listing appointment on Friday.  Loved it.  It was light and flavorful and cheap.  Guys working their were very nice and cute, too.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I finally remembered to check out Dinosaurs when I was in the area. I had the spicy tuna sandwich. Not only was it real good but it was just enough food. I dislike it when places serve gigantic sandwiches for whatever reason because it's always way too much food to finish in one seating. And because they make the sandwich is so big, they have to charge accordingly. At Dinosaurs, the average cost is five bucks.

I'll go back again and try their spring rolls next. And maybe a different sandwich.
author: Ian F.

description:
After a friends recommendation and a solid 4 star rating on yelp I finally decided to try this wonderful little sandwich shop. Simple and to the point, if you want a good Vietnamese sandwich, this is the place to go. 
Everything tastes fresh and that includes the bread. Fast service can get you in and out within a few minutes. Great alternative to the more popular sandwich options on market
author: R J.

description: Excellent tasty food.  I got the vegetarian tofu and vietnamese coffee.  Love that strong coffee.  It's a casual place for a quick bite.  Staff is super friendly.  A place where the locals go for sandwiches that s not of the generic subway.
author: H C.

description: I've been meaning to try this place for awhile since I love vietnamese sandwiches but am never near a place when I get a craving.  I convinced my group of friends to go here on a Sunday and 4/5 agreed that this place was great.  Its clean, not very fast but their sandwiches are made with love! I can't wait to come back and try the crispy tofu.  The special was definitely worth the wait.
author: Sarah C.

description:
the chicken banh mi!!! get it!

the chicken is so fricken good, the bread is perfectly soft on the inside but crunchy on the outside, and whatever amazing sauce they put on it is to die for.

get the sandwich, thank me later.
author: Marge S.

description: Don't be expecting Saigon or anything. The crispy tofu sandwich was totally whatever and the portion was so small for $5.
author: sunny c.

description: Five bucks or less for a Vietnamese sando? Yes and yes. I always get the tofu- which is shredded and crisped to perfection. Just writing this makes me want one right now. Yum.
author: Lara M.

description: I wasn't expecting much when I walked through the door, but I was gladly proven wrong. Being of Vietnamese descent, I grew up eating banh mi. The service was great, the food was great, and I enjoyed my visit! So did all my friends.
author: Sheri N.

description: So, who cares these aren't $3 sandwiches. its still under $5, and they're frickin delicious.  My girlfriend is getting jealous of  how I talk about these sandwiches ...
author: Daniel W.

description: Had catered lunch here delivered by a third-party and was so excited to find out the name of the restaurant that provided us with delicious chicken, meatball, crispy tofu and spicy tuna vietnamese sandwiches. I will definitely be swinging by here during my stay in SF!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Good crispy tofu bahn mi sandwich!
author: Kathy and Mark D.

description: I'm just starting to explore bahn mi in SF after being introduced to them by a rabid east coast fan. I had a special which has roasted pork and pate. The bread was tasty - anyone know if it's made with rice flour - nice and crispy on the outside, soft on inside. I thought the overall flavor was pretty bland with none of the heat and sweet combo I've had at other places. Seems like the veggies weren't really marinated and the peppers had no flavor. At $4.75, alot more expense then other options and not a bad sandwich for that price just not the life changing bahn mi experience I'm seeking. The search continues.
author: John B.

description: Very friendly staff, and a cute little restaurant. I had the Crispy Tofu and some tofu rolls, both were very tasty and very reasonably priced. It's nice to have a cheap lunch spot in the Castro! I'll definitely go back.
author: Joshua Z.

description: I have eaten here 3 times and always scarf down my sandwich too fast. I have had better Vietnamese sandwiches. But these are good and convenient to me. I really can't complain a bit. There is some outdoor seating and seldom is it too busy.
author: Ben V.

description: I just had the most amazing sandwich!! I had the crispy tofu. It was slightly spicy and crunchy on perfectly toasted bread. The pickled daikon and carrot was so good, I could have eaten a whole bowl of it. And it was under $5. I'll certainly be going back!
author: melissa d.

description: The shredded taro and tofu mix in the tofu banh mi makes for an interesting rendition. I thought it was pretty tasty! and the price isn't too bad given the location of the shop.
author: Suzi T.

description: YUM. Great sandwich, I had the pork. Excellent bread. Wish I had another right now...
author: jori m.

description: Finally had a chance to stop in and now that they are open till 10 I can pick up a quick sando on my way home as this place puts out a great banh mi   They make an awesome sliced pork which has a slight smokey flavor to it delicious!  They are a friendly neighborhood place worth checking out. Oh BTW a delicious pork banh mi is only $4.75!
author: Pat C.

description:
I literally DRIVE ACROSS the city, TO GET DINOSAURS!
--cheap
--clean
--fresh, yummy ingredients
--friendly staff

This place has the best bahn mi's.  I've always asked for 'extra' jalapenos, meat, pate..and the workers always put a hefty portion of whatever I ask for - and NEVER charge more!

THis place is addicting - forget about IKE's down the street.  The line for IKE's is too long, and the sandwichs rarely mesh well with your digestive system.  COME TO DINOSAURS INSTEAD - it's really a hidden gem in the city.
author: A Z.

description: Best and cheapest sandwich deal in the city. Love the pork special. $4.75 for two handfuls of food love.
author: Ramin R.

description: There's no other place like Dinosaurs! At Dinosaurs, you can get a delicious sandwich for $5. Can't beat that! As someone who's eaten Vietnamese food growing up, I can say Dinosaurs sandwiches are among the best Vietnamese sandwiches I've eaten.
author: Shirley D.

description: Really good sandwiches, prompt service.  It is a bit hard to find though - easier to enter on 16th and not Market, even though the address is on Market
author: Noreen F.

description: I've been here several times because it's the closest quick food place to my house. The sandwiches are pretty delicious and a good price, and I definitely recommend getting a bag of dried peas on the side (like wasabi peas but covered in a mild, neutral tasting crunchy coating). The sandwiches feel a bit greasy, though, (fatty pork, fried tofu, creamy mayo) and I always end up feeling kind of gross afterwards.
author: Caitlin J.

description: Friggin' LOVE this place! Best Vietnamese sandwiches around! Great prices too! The Special Roast Pork with Pork Pate is my fave but I also love the Pork Meatball!!! So happy you are just 100 steps away! :D
author: Jim S.

description: I'd go back. The tuna was pretty good. The atmosphere is kinda lacking- -minus the pinball machine that adorns the far corner... now that is a cool twist. The service has potential and feels like a go-getter, new entrepreneurial startup restaurant. The thing I can't stop thinking about is how saigon sandwiches does it for $3 instead of $4.50 and the sandwiches taste better... granted, this place actually has seats and a pinball machine and it isn't in the heart of the TL, but I'm wanting to see more out of it. I'd like to see them differentiate a bit and get creative with their stuff... bc I can imagine, the guys behind the counter are cooler than 5 sandwich choices. They are in the castro/delores area - we want some new stuff brothers. Make it happen.
author: Jordan S.

description: Awsome sandwich`s !! I alway`s get the "pork"..  The price is perfect and serving is great too..  AND the staff is very friendly.   SURE BEATS IKE`S..
author: Jack O.

description: I love their Crispy Tofu Banh Mi!  Dinosaurs excels in freshness, taste and consistency.  I keep on coming back for more, and I am never disappointed.
author: Lisa T.

description: I fucking love this place! I went there twice in one day. Truley amazing food. I highly recomend this to anyone who loves Vietnamese sandwiches. What, with Ike's just down the block, with the hour long wait and the no table, sit in the gutter ambiance. Hell No! This is where smart people get their lunch.
author: Gabe T.

description: We tried this great Vietnamese sandwich place in Castro. There was only one guy working so you might have to wait a bit, but it was worth the wait. There's only a few tables inside and outside, so it's probably better to take your sandwich to go. We ended up taking them to enjoy at the Golden Gate Bridge. The sandwiches were delicious! We had the special sandwich, the chicken sandwich, and the spicy tuna sandwich. My favorite was the special.
author: Jerod Y.

description: Guys, get a sign out there on Market Street cuz a whole lot of people are missing out on a real treat.  I recently went here to redeem a couple of Groupons my wife purchased and am glad I thought to call them cuz the address on the Groupon said 2275 Market.  You actually can walk in on 18th Street and you are right there or you can navigate a little mini mall and discover them in the rear.  Once I arrived I asked the counter person if I could redeem both coupons on one visit and he said that technically I couldn't.  I then asked it I could order two, leave, walk to the corner, come back, get in line and order two more.  He said that would work so I went for it.  I tipped on each order and he very graciously thanked me for understanding, that guy gets a star just for that touch.  As for the sandwiches, I am a vegetarian so I went with the crispy tofu and also the portobello and they were great.  Perfectly crunchy rolls, lots of fresh ingredients and a healthy dose of peppers that achieved a near perfect blend of spicy tanginess.  I also ordered the advocado shake on a whim and I will be back for that in no time.  Jamba Juice be damned all Dino's advocado version needed was a protein boost and I would be good to go.  I also loved the color and texture of the shake.  I do have one minor complaint, I drank this baby on my drive home and the multiple brain freezes could have caused a serious pile up.  You may want to chill on one of their outdoor tables before operating heavy machinery when drinking one of these.
author: Ralph S.

description: it might have been because I skipped the mayo, but my sandwiches were a little on the bland side and I found the crispy tofu sandwich that everyone raves about to be lackluster.  Kudos for the Jurassic Park pinball machine though!
author: Toby C.

description: I really like their meatball ban mi, but last week when I went in they were out of meatballs. Another customer suggested I try his favorite, the Pork ban mi, so I did. It was very tasty. The sandwiches here are a bit on the small side, and I could really ate 1.5 - 2 per visit. So next time I plan to get the meatball and the pork sandwiches.  The prices are great and the workers are very friendly.  They have cool dinosaur/monster art on the walls, but otherwise the dining area is rather dull.  I like this place, but often forget that it's here, as it's hidden behind Bagdad.
author: Herschell L.

description: Where is the meat?!! I'm disappointed. Flavor's still good but the amount of chicken/ pork has been significantly reduced.. :(
author: Dr.Quinn L.

description:
It's all about the meatball!

I have tried a lot of banh mi sandwich places in SF, and this is, without a doubt, the tastiest.  I tried the meatball sandwich on a whim, it is not the usual kind of thing I would order, and have never looked back.  The meatballs are savory and juicy, the veggies are crisp and fresh, there is a good balance of bread-to-stuffing.

I ordered 100 sandwiches for a workshop for college students over the summer, and Dinosaurs agreed to take the order, delivered them for free, and the sammies were devoured!  All good!

The shop is a bit of a strange little place, but it is not a place you go for ambiance.  It is a place you go for excellent service, a clean place to sit, and a delicious banh mi! (And they do have tables outside, on their nice, quiet street---it's a great place to sit on a nice weekend afternoon.)
author: Liz L.

description:
LOVE this place!  
My business is nearby, so I visit them several times a week and their stuff is fantastic!
perfect amount of spice and toppings...salivating just writing about it. Honestly.
Check them out  if you haven't already!
author: Alex S.

description: I love this place.. inexpensive, good food consistently...and that sleeve tattoo makes me swoon.
author: Rob B.

description: Delicious. Go for the special. I hate when they run out of spring rolls though.
author: Phillip O.

description: Some places toast the baguette for so long that when I try to eat the sandwich it actually scratches the side of my mouth.  But not here.  I am a fan of the chicken sandwich, perfect amount of meat and pickled carrots, but I wouldn't mind having a few more sprigs of cilantro thrown in there.  It's definitely better than having to pay almost $6 for a sandwich in the peninsula, but it still doesn't beat the $3 sandwiches I get from San Jose!
author: Sally Q.

description: This was the first time I've ever tried a Vietnamese sandwich. I went here for lunch and I ordered the spicy tuna sandwich. It was pretty good. Tuna and the veggies tasted fresh. The sandwich looked kinda small when I got it, but it was pretty filling. They don't have many options though, although that might be a good thing. All the sandwiches where less than five dollars, and they had a pretty decent assortment of drinks. Its def more of a lunch place... I would probably order two for dinner.
author: Jason L.

description: The Crispy Tofu and Spicy Tuna sandwiches are soooooo good.   Fresh cilantro...oh yeah!   Better than Ike's...I live in the Castro and am equidistant to both places and I normally will find myself at Dinosaurs.
author: John B.

description:
When it's hot out and you want a quick bite, banh mis definitely do the trick. SO glad that this is in my neighborhood now! The sandwiches were what I'd expect, I got the special because it sounded most like what I wanted out of my banh mi. The bread was great, the ingredients were definitely fresh, but the flavors of the mayo and the meat were maybe not as sweet/salty as I'm used to (more on the salty end of the spectrum). Still good though.
The fact that they have grass jelly and coconut drinks to accompany just makes my days in the Mission even better.
The evening I went the sandwiches took quite a while to be made, though, maybe a good twenty minutes or so during the heat wave in November; I'm used to Lee's where it comes out instantly like magic, but I think what it came down to was a severely under-staffed store. There was a large group order ahead of us, and there was only one person manning the entire store: the kitchen, the register, everything! Poor guy, he must have been exhausted! They need to help this guy out!!! Rooting for you Dinosaur!
As this is one of the few banh mi places in the neighborhood, and probably the tastiest and cleanest, I understand the prices can be a little more expensive but I do wish they were more competitively marked as they are in the South Bay where you can get banh mi for $2.50, maybe $3, but $4.75...? I was a little meh-ed by it, but not worth making a huge ruckus about (I mean, it's still a satisfying under $5 meal) but it is what it is, a comparatively more expensive place.
Overall it was a good experience, I'm just glad there's an injection of this food-type into the neighborhood, but I'll admit it's not necessarily my favorite banh mi spot. Maybe I'll always just be a Lee's kind of girl; but, I'm definitely willing to give this place another shot and I think being fairly new, there's room for improvement so I'm conservatively rating it at a 3-star!
Dinosaurs, rah!
author: Jessica L.

description: Sandwiches were delicious. Service was great! Nice "homey" feeling. Had "The Chicken" for lunch and came back hours later for "The Special." Can't wait to try some more
author: Jazzbuh S.

description: I came back and ordered the chicken sandwich, no cilantro and carrots. It was delicious! The bread was soft with a nice outer crunch and the cucumber and peppers made it much better. I just wished the sandwich was bigger...
author: Freckles H.

description: everything i've tried here is delicious! i come here once a week, and it is consistantly awesome. everyone who works here is super nice, and the sandwiches are fresh and so so tasty. aaaand watermelon litchi slushy not to be missed!
author: beesknee s.

description:
Who would've thought that a sandwich shop named Dinosaur's would end up becoming my go to spot every time I'm hungry!?

Me: " So, why is the place called Dinosaur's?"
AJ: "What do you look like when you're eating the sandwich?"
Me: "WHOAH! You're right!"

 So one day I walk into this shop called Dinosaur's, a little sandwich spot with a red exterior, hoping to have some great Vietnamese sandwiches (Banh Mi). Now, I'm initally from San Jose and there are a lot of amazing places to get some great vietnamese sandwiches. But  I believe Dinosaur's tops them all, in terms of the service, the people, and most of all their sandwiches.

I LOOOOOOOOOOVE Dinosaurs. and I come here as many times as I can in order to get my sandwich fix because any other sandwich places doesn't taste quite as good. It is a healthy alternative to the mess you get at some other sandwich spots. You can literally taste the freshness of the sandwich. The bread has a great crispness to it (unlike getting soggy breads at other places) and all of the meats have a very specific flavor that hits at different moments of the "eating process." I can't necessarily describe it other than that it is definitely something that has to be experienced.  Everything on their menu is fresh with tastes that will tickle and embrace your taste buds. The menu is inventive yet traditional to Banh Mi and really constructs a great base to expand their business. (They're in the process of having a little fridge area where there is going to be the traditional spring rolls and other vietnamese staples you see at Banh Mi sandwich shops)

I try to take new people here each and every time that I go (almost every Sunday and the occasional weekday) and every person that I've taken has always thanked me for taking them and comes back either on their own, or tells me that they want to go back and get more.
