Once you've had the sandwiches you become addicted. No joke.

Also, the people who have made this place happen are probably the most chill people you would ever meet. Don't be afraid to say what's up to Chris and AJ whenever they're working because they can strike up a conversation with you on anything and are very friendly.

The sandwich that I recommend is the BIG BANG (You would have to ask for it, it's a "secret", which is pretty much everything on the menu). However, don't be intimidated because the way that AJ makes it is very well balanced and will hit your taste buds in all the right places. Wash it down with a coconut juice and your taste buds will thank you! 

DEFINITELY SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT THIS PLACE! They deserve it! and tip well!
author: Jonathan M.

description: The sandwiches are AMAZING.  They're a little on the small side, but the taste makes up for it.  Also, the guy behind the counter is a BABE.  I recommend getting the Chicken with Tofu.
author: Heather O.

description:
Thumbs up for the lemon grass pork sandwich. The flavor is good, like the heat, crisp of the bread. 

Not a fan of the spring roll. Flavor lacking in the sauce and the roll.

 I will return for the sandwich and I wanna try other things on the menu.
author: Diana H.

description: prices have gone up.  got the Special: roasted pork, fancy pork loaf, pate and even at the end of the day, the toasted crunchy bread was still pretty good.  roast pork not quite as flavorful but pate good (might need to avoid the smell)  not the level of the oakland, san jose banh mi with the pickling,etc but good enough.
author: Rob C.

description:
the good:
- location!
- good portion of meat and veggies
- quality marinated meat (i've had only the chicken so far)
- hi-chew, pocky and other asian snacks and drinks sold there
- spacious spot to dine in

the bad:
- a tad too much veganaise (it's watery too so sandwich drips as you eat it)
- soy sauce flavoring is a bit overwhelming so it's pretty salty overall

to be honest, i wasn't expecting much from a vietnamese sandwich place in the castro but man was i impressed. i live so close and love the option to have a decent vietnamese sandwich without traveling across the city. i would be extremely sad if this place goes away. give it some love!
author: elsie k.

description: i LOOOVE their pork sandwich!!  i've tried maaany viet sandwiches before but hands down, dinosaurs has the yummmmmiest viet pork sandwich everrr :)  haha
author: Kathy T.

description: So i was trying to find the sushi place i guess next to dinosaurs and i met the guy that runs this place, chris.  Sushi was apparently closed that day and he was like hey! you should check out my vietnamese sandwich shop.  Of course, me being vietnamese could not back down; and im glad i didnt! Dinosaurs have some great vietnamese sandwiches.  Its kind of small for a sandwich but the flavor makes up for it! Definitely worth to try if you havent yet.
author: Logan T.

description: I had to write a review because for the first time since I started going to Dinosaurs, my experience was way below average. I first asked if I could place my order, go to the ATM to get money, and then come back to pay and pick up my order and the young lady there said she didnt' know?! Um... what do you mean you don't know?! You can either answer yes, or no. On top of that when I got to eat my pork sandwich for lunch, I got a sliver of pork!!! You could hardly see the piece of meat in the sandwich! VERY DISAPPOINTING!!! I don't want to pay almost $5 for a sliver of meat!!! In all fairness though, these guys aren't normally like this. I was just very disappointed in my service this morning!
author: Sisounthone S.

description: umm yum? A friend and I wandered in her after a sunday brunch at lime on the way home because she wanted a sandwich (to take home, we were really full) and I needed to use a rest room.  She kept telling me how vietnamese sandwiches were the bomb so I decided to order one too.  I got the tofu because I was a tad skeptical about meat from a place that seems like a hole in the wall (I am very picky about meat) and I took it home.  Fast forward three hours and I am waking up from a quick nap with a fatty hang over and the sandwich that I almost forgot about is calling to me.  One bite and I fell in love.  SO TASTY!  I dont know what they did but there was sooooo much flavor bursting from this sandwich.  Every time im in the castro now I have to go and order two sandwiches to take home so I have one for that day and one for later!
author: Evan O.

description: Dinosaurs is now serving Vietnamese Iced French Coffee.........it will give you a good pick-up...time to go shopping.  Thanks Chris
author: Ricky B.

description:
This place is so good.
I love the pork sandwich so much that living around the corner has become an issue =) I love that I can call in and order to go so my sandwich is ready to go when I get there.
Oh, order "double meat", it's even better.
author: F C.

description:
yum! banh mi in the castro...and all without the hassle of stepping over bums in the tenderloin. 

the boy and i each ordered the cold cut (aka 'combo #1' at any other banh mi shop) consisting of pork loaf, pork terrine, and pate with a smathering of mayo and then stuffed to the brim with pickled daikon and carrots on a crispy, chewy french baguette. 

it's a standard banh mi flavor-wise, but the fresh deliciousness factor is amplified by the ambiance of super bright interior, big sunny window, and the non-sequitur t-rex watching over you.  3 subs and 2 chilled drinks set us back $16. 

and really, this sandwich tastes even better when you're passing those hungry onlookers at ike's on the way in...and on the way out.
author: Jenn S.

description: I came here the other day w/ a friend of mine, who like me, is always on the hunt for banh mi.  I tried the special which is pate, pork and something else w/ the usual fixings and it was good.  It's hard to match Saigon Sandwiches in both taste & price but this place came close.  The person behind the counter said it's called Dinosaurs bc the owner thinks when people eat banh mi, they hold their sandwich as if they were a t-rex.  I find this amusing and liked the dino-related artwork.  I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Suzanne V.

description:
Went to Dinosaurs on a weekday lunch hour

- $4.75 for all options on the menu, which is a tad more expensive than the other banh mi shops in SF (around 3.50/3.75) 
- The size is also a tad smaller than the average, but it is well-stuffed with daiko and carrot. 
- I ordered the Special Pork, which tasted like Cha Siu.  There was a good portion of meat and pate, and both tasted alright.  Maybe they don't have it on the menu but I wanted to carmelized pork meat on a banh mi. 
- Overall, it was okay and acceptable because it's probably the one of few Vietnamese food shops in the area, but there is definitely better one in the city if you're looking for an authentic banh mi.
author: S c.

description: Love banh mis.  Not the best, but pretty good and super convenient.
author: beverly l.

description: Went on a Sunday at noon the service was fast and friendly. Got the grilled lemongrass chicken sandwich. Taste was great, the french bread had a nice crunch and was very fresh, so were the veggies (pickled carrots and daikon radish, cucumbers, cilantro, jalapenos). The sandwich was 6", packed full and was very filling for me. Only $4.75 tax included, eat in or take out. I will be back to try their other sandwiches, spring rolls and steamed buns. A great find in the Castro.
author: Bill B.

description: Very friendly, open late (10 pm). Tasty sandwiches (I'm vegetarian and had the tofu one - - very flavorful, get it with extra veggies, no extra charge, and I'd get it with extra spread next time). Really sweet, friendly people who offer friendly, genuine chat while working. Very modest folks, very different from the pretentious Ike's across the street. Great prices, under $5. Big, generous servings.
author: Ice Cream Truck I.

description: i enjoyed my tuna banh mi sandwich here :)
author: Jenn L.

description: Love the crispy tofu - delicious!
author: Benjamin B.

description: This place isn't bad.  They have one option for vegetarian and it tastes good, and is only like $4, but it doesn't fill you up.  You really need 2 subs, but then that's $8.  It's ok, but you can skip it.
author: Jonathan U.

description:
good good good. 

just had lunch here today and it was tasty. i've been craving this foreeeeever! yum.
author: Art A.

description:
I haven't tried Ike's and as far as sandwiches are concerned, I don't want to even bother with the lines, it feels like it's all hype and a trendy spot to go, what evs, I'm not going to waste my life standing in line only to become disappointed. So I passed by this little vietnamese sandwich joint close to Ike's, I thought, wow, this is sure gutsy for another sammy place to be such close proximity of the Ike's hype. I have to concur with the comment on the price of a sandwich in the Castro, $4.50, it's a great price and a good little spot for a snack such as a vietnamese sammy. Light, the bread is airy, the meat is tasty and the other fillings are tasty as well. I think there is room for improvement on the bread and the fillings such as just a tad more of it. 
The people who worked there were great, they were super nice and that makes a big difference. I'm sorry but if I was waiting in line for a sammy at Ike's and there was some stranger that got in the front of the line just because they knew the owner or the person making the sammies, wtf, I would walk away from that shit. Just inconsiderate for that to happen, especially if I was famished. Perhaps it was a good idea to open this place up so close so that people like me would discover it and get hooked. Thanks for the option, Dinosaur.
author: Natasha C.

description: It is AMAZING! Just moved here from NYC and Dinosaurs has hands down the BEST Vietnamese sandwiches I've ever eaten. I'm completely addicted. GO NOW!
author: Scott L.

description: Great Vietnamese Sandwich.  My BF had the meatball sandwich and it was equally good, maybe better.  Prices are very cheap and the guy who runs it seems very nice.  I'm definitely coming back, one of my new favorite sandwich places in SF.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Yum! Good Vietnamese sandwiches, reasonable prices, and a veggie option to boot. 

 The bread is fresh and delicious, the tofu/taro combo (in the tofu version) plays well with the pickled carrots and radish. 

 They have coupons as an added bonus! Had a buy one get one free -- lunch for two (including drinks) was $7. Can't beat that!
author: C M.

description: This place is amazing. Great service, pleasant atmosphere, and excellent food. Cheap, tasty, healthy, delicious! What more could you ask for? This restaurant brought me out of the depths of yelp and motivated me to review it. You've just gotta try these delicious sandwiches. I'll definitely be coming back here whenever i can
author: Bishop J.

description: I appreciate that, aside from Kasa, they're pretty much the only $5 lunch option in the Castro (and their portion size is more reasonable than Kasa's single kati roll). I actually like their Bahn mi better than Saigon, which always seems to be dripping in some sticky soy sauce concoction, but I prefer the BBQ Pork at Two Tarts or, even better, the offerings from the Lil Green Cyclo food truck. Dinosaurs also has very friendly young staff who seem genuinely nice, which is impressive considering I'm sure they're no stranger to the entitled attitudes of many men who populate the neighborhood.
author: Paco Q.

description: My local Vietnamese sandwich shop...in the castro! Very simple menu but with some unique additions. The guys in there are always friendly and it's very reasonably priced. I like to get the combo sandwich-- crispy tofu and chicken. The bread is soft and crunchy and the chicken is juicy enough. I eat here about once a week-- love it so much!
author: Keegan M.

description:
Delicious grilled pork banh mi. Chicken is not as flavorful and crispy as the pork (maybe that is because it is grilled in larger chunks?)

Solid sandwhich with nice collection of asian juice and tea boxes, as well as pulp coconut water to wash lunch down with. 

Check it out!
author: julia k.

description: Great sandwiches iv known Chris for some time now and hes always done me right. good location, good people working, and good food. i liked the chicken a lot. but ill try the tofu next time. keep up the good work guys!
author: T L.

description:
this place is awesome!!! 

they're def. on par with saigon sandwich. (and i love saigon sandwich!) there's aspects of from each that I like better than the other so let's just call it a draw ...

the guys running the place are friendly. 

my tips to make it  better: maybe use a tad more fillings so the filling to bread ratio is just a little better and learn the assembly line production method the ladies at saigon sandwich use. they knock those things out quick.

you definitely have to check these guys out. they have a stamp card, after 9 sandwiches the 10th is free!
author: Ken B.

description: We love banh mi's and have had them from many different spots in SF. This place is the best we've found. Rolls are super fresh and crunchy crusted. Ingredients seem to be top quality and both the chicken and pork have great flavoring.
author: Bob C.

description: Another trip resulted in even a better sandwich this time and faster service. Chicken cutlet was tasty and hit the spot. Service was speedy too. Love this place for great sandwiches and the right prices.
author: Jim H.

description:
5 stars for proximity

5 stars for staff

4 stars for food

Makes every Saturday morning that much better.  

Not OG, but pretty darn good.
author: John K.

description: I had the crispy tofu sandwich here one rainy afternoon, and it was delicious.  The bread was perfect, the tofu and the other stuff in the sandwich were full of flavor and texture.  I will definitely be back.  The 4 stars are on account of the lack of any ambience - the shop could use something ... I'm not sure what - but it needs little something to give it some character or something.  Anyhow, the food and service were great.
author: Heather C.

description:
Why wait in line at Ike's for an overpriced messy sandwich and no place to eat it when you can come here?

6 types of sandwiches under $5, steamed buns, fresh rolls, large selection of beverages and asian snacks.

Will be back.
author: Derek I.

description: This Vietnamese Sandwich place is delicious.. i will i had the chicken sandwich it was the best ... Great services and great sandwich i had..
author: Wilson W.

description: This place is great, way better then Ikes and everything is less then 5 dollars, thats half the price.  No line to wait in, friendly people.  Don't give your money to ike, he is short and cocky.  Come on over and buy 2 sandwiches for the same price as one, in less then 5 minutes and imo much better.  Try the crispy tofu! the others are great as well.
author: Cornelious B.

description: LOVE the crispy tofu sandwich. It always tastes fresh and yummy.  Perfect size and perfect price. I love Ike's, but instead of waiting 2 hours and paying 10+ bucks for a good sando, I can get a very good one for $4.50 in about 5 minutes a few doors up! Very nice service, I always feel welcome and enjoy going back again and again.
author: Sara G.

description: Great sandwich for a great price, especially in the overpriced Castro area. Forget overpriced IKE's with their ridiculous wait!  Run don't walk. Yummy!
author: RED L.

description:
I walked hungry out of the Eureka Valley branch of the SFPL and noticed a place called "DINOSAURS Vietnamese Sandwiches" across the street.  Bemused, I crossed, ordered, and sat down.

So glad I went in.  REALLY cheap, REALLY good.  I got the Special, with multiple layered pork products and lemony crisp carrots and peppers.  Really hit the spot.  I'm gonna make it part of all my library jaunts.
author: Flapjacks M.

description: i love this place , they are awesome , great food, cool location and everything fast and fresh ! thank you ! I love your shrimp papaya salad !
author: Angelica k.

description: combo banh mi is ok.  If you are craving banh mi and live in the neighborhood and too lazy to go down to clement/irving street, this is a decent alternative considering the lack of other choices around.
author: LT B.

description: Friendly staff serving made to order Vietnamese sandwiches - the only ones you are going to find in this area, but even by other neighborhood's standards these are pretty good.  As others have mentioned, the bread is a notch above the usual, and the vegetarian tofu sandwich is really crispy and tasty; no bland tofu slabs here. Cheaper than the other sandwich shop down the street and no crazy lines either = double win.
author: saru k.

description: yum!  the crispy tofu was delicious and spicy and cheap and fast...just a tiny bit dry.  that's all i can review because the rest of the menu is meat but it's not crowded and the staff was really nice and i'll definitely be back.
author: kate s.

description: Tasty banh mi in the Castro?  Can hardly believe it.  Nice prices too.  Yay!  I likey.
author: Joseph S.

description: Great lil' place in the neighborhood, to grab a quick, delicious lunch.  The sandwiches are fresh, and tasty, the spring rolls are great as well.  The guys that work here are friendly and welcoming.  With a lot of choices in the Castro to grab a quick bite to eat, they do it right.
author: Tony K.

description: I just had an amazing pork sandwich for $4.50 (#2 on the menu). I am not a banh mi expert, but this is without question the best I've had. Fresh daikon, a modest amount of nicely flavored pork with no traces of gristle or chewiness, and a good bit of cilantro, mayo and jalapeño to round out the flavor. Great bread as well. What's not to like?
author: Matt B.

description: great banh mi. cost was $4 something but I didn't mind. meat had good flavor and the bread was crunchy. Probably a top 2 or 3 banh mi for me, maybe tied for the best.
author: J A.

description: So yummy! I ordered The Special - it was really good. Although the bread was a little bit stale to me (didn't really mind though), but my friend insists that it was just "crispy." Also, they don't have water, which is weird. Overall though, I was pleasantly surprised with the food :)
author: Melissa P.

description: Had the Special with roasted pork, fancy pork loaf and pate. Decent sandwich. Roast pork was unseasoned and not roasted, but other flavors balanced well. Knock a star or two off for refusing to serve tap water. I mean, really...
author: Bernie S.

description: when i lived in the richmond i could walk half a block up the street and get a $3 bahn mi any time i wanted.  so i'm happy to have a place near my house that satisfies my bahn mi cravings.  their menu is a little limited but i've had everything and its all really fresh and good.
author: bucky c.

description: Excellent.  Cheap.  Vegetarian tofu sandwich is great.  $4.75
author: Brian W.

description: Good and the price is right...love the bread.  The Special and the meatball are great.
author: Chris S.

description: At last, Vietnamese sandwiches in the Castro!  Decent prices--under $5.  Fresh and tasty.  I disagree with the review below; I get the pork and find it good quality and *not* fatty.  They put more on their sandwiches than some other places (e.g., cucumber, radish, soy sauce) and offer vegennaise.  Fresh bread.  I wish the rolls were a bit bigger, but I am a bigger eater than most.   :-)
author: michael m.

description: love the bread, love the special, spring rolls are ok. they've done a scoutmob deal twice already so the deal is even better.
author: Lia A.
